job description

Saks OFF 5TH is the premier luxury off-price destination. In its more than 100 stores in the U.S. and Canada, and online, at SaksOFF5TH.com, the company provides the best names in fashion at an incredible value through its merchandise authority, unparalleled brand access and seamless connection between ecommerce and stores.

What This Position Is All About:

Saks OFF 5TH is the premier luxury off-price destination. In its more than 100 stores in the U.S. and Canada and online, at SaksOFF5TH.com, the company provides the best names in fashion at an incredible value through its merchandise authority, unparalleled brand access, and seamless connection between e-commerce and stores.


As an Analyst of Store Operations, you will support the corporate Stores team in analyzing data related to operational processes, store procurement, and facilities. Procurement analysis could include a review of data for Utilities, Energy and Facilities across Saks OFF 5TH, as well as the procurement of supplies critical to Business Operations. Data collection and analysis will be utilized in contract negotiations with vendor partners and in business decisions that benefit the company. Monitoring and forecasting of industry and macroeconomic trends will be utilized to anticipate company needs. The Analyst of Store Operations is a key point of contact in managing relationships with internal and external partners, inclusive of ensuring accounts payables are properly reconciled. Working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, this is a significant opportunity to help drive improvement to the company’s bottom line and to interface with leaders across the enterprise while building a solid procurement foundation for future growth with a lens toward sustainability.

Who Are You:

Ability to learn and demonstrate expertise in categories quickly while prioritizing multiple projects & tasks to deliver results

Experience in working both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment is essential

Eager to embrace and support change, ability to manage in an ambiguous environment


You Also Have:

Minimum 2+ years of professional experience in Store Operations, Data analysis or strategic sourcing/procurement, supply chain management, or management consulting.

Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited four-year college or university (preferably in Supply Chain, Engineering, Business Management, or Finance)

Category expertise in multiple of the following categories: Facilities, Operations, Energy, Utilities (highly desired)

Strong analytical skills, innovative, interpersonal, client facing and presentation skills

Proficient in Microsoft Excel Word, PowerPoint, Visio experience & understanding is a plus

Advanced in contract development and supplier relationship management with a deep understanding of procurement and supply chain

Experience purchase to pay and procurement transformation, strategic sourcing, commodity management, supplier management, and contract management is not required but is a plus.


As The Analyst of Store Operations, you will:

Understanding the functional business; helping identify opportunities for process improvement, cost containment/avoidance, revenue generation, capital investment

Developing relationships with internal and external business stakeholders

Research market trends and leading practices to discover and execute cost savings initiatives

Prepare business cases to quantify savings and/or benefits of new initiatives

Project planning including timelines, deliverables, and stakeholder teams, etc.

Manage sourcing activities by preparing, issuing and evaluating bid and RFI/RFP requests. Develop optimization scenarios for awards.

Partner closely with the business stakeholders you support to identify and execute value generating opportunities

Explore process & continuous improvements across the procurement organization as well as within business and outline how to address (i.e., value-stream mapping)

Increasing Procurements spend under management, by building business relationships and identifying opportunities to leverage skill set to achieve company-wide goals

Ability to negotiate contract terms in order to ensure business requirements are being met, while reducing risk and increasing controls

About NYC Health + Hospitals

For more than 30 years, MetroPlusHealth has been committed to building strong relationships with its members and providers to enable New Yorkers to live their healthiest life.

Positon Overview

MetroPlusHealth is seeking an IT Business Analyst to join our team. We are looking for a professional with experience in healthcare business systems and analysis. The successful applicant will serve as the liaison between the executive/business areas and the IT department of MHP, leveraging the tools and processes developed and managed by the IT department, while analyzing and suggesting enhancements to technical systems, processes, and business models. The ideal candidate for this position is responsible, an excellent communicator, self-starting, detail-oriented, and highly innovative. The Stone Operations Analyst will support the creation and implementation of Key Performance Metrics across Industrial Stone Operations. This role will also lead and support high level projects for department growth and evolution across all stone categories, promoting standardization and alignment within processes with heightened focus to maximize process efficiency.

Key Accountabilities

Metrics & Analytics

Lead department implementation of reporting tools to support analytics across departments within and supporting stone operations
Develop reports to support key performance metrics and aid management in decision making
Ensure reporting demand is tracked, planned and implemented to meet vast evolution of the business
Identify trends within data to support project development for department growth
Monitor aging inventory for Laurelton, 3 rd Party & Tiffany Owned stones. Complete detailed analysis as well as balancing for transactions to ensure timely processing of all transitional inventory.
Understand the impact of JDE transactions for Diamond Division departments. Utilize reports to analyze, identify trends & opportunities for error reduction and enhancements in workflow.

Continuous Improvement

Manage end to end process documentation, gathering business requirements across varying departments within Industrial Stone Operations
Oversee initiatives specific to Industrial Stone Operations which overlap between stone departments, and which directly link to both short- and long-term Leadership goals
Create improvement plan, document milestones and liaison with key department leads for implementation.
Create value stream map specific to stone flow within the grading labs. Identify non-value add vs. value-add activities. Document potential opportunities and propose to cross-functional teams for buy-in and project evolution.

Compliance Management

Ensure understanding of compliance requirements for ERICA, CODC, and Audit Requirements.
Develop and maintain training material to educate staff on compliance requirements and process
Identify opportunities for increased controls to reduce risk. Create and document such proposed controls for Leadership approval.

Project Management

Liaison between IT and Stone Operations to support the development, business requirements and delivery of JDE projects.
Support the project oversight of Blue Book and HJ stones within the grading pipeline, challenging the status quo to achieve process optimization.
Oversee cycle count process, reporting and execution across both internal departments and Virtual Vendors.

Health, Safety and Corporate Policy Adherence

Work safely at all times by consistently following safe work procedures for your role, as well as all safety procedures required at your worksite. Demonstrate leadership by leading safety process checks & improvement projects in coordination with continuous improvement initiatives.

Required Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree
2+ years’ experience in supply chain, project management, analytics, or related field
Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to effectively interact with multiple levels of management within and outside immediate department
Must be creative, analytical and demonstrate problem solving skills
Excellent computer skills and advanced experience using MS Office
Experience using Power BI, DAS Reporting, JDE, Alteryx or other comparable reporting tools in supply chain environment
MS Office skills particularly using Excel, Power Point, Visio, and Word

Preferred Qualifications

MBA graduate or current student
Prior experience leading initiatives which require use of change management skills
Experience working in an environment that practices Six Sigma & Lean Concepts
Six Sigma/ Lean Green belt certification

As an FX Product Development Business Analyst, you will sit directly in Markets and be responsible for supporting our strategic InfoFX and emerging markets products. This includes leading InfoFX client onboards, supporting the implementation of new technology efforts, and providing day-to-day support internally to the Foreign Exchange trading desk and externally to our clients with respect to InfoFX and our Custody FX services.

This role partners directly with our New Business Development team as a subject matter expert on InfoFX and related matters during the sale process. Once a client is committed, the FX Product Development Business Analyst will assist with the onboarding of the client onto our products. This includes integration with the client’s systems, coordinating documentation with legal, and instructing our back office to open and setup accounts. Once the client is live, this analyst will remain involved in the relationship moving forward and will liaise with our FX desk to help participate in client meetings, provide day to day support and help manage their FX program.

The FX Product Development Business Analyst will also help lead and support our emerging markets InfoFX and Custody FX business. This includes researching and responding to emerging market FX related inquiries from our global client base and internal BBH teams. As well as participate in client or sales discussions and presentations as they pertain to our emerging market suite of FX products. The individual will help to support BBH FX’s relationships with our contacts in local markets (i.e. FX counterparties, subcustodians).

Since this role will be expected to partner across many internal teams, (Relationship Management, Trading, Sales, Technology, Documentation, Investment Operations, Service Delivery and Custody), as well as supporting clients directly, we are searching for a candidate with strong communication and an interest in building relationships. The ideal candidate will also have a strong interest for Foreign Exchange and Technology.
Key responsibilities include:
Info FX Implementation, Onboarding:
Operate as the client’s FX subject matter expert during implementations.
Research and analyze the impact of market changes to BBH clients.
Assist in the identification of process improvements to lower costs and improve efficiencies.
Leverage expertise from other BBH lines of business
Document procedures, opportunities, best practices, project goals and workflows.
Client Service/Relationship Management
Build and maintain relationships at all levels, both within and outside the organization
Assess and provide solutions for clients, acting as a key point of contact for enhancement requests and escalated onboarding and production issues.
Participate in relationship meetings to communicate InfoFX product strategy to clients.
Emerging Markets
Research and respond to emerging market FX related inquiries from global client base and internal BBH teams.
Participate in client sales discussions and presentations as they pertain to our emerging market suite of FX products.
Utilize information from BBH FX relationship managers and FX clients to understand emerging market trading needs and changes in local market practices.
Design, create, and maintain detailed FX trading guides, including client case studies that highlight innovative and thoughtful trading solutions in restricted markets
Continually expand understanding of our industry concepts and market practices through responses to client queries, participation in departmental projects, and regular interaction with Operations, Treasury, Network and Trading functions.
Work with local market providers to support BBH FX’s operations in local markets.
Desired Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience required
5+ years of relevant work experience
Experience working in the financial services industry
Knowledge of BBH products, services and practices is a plus
General knowledge of the SWIFT platform and messaging is a plus
Strong business analysis skills, including business requirements, product proposals and business and technical workflows
Strong interpersonal and collaboration skills
Knowledge of international currency markets, including the impact of economic and political factors, a plus
Knowledge of foreign exchange trading instruments, a plus
Strong project management, problem solving and analytical skills
Strong organizational, consultative, and advisory skills
Knowledge of emerging trends in the industry
Ability to analyze and summarize complex business issues
Ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously, while meeting deadlines
Strong written and verbal communication skills, including presentations.

JOB SUMMARY:

The Senior Business Analyst leads the business requirements process on strategically important projects for the firm. This role with interact with project stakeholders and other subject matter experts to learn a business process, document detailed requirements, review with technical and non-technical resources on the team and ensure the execution of the project objectives aligns with the stakeholders needs.

This role will lead business requirements for technology-centered and process improvement projects. Technology projects will include the evaluation, selection and implementation of new systems, the development of custom in-house solutions and major improvements to existing products.

Process-improvement projects will involve definition and implementation of standardized processes along with defining efficiency improvements for existing processes.

The Senior Business Analyst will understand and promote key concepts and best practices relating to business analysis at the firm. This role will understand both waterfall and agile methodologies and be able to adapt the business requirements process to both methodologies.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Work with project stakeholders across the firm to understand, analyze and document business requirements for system implementations, enhancements, and process improvement projects.
Meet with business stakeholders and document business requirements, which can be translated into functional specifications, process flows and system design specifications.
Responsible for recognizing and communicating the downstream effects a system or process change will have on other areas of the business
Identifies and recommends alternative methods and technologies to meet business needs.
Documents detailed current state & future state business processes to drive productivity improvements.
Collaborate with project stakeholders and technical teams to deliver functional requirements.
Act as an interface between business units, technology teams and support teams.
Lead and perform quality assurance testing on certain projects, including the design and execution test scripts and test scenarios.
Ensures that issues identified during testing are tracked, reported, and resolved in a timely manner. Works with stakeholders to perform acceptance testing. Communicate needed changes to development team.
Establish and maintain processes, best practices, and metrics relating to business analysis.
Work closely with stakeholders and technical teams to determine success metrics for each project.
Provide basic project management functions for smaller projects and activities including but not limited to project scoping, planning and resource management.

EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS REQUIRED:

Bachelor's degree required
At least five years as lead business analyst on complex process-improvement and system implementations
Excellent verbal and written communication skills for both technical and non-technical audiences
Strong analytical, listening, interpersonal and problem-solving skills.
Ability to collaborate across support teams, contribute to a positive team spirit and earn the trust and confidence of co-workers.
Must be flexible to respond quickly and positively to shifting demands and opportunities; ability to work under tight deadlines and handle multiple, detailed tasks.
Proven ability to quickly learn a new business process and firm technology platforms
Experience with both waterfall and agile development methodologies.
Experience participating in multiple, complex projects and working with diverse teams in multiple locations

NY Comprehensive Total Rewards Package

Ropes & Gray is proud to offer a comprehensive Total Rewards package to our business support team members. The firm also offers comprehensive health and well-being benefits, personal and professional development, career growth opportunities and a collegial and supportive culture. Job Title: Business Analyst, Transformation and Analytics (Supply Chain) - PVH Corp
Job Description:
POSITION TITLE: Business Analyst, Transformation and Analytics Team

POSITION REPORTS TO (TITLE): Director, Supply Chain PMO

POSITION LOCATION: 285 Madison Ave

POSITION SUMMARY:

Be a part of PVH Supply Chain Analytics! This Transformation & Analytics team is passionate about powering a world-class, data-driven Supply Chain through exceptional data & analytics, driving impactful business decisions and insights. Supply Chain Data & Analytics play a critical role in unlocking transformational outcomes within our supply chain.

The Transformation and Analytics Team is a lean team within the corporate Supply Chain and is responsible for managing Data & Analytics, Tech Strategy and PMO/Project Management needs of the PVH Global Supply Chain. The goal of the PMO function is to outline PMO framework and Methodology and leverage it to define, execute and manage initiatives to help achieve strategic goals of PVH Supply Chain.

The Business Analyst role will be responsible for working closely with teams and stakeholders across PVH supply chain to define and gather business requirements for the global data and analytics platform. This individual will be responsible for translating business needs into functional requirements and work with product & engineering teams to deliver technical solutions aligned with business needs. Business Analyst will partner closely with product managers, product owners and product/technical teams to deliver product increments that include vital User Acceptance Testing (UAT), training, demos, and rollout of product solutions.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES/ACCOUNTABILITIES

Requirements & Product Roadmap

Partner with Product Owner and Product managers to understand product roadmap and vision and translate them into tangible requirements.

Responsible for collaborating with business teams and stakeholders to gather and document business/functional requirements with clarity and completeness that minimizes later rework.

Responsible for collaborating with business teams and stakeholders to capture and document Business process definition (both current and future state) for things owned by Global Supply.

Responsible for translating business/functional requirements into wireframes and functional specifications.

Bring structure to business requests and problems by breaking them down into business needs, what questions are being answered and how the solution ultimately solves that problem.

Leverage data and analysis techniques to solve business problems, drive value, and gain insight from information in a scalable, reproducible, and automated manner.

Translates requirements into an analytical product approach.

Functional & Business User Testing

Review and provide feedback to engineering teams on functional test scripts/scenarios.

Actively collaborate with engineering teams to validate solution(s) throughout each sprint and ensure they meet the business requirements.

Participate in end-of-sprint demos in partnership with product owner and product manager; facilitate and collate business feedback during the demos.

Coordinate with product owner, business stakeholders and end users on user acceptance testing strategy, planning, execution and tracking.

End to end delivery of advanced analytic solutions:

Understands and can contribute to discussions with business on analyses of large datasets (both structured and unstructured) to surface trends and insights using advanced analytics methods.

Prepares and delivers visualizations and internal presentations that translate analytic capabilities into tangible, actionable solutions for business partners to implement.

Liaison for systems related issues, requests, etc.

Communicate and work across business, product and engineering on all issues and needs.

Craft and deliver presentations on new capabilities and enhancements to assigned platforms.

INTERNAL & EXTERNAL CONTACTS

Internal Contacts:

Regional and corporate teams located in the US, Europe, Hong Kong and India

Supply leadership & direct report teams, PVH Technology team, Corporate Responsibility team

External Contacts:

Third party partners and service providers, as needed

DECISION MAKING

Provide recommendations and help teams to make decisions in a timely manner and escalate when necessary.

Utilize good communication and tactical skills to drive effective and efficient execution of projects.

Prioritize work and escalate issues as needed to meet timelines with high levels of quality.

RESOURCEFULNESS/CREATIVITY

Ability to build good working relationships; collaborates toward deadlines and deliverables.

Uses creativity in communication to clearly articulate written and visual messages; includes creative usage of Power Point to convey messages.

Trusted and respected resource as the “connector” to keep project teams on track.

Self-starter with a curious mind who proactively seeks out resources needed to be successful.

Ability to engage externally with industry groups and partners and represent PVH.

ENVIRONMENT:

Ability to work in a fast-paced, team-oriented setting with peers who are energized about building the future together.

Ability to work on multiple initiatives and adapt to evolving priorities with ease.

Ability to interface with stakeholders across multiple countries and cultures.

CORE VALUES

Embrace PVH's core values: Individuality, Partnership, Passion, Integrity, and Accountability.

QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE

Education & Experience:

University Degree

3-5 years’ experience working in a business analysis role.

3-5 years of business analysis experience in Fashion, Retail or CPG industries is preferred.

Experience in building strategic, impactful, business-driven insights from data.

Experience working in cross-functional teams delivering consumer analytics solutions or digital products using Agile methodologies.

Experience writing detailed user stories and creating and maintaining a product backlog.

Ability to work with & understand raw data, knowledge of preprocessing procedures and ability to prepare data for modeling.

Previous experience implementing data and advanced analytics platforms, capabilities & solutions.

Experience dealing with multiple stakeholders and balancing priorities against competing interests.

Familiarity/Experience with Project management tools such as Jira, Smartsheet, preferable.

Experience with data visualization software such as MicroStrategy, Power BI, Tableau etc., preferable.

Skills Required:

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Excellent written and verbal communications skills, and presentation skills (Powerpoint) – communicates effectively and at the right level based on the audience.

Cross functional coordination – coordinates input and participation from diverse set of business stakeholders.

Business Relationships – grows and strengthens relationships with business partners.

Knowledge of Agile process and principles as well as Waterfall project management.

Goal oriented and self-motivated within a collaborative team environment.

Demonstrated ability to understand and discuss technical concepts.

Agile methodology certifications, preferable.

Mini-Circuits designs, manufactures and distributes integrated circuits, modules, and sub-systems for high-performance radio frequency (RF) and microwave applications. With design, sales and manufacturing locations in over 30 countries, Mini-Circuits’ products are used in a range of wired and wireless communications applications. Our products are also used in detection, measurement and imaging applications, including military communication, guidance and electronic countermeasure systems, commercial, scientific, military land, sea and aircraft; automotive systems, medical systems, and industrial test equipment.

Mini-Circuits’ sells its products to over 20,000 customers globally through our direct sales force, applications engineering staff, sales representatives, as well as through our extensive website.

Position Summary:

The Financial Business Analyst role is an intensive position that allows the employee to see across many different departments and entities at Mini-Circuits (MCL). You will work with people at all levels of MCL and learn how to navigate the corporate environment to understand how to provide Finance, Sales, and Engineering partners with the support they need to meet to better understand their business.

Your primary responsibilities will be to support the Business Unit Financial Partner (BUFP), Director of Finance, and the Business Unit Cost Center Owners in performing analysis to better understand the current state of the business and improve the decision-making process and forecast quality.

Salary Range: $76,000 - $114,000 per year

Job Function:

Roles:
Support BUFP & collaborate with the Business Unit Leader, Engineering and Marketing teams.
Analyze sales and financial reports to derive trends.
Prepare monthly and quarterly Sales and financial presentations.
Tasks:
Business Analysis
Prepare and publish monthly and quarterly expense reports and analyses with a focus on goal achievement for each BU cost center owner.
Prepare, analyze, and publish monthly (KPIs) to identify causes of unexpected variances.
Assist in benchmarking financial KPI and ad-hoc analysis related to the current business.
Prepare variance analysis for sales, P&L, Headcount, and CapEx.
Prepare Gross margin analysis including impact from sales price variance, product mix, and volume.
Planning:
Assist the Cost Center Manager during the budgeting and forecasting cycle.
Assist Business unit Partners in meeting planning calendar deadlines.
Other:
Lead and support special projects, miscellaneous financial analysis, and other financial initiatives.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in finance or accounting.
3 years of FP&A and 2-3 years of finance and accounting experience.
Strong MS Office skills, especially Excel (2 years of everyday experience).
Strong grasp of business finances.
Demonstrate good personal judgment, and effectively handle tasks under pressure.
Track records to develop strong relationships, influence thinking, and drive consensus among a wide range of stakeholders.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills needed Ability to operate comfortably, independently, and effectively in a fast-paced, highly cross-functional, rapidly changing environment.
Positive attitude and excitement to contribute and grow!
Familiarity with financial reporting and planning tools is strongly preferred.
Good analysis and problem-solving skills to address the differing issues presented by the customer as well as the business.
Discretion to deal with confidential information.

About NYC Health + Hospitals



NYC Health + Hospitals/Bellevue is America’s oldest public hospital, established in 1736. Affiliated with the NYU School of Medicine, the 844-bed hospital is a major referral center for highly complex cases, with its 6,000 employees including highly skilled, interdisciplinary clinical staff. It sees more than 110,000 emergency room visits and 500,000 outpatient visits annually. Bellevue is an academic medical institution of international renown. We have served as an incubator for major innovations in public health, medical science, and medical education. Bellevue is a Level I Trauma Center delivering around-the-clock care in adult, pediatric, psychiatric and pediatric psychiatric emergencies as well as in the nationally-designated categories of cardiology, neurology, toxicology, and neonatology. In addition to providing comprehensive inpatient and outpatient state-of-the-art care Bellevue is a city-wide medical specialty referral source. Bellevue’s clinical centers of excellence include: Emergency Medicine and Trauma Care; Cardiovascular Services; Designated Regional Perinatal Center and Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (ICU); Comprehensive Children’s Psychiatric Emergency Program; and Cancer Services.

At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.

Who We Are:

EmpiRx Health is a disruptor in an ever-changing healthcare industry, offering a market-differentiating, value-based pharmacy benefits management solution. We are bold and fearless in our approach to healthcare, how we talk about ourselves, and our use of advanced technology and analytics.

What We Do:

We partner with HR and Benefits managers nationwide to ensure our membership has access to the best pharmacy benefits available. We place more emphasis on member care than any other PBM by focusing on health outcomes first. Our pharmacists and clinicians are at the center of everything we do―and our population health solution delivers tailored strategies for our clients. Our pharmaceutical staff daily consults with physicians to drive the greatest clinical and financial outcomes.

Employee-Centric Culture:

At EmpiRx Health, our employees are our most valuable asset. We've earned recognition as an award-winning leader in healthcare by investing in our employees. Our leadership teams drive the employee experience with a strength-based learning and development approach. By leveraging Gallup's Clifton Strengths assessment, we empower our teams to excel and unleash their full potential. We've fostered an environment where every voice is heard and talents are nurtured. At EmpiRx Health, we celebrate groundbreaking ideas, encourage collaboration, and value open dialogue and continuous improvement.

Who We're Looking For:

EmpiRx Health is in unprecedented growth, and we're seeking a highly skilled and experienced Business Operations Analyst. In this critical role, you will coordinate activities for all aspects of client operations, including program implementation and ongoing maintenance, data issue escalation and resolution, and operational reporting and analytics. The ideal candidate will be analytically curious, detail-oriented, self-directed, and collaborative.

What You'll Do:

The Business Operations Analyst role will encompass a wide range of responsibilities:

Maintain a roadmap of all active projects with high-level timelines tracking project/portfolio performance metrics to monitor business value over time.
Generate thorough documentation, i.e., process mapping, detailed business requirements, and standardized operating protocols for all processes.
Investigate complex operations-related problems/inquiries and recommend, facilitate, and coordinate solutions to ensure processes are optimized and efficient.
Evaluate emerging IT developments, applications, and evolving business/systems requirements.
Implement diverse change management strategies to successfully launch new or updated processes.
Work closely with client management to analyze technology's current and future direction to meet business goals.
Design user-friendly training documents and programs that cater to varied learning styles, facilitating easy adoption and comprehension of processes.
Conduct ongoing training for team members.
Use data analytics to detect trends, thereby bringing to light potential areas for process enhancements to light.

What You Need:

A bachelor's degree with a minimum of 5 years experience in a healthcare setting.
Innate curiosity, analytical prowess, and a knack for problem-solving and/or strategic insight.
Must take initiative, be eager to execute ideas, and be solutions-oriented.
Comfort in and adaptability with a fast-paced, dynamic environment while maintaining focus on key goals.
Ability to operate independently in an environment with competing priorities.
Razor-sharp attention to detail and exceptional written and oral communication skills

Benefits and Perks:

Our commitment to diversity is reflected in our family benefits, which include:

Comprehensive medical, prescription, vision, dental, life, and disability insurance, with coverage for domestic partnerships.
A 401K program to secure your financial future.
Parental leave for childbirth and adoption.
Student loan reimbursement.
Additional perks include flexible PTO, hybrid and remote work arrangements, online wellness resources and counseling access, and bi-weekly "take a break" sessions.

Join EmpiRx Health, where we are transforming the healthcare landscape with innovation and unwavering commitment to our employees and members. Make a difference and grow with us!

Work Environment: Hybrid in Montvale, NJ.

EmpiRx Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer

At EmpiRx Health, we wholeheartedly embrace the power of diversity and the magic of inclusion. The kaleidoscope of unique perspectives, backgrounds, and talents fuels our innovation and sets us apart. We're on a mission to build a team as diverse as the world we serve, where everyone is welcome and celebrated. We're not just breaking down barriers; we're actively erasing them to create an environment where opportunity knows no bounds. In unity, we find our strength and invite individuals from all walks of life to join us in our exhilarating journey to shape a brighter, more inclusive future together.

The Enterprise Technologies Finance IT team, part of the broader CIO organization, is looking for a proactive and collaborative self-starter to support the team's mission to establish an outstanding Finance solution by supporting our existing NetSuite ERP implementation. You will interact with multiple team members across the organization and will be instrumental in furthering the team's mission. This role offers a unique opportunity to be a part of an evolving business systems team in a high-growth global organization. You will have the chance to create, build and implement standard methodology financial processes.

Understand and document business requirements; analyze existing and/or new information and applications; propose potential solutions; and implement selected technology solutions.

In alignment with SOX, ensure procedures, processes and accurate change controls are adhered to on all production changes and implementations.
Run root-functional root cause analysis where issues are noted and be the enterprise systems champion for prioritization and remediation.
Work closely with cross domain IT teams and business partners efforts to develop and test any cross team solutions.
Facilitate consistent adoption of best practices, policies, and standards.
Develop strong working relationships with your Enterprise Technologies and finance peers as well as across the wider Peloton teams.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

Minimum 5 years' hands-on experience in NetSuite ERP with knowledge of Order to Cash, Procure to Pay, Record to Report processes or 2 years hands-on experience with NetSuite working with multiple members and 5 years of experience in finance or accounting
Ability to navigate ambiguity, explore platform features and third party bundles, and advise on build vs buy for NetSuite solutions
Lead process and solution design sessions with stakeholders
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Deep analytical and critical thinking skills
Adept and proactive at problem-solving and conflict resolution
Excellent organization and time management skills
Ability to work well under pressure; handle tight deadlines and situations where conflicting priorities arise
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
Proficient in Excel

Preferred: Ability to build sophisticated SQL statements
Preferred: Retail experience
Preferred: Agile (SCRUM) experience
Preferred: Experience crafting and maintaining NetSuite workflows

AAC is seeking a Business Analyst for our growing client in Glen Rock, NJ, who can thrive in a scaling organization and can lead and drive business analysis. This is very much a hand’s on, broad role and will entail all aspects of the ROI for operations and directly contribute to the automation of several business systems, data collection, and more. As such candidates need to be comfortable working with multiple stakeholders over all aspects of the business. They will report directly to the Director of Data and Applications.

Recommend actions by analyzing and interpreting data and making comparative analyses

Strong IT skills including advanced use of Excel, Microsoft Word, and Power Point

The ability to tackle a problem by using a logical, systematic, sequential approach

The ability to demonstrate depth of knowledge and skill in accounting, financial management, business analysis

Experience with Web API, XML, or CSV type formats
Experience with Python, PowerShell, and VB script

Job Description
The Office of Human Resources (OHR) seeks a highly motivated individual to serve as a Business Operations Analyst. As Business Operations Analyst, the selected candidate will operate as a project manager and personnel records coordinator for OHR. The individual will facilitate the workflow processes across OHR business units and push projects through the appropriate channels to eliminate gaps and delays; and coordinate the request for OHR records and review of personnel folders. Reporting directly to the Chief Human Resources Officer, the Business Operations Analyst duties will include but not be limited to the following:

Project Management Duties:


Manage planning processes and critical projects involving the various OHR units.
Support the OHR team to organize and structure projects utilizing a project management framework and approach; coordinate people and processes to ensure effective planning to keep projects on track for timely delivery and to produce the desired results.
Break projects into doable actions and set time frames.
Prepare written materials for internal and external communications, including project overviews, internal memos, meeting agendas and presentations.
Lead special and confidential projects as required by the Chief Human Resources Officer.
Participate in special projects and initiatives as needed.

Personnel Records Coordinator Duties:


Coordinate the request for personnel records within the agency.
Facilitate employees' request to review their personnel folders and ensure the agency protocol is adhered to.
Maintain a structured system for releasing personnel records and ensure timely return of folders by stakeholders.
Lead the digitization of personnel records initiative by working with various stakeholders within the agency.
Maintain confidentiality of personnel information received.

Company Description


With an overarching mission to eliminate ageism and ensure the dignity and quality of life of approximately 1.775 million older New Yorkers, the New York City Department for the Aging (NYC Aging) is deeply committed to helping older adults age in their homes and creating a community-care approach that reflects a model age-inclusive city.

The Office of Human Resources (OHR) is responsible for the agency's human capital administration, which includes employment and recruitment, human resources, civil service administration, employee and labor relations, training and professional development, timekeeping & payroll, employee benefit programs, performance management, employee recognition, agency-wide events, and partnering with citywide and oversight agencies to facilitate the agency's workforce management business needs.


Minimum Qualifications


1. A master’s degree from an accredited college or university, accredited by regional, national, professional or specialized agencies recognized as accrediting bodies by the U.S. Secretary of Education and the Council for Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA) in economics, finance, accounting, business or public administration, human resources management, management science, operations research, organizational behavior, industrial psychology, statistics, personnel administration, labor relations, psychology, sociology, human resources development, political science, urban studies or a closely related field, and one year of satisfactory full-time professional experience in one or a combination of the following: working with the budget of a large public or private concern in budget administration, accounting, economic or financial administration, or fiscal or economic research; or in management or methods analysis, operations research, organizational research or program evaluation; or in personnel or public administration, recruitment, position classification, personnel relations, labor relations, employee
benefits, staff development, employment program planning/administration, labor market research, economic planning, social services program planning/evaluation, or fiscal management; or in a related area; or
2. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university, accredited by regional, national, professional or specialized agencies recognized as accrediting bodies by the U.S. Secretary of Education and the Council for Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA) and three years of satisfactory full-time professional experience in the areas described in “1" above.


Preferred Skills

- Project management experience and expertise is a plus. - Self-starter works independently and well with others across teams and at all levels of the organization. - Excellent organizational skills. Problem solve, and prioritize duties. - Excellent oral and written communication skills. - Seamlessly use technology to execute/streamline tasks and highly proficient with Microsoft Office. - Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while maintaining attention to detail and follow-up.

Position Title: Senior Analyst Operations Strategy


Position Summary

JetBlue is looking for a Senior Analyst of Operations Strategy in NYC. The Operations Planning & Analysis team works with the Network Planning/Scheduling team and all of the various operating groups on schedule levers, crew planning levers, manpower planning, etc. with the overarching goal of optimizing the tradeoff between operability & profitability. The ideal candidate has a passion for aviation, a deep understanding of operational reliability and airline schedules, strong problem-solving abilities, and developed quantitative and inter-personal skills. Finally, at JetBlue we take our mission to Inspire Humanity very seriously. As such, we are looking for someone who embodies our five values of Safety, Caring, Integrity, Passion, and Fun.

Essential Responsibilities

Determine strategy for JetBlue operational reliability
Analyze JetBlue operational performance and assess potential constraints that hinder performance
Work with operating groups to determine requirements/buffers that would set them up for reliable performance and analyze (opportunity) cost/trade-offs of those
Actively review JetBlue’s schedules to ensure agreed criteria are provided and look for opportunities to improve performance
Produce and ensure accuracy of monthly reporting for various internal teams; create automated reports and dashboards with operational data
Perform ad hoc operability-related projects in support of senior leadership
Build relationships with operational partners across the system
Support other teams including all operational divisions, Airline Planning and Finance
Other duties as assigned

Minimum Experience and Qualifications

Bachelors’ degree in aviation, mathematics, operational research, computer science, engineering or a related field OR demonstrated capability to perform job responsibilities with a combination of a High School Diploma/GED and at least four (4) years of previous related work experience
Three (3) years of analytical experience in aviation, finance, management consulting, or a related field
Strong capabilities with database querying (e.g., SQL) and/or high-level programming language(s) (such as Python or Visual Basic)
Excellent data analysis and problem solving skills
Experience communicating with senior leadership
Proficiency with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
Strong written and verbal communication ability
Available for occasional overnight travel (10%)
Must pass pre-employment drug test
Must be legally eligible to work in the country in which the position is located
Authorization to work in the US is required. This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship

Preferred Experience and Qualifications

Four (4) years of work experience in aviation, management consulting, or a related field
One (1) year of work experience at an airline in Operations Planning, Network Planning, Revenue Management, or Finance
Master’s degree in aviation, mathematics, operational research, computer science, engineering or a related field
Experience with statistical packages (e.g. R, Stata, SAS)
Experience with optimization models, linear and integer programming and or simulation
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau)

Crewmember Expectations

Regular attendance and punctuality
Potential need to work flexible hours and be available to respond on short-notice
Able to maintain a professional appearance
When working or traveling on JetBlue flights, and if time permits, all capable crewmembers are asked to assist with light cleaning of the aircraft
Must be an appropriate organizational fit for the JetBlue culture—that is, exhibit the JetBlue values of Safety, Caring, Integrity, Passion and Fun
Promote JetBlue’s #1 value of safety as a Safety Ambassador, supporting JetBlue’s Safety Management System (SMS) components, Safety Policy and behavioral standards

COTY is looking for smart leaders who are tenacious, passionate, and fearlessly kind.

This role will work on business & systems analysis for our data and reporting projects liaising closely between our US DTC business team, media teams and our data and reporting team, to ensure correct scoping and delivery of reporting solutions for our US reporting landscape which includes DTC Direct to Consumer (DTC), Paid Media, Web Analytics, and CRM .

The Senior BI Analyst:
Ability to quickly learn end to end processes, and key reporting KPIs across different business areas eg Direct To Consumer Sales and Paid Media Advertising.
Capture, manage and prioritize business requirements from several business teams.
Work with Power BI reporting and technical data team to identify correct solutions and timelines to deliver business data and reporting requirements.
Build proof of concept Power BI models and reports.
Work with Director of Data Systems Automation to identify new and additional data sources and reporting solutions required.
Setup and run regular requirement and delivery feedback processes with business to keep on top of changing business priorities in a dynamic and reactive operational environment .
Stay up to date with latest Power BI reporting features, industry best practices for data management and data processing using frameworks such as DBT.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIE S

Quality from the core. You will be conscientious and diligent in over-delivering for business partners and ensuring our consumers get the best experience possible.
Monitor success. Even when delivered, reporting solutions and need monitoring. Understanding current and changing reporting KPIs and their meaning, checking delivered solution remains current and useful, being curious and investigating anomalies to track down the hidden issues to ensure solution remains fit for purpose.
Collaborate and Align. Foster collaboration across business, data and reporting teams.
Communicate clearly and efficiently. Setting clear expectations, and frequent communication are key for success.
Understand that ‘real boats rock’. All projects have issues, all requirements are incomplete, all implementations are imperfect. You will not hesitate to raise your hand when you have an issue, a road-block or even messed something up. We address problems together.

WHAT YOU’LL BRING

You will have: Bachelor's or master’s degree in computer science, or a related field
Will have knowledge / experience in at least one or both areas:
Understand end to end Direct To Consumer business operations (including Inventory management, Sales, CRM, Finance Reporting).
Understand key reporting KPIs for paid media across Social, Programmatic and Traditional offline media (TV, Print, Cinema, OOH). Good understanding of data operations principles, data warehousing, ETL processes Strong experience with SQL. Strong Experience with data visualisation and report modelling in Power BI. Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently or as part of a team. Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate with stakeholders at all levels of the organisation.

Your required skills: Demonstrated ability to perform at a high level in a high-growth, fast-paced environment. Analytical data skills - including data lineage, data mapping, process mapping. Engagement skills with multidisciplinary stakeholders across all levels of the organization. Ability to drive pragmatic solutions to reporting and data challenges to enable BI developers to deliver reporting. Proficient in Atlassian JIRA. Strong communication and presentation skills Excellent interpersonal skills. Organized, disciplined and methodical approach to requirements gathering and prioritization. Strong team spirit. Pro-active approach to workload

Other skills / Qualifications: Understanding agile methodologies and JIRA/Confluence tools. An understanding of data management/ transformation technologies such as DBT / Data Bricks. Energetic can-do attitude; autonomous and motivated. Team player with strong passion for winning and a bias for action and taking ownership when problem solving.

THE TEAM
This role is part of Coty’s Digital Technology Data platform Team which in turn supports the Digital Organization within Coty across Web, DTC, Social, CRM, and Media.
You will join a small, but energized and ambitious team building and operating a modern data platform. Our responsibilities cover:

Digital data collection across all of Coty’s brands globally
Data ingest and transformation building a quality data asset used for activation, reporting, and insights.
We operate mainly on AWS, but also have initiatives on GCP and Azure.

WHAT WE OFFER

This is unique role with a genuine opportunity to make an impact. You’ll get to work in a diverse environment with a team of professionals who are passionate about the work they do and know how to have some fun along the way.

Coty’s global omni-working policy provides the option to work up to 50% of your month remotely. We believe that a more flexible philosophy of remote working will give everyone the freedom to choose what works for their individual circumstances and empower them to always perform at their best.

ABOUT US

Our people make us who we are. They are the brightest minds bringing the boldest ideas to life every day. If you’re the kind of person who refuses to settle, if you want to think bigger, learn faster and go further than you ever thought possible – we’d love to hear from you.

Coty is deeply committed to Changing the Conversation around Diversity, Equity & Inclusion in an effort to create a more open, inclusive, and diverse workplace where all employees can be their authentic self.

EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES

THE ROLE
ITD’s Service Portfolio Management (SPM) unit is seeking a highly skilled and motivated Senior IT Business Analyst/ Product Manager to lead requirements analysis, planning, and execution of technology projects that align with the agency’s business goals and strategic initiatives, collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to define requirements, shape product roadmaps, and drive the successful delivery of IT solutions.

Responsibilities:
Under supervision and general direction, with considerable latitude for the exercise of independent judgment, the Senior Business Analyst’s responsibilities include, but may not be limited to:
- Lead elicitation and analysis of business requirements, ensuring a comprehensive understanding of stakeholder needs and objectives.
- Identify and document functional and non-functional requirements, translating them into clear and actionable project specifications.
- Evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, and distinguish client requests from the underlying needs.
- Develop and maintain detailed specifications, business rules, swim lane diagrams, use cases, user stories, wireframes, and mock-ups that effectively communicate the product vision and requirements to development teams.
- Facilitate workshops and meetings to gather input from stakeholders and subject matter experts, ensuring comprehensive requirement documentation.
- Develop and maintain product roadmaps, prioritizing features and enhancements based on business value and customer impact.
- Act as a liaison between business stakeholders, development teams, and other relevant stakeholders, facilitating effective communication and alignment.
- Lead the design of intuitive user interfaces (UI) and seamless user experiences (UX) that align with business goals and industry best practices.
- Collaborate in an agile environment, participating in sprint planning, backlog grooming, and daily stand-up meetings.
- Collaborate with customer support teams to understand user pain points, gather feedback, and incorporate enhancements into ongoing development efforts.
- Collaborate with QA teams to define acceptance criteria, test cases and scenarios, ensuring the quality and reliability of the delivered products.
- Conduct thorough testing and validation of software applications against established requirements, identifying deviations and ensuring quality assurance.
- Monitor project progress and provide regular updates to stakeholders, addressing any changes in scope or requirements promptly.
- Continuously gather feedback from stakeholders to refine product features and drive system improvements.
- Define and contribute to roll-out strategies and client training for new and existing systems.
- Stay updated with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices, incorporating relevant insights into product development strategies.
- Provide guidance to junior analysts, mentoring them in effective requirement gathering, analysis, and documentation practices.
- Adept to use MS-Visio, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SQL queries and other tools to prepare/present requirements and analyze data.
- Estimate time required to complete tasks accurately, prioritize multiple tasks effectively, and ensure issues are identified, tracked, reported, and resolved in a timely manner.

Preferred Skills:
- Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, or a related field. Master's degree is a plus.
- Proven experience (5+ years) in IT Business Analysis and/or Product Management roles on mission critical business applications.
- Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP), Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO), or similar certification.
- Proficiency in eliciting, documenting, and managing business and functional requirements.
- Excellent analytical skills with the ability to synthesize complex information and provide actionable insights.
- Exceptional facilitation skills and proven experience at driving consensus across multiple stakeholders.
- Strong understanding of software development lifecycles, methodologies, and project management practices.
- Experience with Agile methodologies, including Scrum or Kanban, and tools such as Azure DevOps and JIRA.
- Ability to effectively communicate with technical and non-technical stakeholders, translating between business needs and technical solutions.
- Familiarity with UX/UI principles and practices to ensure user-centric product design.
- Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects and priorities concurrently.
- Proven track record of successful collaboration with development teams to deliver high-quality software products.
- Exceptional problem-solving skills and a proactive approach to identifying and resolving challenges.

If you are a highly motivated individual with a passion for technology, system/data analysis, process modeling and analysis, and possess the required skills and qualifications, we would love to hear from you. Please submit your resume along with any relevant work samples or projects.

The Position

The Cloud Enterprise Initiatives team, part of the Chief Data Office, is responsible for the development of an authoritative, future-state Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud data environment, the first of its kind at New York Life (NYL).




The team is in search of a strong business analyst to lead and deliver on all business specifications related to cloud initiatives. This includes collecting and documenting requirements, analyzing and developing data sets and code, and working with technology to design and implement solutions. The candidate will work closely with both business functions and the technology team to drive enterprise-wide adoption of the cloud. Note: This is an individual-contributor role at the Senior Associate level. This will be a mix of business facing and technical role.


Responsibilities:

Work with business units and technology to define, analyze, and document business requirements with focus on workflows, business rules, KPIs, and final outcomes
Own the entire lifecycle of business specifications and provide timely delivery to business, data, and tech teams

Consult on defining enterprise sources and building physical data models
Track milestones, activities and interdependencies across projects and tasks, with frequent status updates
Analyze source systems to understand lineage and define authoritative sources and systems of record
Anomaly discovery, root cause and gap analysis, and defect triage
Lead business user acceptance testing and validation including definition of test scenarios and scripts to support business and technology teams in end-to-end QA testing efforts
Prioritize projects and rationalize data products and downstream reports and other data dependencies

Experience working with business requirements through to system level functional specifications
Experience in business and data analytics

Strong background with relational database design and data pipeline architecture
Ability to define and execute test strategies and approaches

Empassion is a Management Services Organization (MSO) focused on improving the quality of care and costs for a highly neglected “Advanced illness/ end of life” patient population. Four percent of the Medicare population but 25 percent of its costs. The impact is driven deeper with families who are left with minimal options and decreased time with their loved ones. Empassion is enabling increased access and alignment while delivering superior outcomes for patients, their communities, the healthcare system, families, and society.

About Empassion:
Empassion is one of the most impactful and exciting start ups in health care. We enable better care for America’s seniors with advanced illness (think roughly last 3 years of life). This is too often a fragmented and unnecessarily painful experience for patients and their families. It is something we all will experience or have already experienced as family members, and it’s something we all will face ourselves. It needs to be better. On a societal level, this care is shockingly expensive and is one of the wonderful areas where better care and patient experience saves CMS, and thus all of us, significant amounts of money. Our business is supporting our network of advanced illness care providers to move into value-based care and deliver better outcomes. We are live in 35 states and are growing, and work with hundreds of providers and thousands of patients.

Location:
This is a full-time role based in New York City. We expect you to come to the office 2-3 days per week, with flexibility for travel and fun New York summers.

Reporting To:
This role reports to the Senior Vice President of Growth with exposure across the company cross-functionally.



Role Overview:
We seek a data driven, strategically minded Sr. Business Analyst to join the growth team. The business analyst will serve as the bridge between Empassion’s Data team, clinical team, and Account Executive team. In this role, the Sr. Business Analyst will be entrenched in the clinical data, finding trends, building stories, and packaging data to be handed to Provider Organizations to deliver high value insights that improve performance and lead to better care of patients and financial savings. In this crucial role, the Sr. Business Analyst will be a catalyst driving new insights and tools into the hands of Empassion’s customer-facing team, making material impact in provider performance and Empassion’s performance.

Ideal Candidate:
2-5 years of consulting and/or data & analytics experience
Expertise in data analysis, excel, & deck building
Experience working cross functionally across teams with open and clear communication
Intellectual curiosity to learn new things and look deeply at data to find new insights
Adaptability to pivot to new projects and leave failed experiments behind
Healthcare experience, value-based care (not required but ideal)

Overview:
BUSINESS SYSTEMS SENIOR ANALYST

WHAT IS THE OPPORTUNITY?

A business systems analyst is an information technology (IT) professional who specializes in analyzing, designing and implementing information systems. Business systems analysts assess the suitability of information systems in terms of their intended outcomes and liaise with end users, software vendors and programmers in order to achieve these outcomes; skilled in understanding both qualitative and quantitative data from business operations and technical software development. They must be able to analyze and synthesize that data, including business processes, business rules and data research, and data analysis, to validate needs with business. The analyst must be able to identify, collect and translate this information into documented design solutions (specifications, use cases, user stories, UI, database and API data mapping) from which the applications and solutions will be developed. Although they may be familiar with a variety of programming languages, operating systems, and computer hardware platforms, they do not normally involve themselves in the actual hardware or software development.The senior business systems analyst is an advanced senior professional, with full understanding and in-depth knowledge of their discipline and wide ranging experience who uses various concepts and in-depth evaluation to address/resolve complex business and systems needs and issues in creative and effective ways. The senior business systems analyst uses analysis and design techniques to address business needs and problems using information technology, playing a crucial role working with business and technical stakeholders to analyze current processes and business rules around processes, identifying technical solutions for future processes that could increase corporate effectiveness and efficiencies. The senior business systems analyst may provide technical guidance to other team members.

Technology and Innovation Division
As a member of City National's Technology & Innovation group, you will drive, develop, and maintain solutions for clients and colleagues. This is an exciting time of technology advancement and innovation across the bank, particularly within our technology teams.

WHAT WILL YOU DO?


Elicits requirements via interviews, facilitated requirements workshops, document analysis, surveys, customer site visits, business process analysis, work flow and task analysis, ensuring the right questions are asked to produce essential requirements information to help align business needs with a technical solution.
Performs "As Is" and "To Be" Business Process Mapping and Business Process Validation.
Identifies process improvements and provides options and technical solutions for future process design/changes that increase corporate efficiencies while considering impact and integrity of the project.
Participates in integration design approach for third party vendors products in collaboration with vendors, solutions architects, and business unit
Breaks down business needs into Epics, Features and User Stories or deliverables to optimize business value of applications and processes.
Prioritizes the User Story Backlog or Analyst Deliverables (with Business Users or Product Owner) and forecasts/schedules their time for developing the functional design specifications/User Stories (which would include UI, workflow, business rules, security and data mapping and if for a user story also the user story and acceptance criteria).
Investigates, researches, analyzes, comprehends, and validates data and data integration needs from multiple sources such as User Screens, Reports, SQL, Oracle, APIs and files.
Creates complex integration/data mapping Functional Specification documentation for vendor and/or internal development teams related to API/UI/Reports/Databases/files; documents include direct mapping, data transformation rules, data business rules and multiple data hops.
Creates functional specifications and/or user story documentation including: Functional specifications include UI/screen shots, data-mapping, business rules, edits, error handling, system access matrices/user security, process flow diagram and use cases as needed, etc. from which programs will be developed and that fit with the Bank's system architecture standards.
Works with technical teams to translate business processes and interpret business needs to them and clarify / update specifications provided to ensure proper translation/development during the Development cycles.
Provides technical direction and support to project or Agile team members during development and testing of functional specification and user stories.
Supports QA and UAT testing, clarify specifications and user stories and performs testing as needed.
Works with Business Users, Development, QA and Support teams to troubleshoot and help identify root cause of reported problems during project and post implementation warranty period and document resolutions so that development can code solution.
Provides support and guidance to other analysts.

WHAT DO YOU NEED TO SUCCEED

Must-Have*
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent Or
Minimum 6 years experience working in a business analysis function required And
Minimum 5+ years experience working with Information technologies required And
Minimum 3 years Microsoft Office software experience required

Skills and Knowledge
Excellent verbal and written communication skills to technical and non-technical audiences of various levels in the organization (e.g., executive, management, individual contributors)
Strong interpersonal and organizational skills with the ability to navigate, facilitate, negotiate, and influence across stakeholders
Knowledge of business analysis methodology and requirements tools.
Skilled in using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions, or approaches to business needs and problems.
Thorough understanding of "business needs analysis" process and how system requirements relate to daily business operations.
Excellent analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Ability to recognize, analyze, and solve for a variety of business needs and problems.
Skilled at writing SQL statements and very knowledgeable of SQL, Oracle, etc. databases in order to analyze or extract data to perform analysis, data validation, and establish data transformation rules.
Must have ability to read through and understand intermediate level SQL code written by others.
Works with complex data structures/models.
Knowledgeable about APIs, familiar with API tools used to validate data and skilled at mapping to and between APIs, SQL, databases, screens, files, etc.
Experienced with the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) and software development methodologies (e.g. Agile, Scrum, Iterative, Waterfall, etc.)
Knowledge of systems development and integration for new technologies.
Excellent organizational and time management skills with strong ability to work independently with the ability to multi-task; work on multiple projects..
High initiative with strong desire to learn new concepts, processes and technologies
Proficient with Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio) and SharePoint.
Able to work in a team environment on task driven work
Able to work in a structured team environment on task and timeline driven work
Ability to document existing and recommended flows using Visio (or like product) and ability to create use cases.
Strong understanding of project management methodologies and procedures
Compensation
Starting base salary: $92,114 - $156,880 per year. Exact compensation may vary based on skills, experience, and location. This job is eligible for bonus and/or commissions.

Overview:

Morgan Advanced Materials is a business rich in history and innovation. Founded in the UK in 1856, we have grown into a global organisation with 70 sites in 18 countries. Our model to serve our customers where they need us has led to a diversified product range using our unparalleled expertise in ceramic and carbon materials, which we exploit to solve difficult problems for our customers across a diverse range of markets.


We are a purpose driven organisation. Our purpose is to use advanced materials to make the world more sustainable and to improve the quality of life. We deliver on that purpose through the products that we make, and the way that we make them.


We help our customers push the limits of their processes and products to meet the demanding requirements they face, from higher process temperatures to higher product performance to increasing miniaturisation.

Key Figures: Revenue £1,112m (2022), ~8,500 employees, manufacturing in 30+ countries, and a global customer portfolio. A UK PLC with head office located in Windsor, Berkshire UK. Listed on London Stock Exchange; Member of the FTSE 250 Index.

JobSummary: Barnes & Noble is the world’s largest retail bookseller and the leading retailer of content, digital media and educational products. We operate over 600 Barnes & Noble bookstores in 50 states and one of the web’s premier e-commerce sites, bn.com. Our Nook Digital business offers a lineup of popular NOOK® tablets and eReaders and an expansive collection of digital reading content through the NOOK® store.

We’re proud to be an industry leader, consistently recognized for excellence in quality and customer service in our stores and online at bn.com.

The Sr. QA Analyst administrates the QA testing requests incoming from each of the development groups within Store Systems, executes QA testing, manages QA testing assignments for the other QA/Business Analyst team members, and provides weekly progress updates to the Project Managers and Developers.
The goal of the Sr. QA Analyst is to ensure any and all system issues have been uncovered and resolved prior to implementation to prevent negative business impact to our Barnes & Noble, Inc and Paper Source stores.

An employee in this position can expect an annual starting rate between $100,000 and $120,000, depending on experience, seniority, geographic locations, and other factors permitted by law.

WhatYouDo:

Participate in the analysis, design, testing, and pilot validation of applications in coordination with business departments and development groups; complete the standard documentation to support the project stages.
Monitor & advance project progress by tracking activity, completing milestones, recommending actions to resolve blockers; communicate project status and issues to the project manager.
Understand operational objectives by studying business functions, gathering system information, and evaluating output requirements, then formulate and execute comprehensive test plans and detailed test cases, report results, track fixes.
Partner with Manager to achieve business and system goals.
Increase user understanding of business functions being supported by the existing systems, which are maintained and developed by the Store Systems department. Provide advice and support to users to resolve specific operational/systemic issues for existing applications.
Knowledge&Experience:

8+ years in Quality Assurance testing and/or System Analysis and/or Business Analysis experience in a software development environment. Candidates with less experience will be considered if their skill set is a good fit. Booksellers with user experience in Barnes & Noble store systems will be considered.
Live in NY Long Island or Tri-state area with the ability to work from the Westbury, NY lab.
Demonstrate initiative, tenacity, motivation, ethical work practices, ability to carry out multiple complex assignments simultaneously, flexibility to switch focus without losing track of other priorities.


Expertise in analytical/critical thinking, reasoning, and problem-solving.
Proficiency in oral & written communication, including the ability to define all variations of test cases, trace through and clearly report results.
Extremely detail oriented.
Strong technical aptitude. Ability to track with and contribute to team development discussions.
Helpful to have experience with SQL query language, Windows environment
Bachelor’s degree

Will Learn:

System tools (e.g. JIRA) needed to be successful in this role.
