Company Name: Consolidated Edison Company of New York, Inc.
Job Description:
Mission Statement

Consolidated Edison Company of New York, Inc. (Con Edison), Orange & Rockland Utilities (O&R), and Consolidated Edison Transmission (CET) employees are required to follow health, safety, and environmental policies, EEO, Standards of Business Conduct, and all other applicable company policy and procedures. We all share a responsibility to advance the company's mission by excelling at our three corporate priorities - safety of our people and the public, operational excellence in all that we do, and ensuring the best possible customer experience.

Core Responsibilities

Perform other related and assignments as required.
Lead and/or support complex integration projects, assessing risks, evaluating proof-of-concepts (POCs), and creating project plans that align with the Enterprise Architecture strategic roadmap
Collaborate with business customers, system architects, developers, and other IT groups to develop integration design documents, business cases (including value analysis), and enterprise-grade integrations using Oracle's products and Business Intelligence reporting solutions
Design and develop complex mappings, interfaces, and process flows, and maintain ETL scripts/processes that meet project-specific business and technical requirements using Oracle Data Integrator (ODI)
Integrate ODI with multiple sources/targets, using Python or Java scripts to support ETL interfaces, scheduling ODI jobs, and configuring monitoring and alerting mechanisms
Create and document Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) interfaces or packages, source code, and controls using standard tools and processes
Use HPI tools to troubleshoot ODI and WebLogic server issues, incidents, respond to monitoring alerts within the OAS environment, and conduct root cause analysis
Develop written policies, procedures, job aids, and/or instructions
Must be flexible and able to work off-hours, be on-call if needed, as required to support deployments, resolve production problems, and respond to corporate emergencies
Perform other related tasks and assignments as required

Required Education/Experience

Bachelor's Degree Preferably in Information Technology, Computer Science, or Engineering and a minimum of (3) years of IT experience or
Associate's Degree Preferably in Information Technology, Computer Science, or Engineering and a minimum of (5) years of IT experience or
High School Diploma/GED a minimum of (7) years of IT experience

Preferred Education/Experience

Master's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent is a plus.

Relevant Work Experience

3+ years of experience with at least two (2) of the following technologies:
Structured Query Language (SQL), such as Oracle PL/SQL or Microsoft T-SQL;
Object-oriented programming, such as Microsoft .NET (VB , C#) or Java;
Web Development using HTML, JavaScript and ASP.NET/MVC;
Oracle RDBMS development (supported versions) or SQL Server (supported versions) development;
Business Analysis;
Project Management
Strong skills and experience with the MS Office suite: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, and Project required.
Experience developing applications and/or databases.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Must have an excellent work ethic.
Must have ability to learn new technology as required for the job using documentation and other available resources.
Flexibility to work on multiple assignments with changing priorities and stay on schedule/on budget.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Advanced experience leading and/or supporting medium to large integration projects preferably using Oracle ODI
Created project plans including, risk assessments, proof-of-concepts (POCs), integration design documents, and business cases including value analysis
Developed Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) interfaces or packages using Python or Java scripts for ETL interfaces or other tools
Performed load balancing to support High Availability environment in Oracle Data Integrator (ODI), and performed performance tuning and optimization
Provided production support, disaster recovery planning, and conducted drills
Designs data quality and reconciliation frameworks using ODI or other integration tool
Works with the business and customers to translate business requirements into technical specifications and create practical integration solutions

Licenses & Certifications

Calling all innovators – find your future at Fiserv.

We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments, and we move money and information in a way that moves the world. Job Title

Business Intelligence Analyst

What does a successful Business Intelligence Analyst do at Fiserv?

The Cyber Risk Business Intelligence Analyst will be responsible for performing data analysis, report development, building visualizations, and improving the information portal delivery. The role will be supporting the cybersecurity organization and technology/business partners across the firm. The person will be responsible for design and development of the web portal content to guide business activity. The ideal candidate will have the curiosity and skills to investigate the data from multiple angles, conduct research and identifying trends while partnering with colleagues to match data from multiple resources to make recommendations. The candidate will have experience in building solutions based on KPIs and metrics.

What you will do:

Design, build and deploy business intelligence solutions for the organization.
Maintain and support data analytics platforms.
Conduct unit testing and troubleshooting.
Collaborate with teams across the organization to manage information portal content and drive requirements for continual improvements and enhancements.
Communicate internally to collect and validate data as well as answer questions regarding reports and data.
Translate business needs to technical specifications.
Build automation and additional efficiencies into manual reporting efforts.
Helps implement new practices, processes, and procedures.
Create and maintain relevant documentation.

What you will need to have:

Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, MIS, Computer Science or equivalent and 7+ years relevant work experience
7+ years’ experience on multiple (3+) BI related projects i.e. reporting, visualization, web portal
5+ years’ experience with enterprise Power BI
2+ years’ experience with additional BI tools (Looker/Grafana/Tableau)
Experience developing and maintaining BI solutions for the organization.
Experience developing and maintaining dashboards, preparing data visualizations, and correlating data to improve decision making ability.
Experience with SharePoint online and Office 365/Power Platform tools and services (Power BI/Power Automate/Flow/Forms)
Advanced level knowledge of SQL queries, performance optimization and data warehousing design principles.
In-depth understanding of database management systems, online analytical processing, and ELT frameworks.
Gather, analyze, and translate business needs into actionable, clearly defined user stories.
Leverages Jira to track requirements, prioritize features, curate content, sequence deliverables into sprints, and report progress.

What would be great to have:

Cybersecurity KPIs and Metrics
Security Event and Information Management experience
Google Cloud Platform (Big Query/Looker)

Regulatory Reporting Business Analyst

Position Description
CGI is seeking to hire a Business Analyst with 4 to 5 years' experience in Regulatory Reporting and Capital Markets. The individual is primarily responsible for day-to-day operational execution to broader planning within this area of expertise. Functions within the team can include remediating issues identified; control and risk management and reporting process improvement; providing support for regulatory change initiatives; and researching and responding to regulatory inquiries and exams. Additionally, the individual will use subject matter expertise while representing the department or function at a broader level. Additional responsibilities may include performing user testing for new or existing process improvements, detailing new procedures related to new reports on-boarded while acting as a go-to-person/escalation point for questions from analysts and other areas. This role may focus on multiple forms of regulatory reporting, such as Electronic Blue Sheets, OATS, LOPR, Short Interest, TRACE, MSRB, CAT and more. The role works closely with several areas of the Firm to support the above functions, including various business groups within the Firm, Compliance, Legal, Finance, and Technology.

Role requires to be On-Site with Client a minimum of 2 days per week.

Your future duties and responsibilities
Review and analyze new business, rule changes or system changes that impact reporting processes and perform associated testing / checkouts.
Coordinate the remediation of reporting anomalies (raise Jira, document requirements, and perform checkout etc.)
Develop UAT strategy, document test cases and execute testing of applicable regulatory, business or control changes.
Acts as an effective layer of escalation for junior or less experienced staff on complex issues.
Drive process improvement or re-engineering by identifying and implementing automation opportunities.
Lead the development and implementation of controls to ensure the timeliness, accuracy, and completeness of reporting.
Document, revise and maintain procedures as the need arises; ensure team is trained on all procedures.
Produce presentations for a range of stakeholders highlighting achievements, regulatory reporting metrics, regulatory risks and change management initiatives.
Serve as a liaison for Regulatory Services on assigned projects; ensure Regulatory Services is advised of program developments and potential impacts to existing processes and reporting logic.
Lead the development of performance management metrics for the group across daily, weekly, or monthly regulatory reports including: Electronic Blue Sheets, Qualified Financial Contracts (QFC), Listed and OTC Large Option Position Reporting (LOPR), Consolidated Audit Trail (CAT), TRACE, MSRB and others as assigned!

Required qualifications to be successful in this role
Strong understanding of financial products (Equities, Listed Derivatives, Fixed Income, and/or OTC Derivatives) and US regulatory reporting requirements.
Understanding of sophisticated option's trading to include options allocations.
Strong understanding of the trade life cycle (Orders, Executions, Allocations) required.
Understanding of Middle Office Trade Processing.
Electronic Blue Sheets, Qualified Financial Contracts (QFC), Listed and OTC Large Option Position Reporting (LOPR), Consolidated Audit Trail (CAT), TRACE, MSRB and others as assigned!
Strong proficiency in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Visio.
Proficiency with Broadridge and Fidessa is helpful.

ABOUT FANDUEL GROUP

FanDuel Group is an innovative sports-tech entertainment company that is changing the way consumers engage with their favorite sports, teams, and leagues. The premier gaming destination in the United States, FanDuel Group consists of a portfolio of leading brands across gaming, sports betting, daily fantasy sports, advance-deposit wagering, and TV/media.

FanDuel Group has a presence across all 50 states with approximately 17 million customers and 28 retail locations. The company is based in New York with offices in California, New Jersey, Florida, Oregon, Georgia, Canada, Portugal, Romania and Scotland.

Its network FanDuel TV and FanDuel+ are broadly distributed on linear cable television and through its relationships with leading direct-to-consumer OTT platforms.

FanDuel Group is a subsidiary of Flutter Entertainment plc, the world's largest sports betting and gaming operator with a portfolio of globally recognized brands and a constituent of the FTSE 100 index of the London Stock Exchange.

THE ROSTER…

At FanDuel Group, we give fans a new and innovative way to interact with their favorite games, sports and teams. We're dedicated to building a winning team and we pride ourselves on being able to make every moment mean more, especially when it comes to your career. So, what does "winning" look like at FanDuel? It's recognition for your hard-earned results, a culture that brings out your best work—and a roster full of talented coworkers. Make no mistake, we are here to win, but we believe in winning right. That means we'll never compromise when it comes to looking out for our teammates. From creative professionals to cutting edge technology innovators, FanDuel offers a wide range of career opportunities, best in class benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. At FanDuel, our principle of "We Are One Team" runs through all our offices across the globe, and you can expect to be a part of an exciting company with many opportunities to grow and be successful.

THE POSITION:
Our roster has an opening with your name on it

We are looking for a Manager of Compliance Analytics to manage a team of analysts. You will work with our Compliance teams, Data Product, and Data Engineering teams to ensure that our regulatory reports are timely and accurate, that we are able to meet ad hoc regulator requests and audits, and that we improve business performance in the compliance space with actionable insights, models, and solutions. This position is based out of New York and reports to the Director of Security, Risk, and Compliance Analytics.

Note: This role works with sensitive data and must be highly responsive. Regulator requests often need quick turn around and occasional effort outside of normal office hours is required.

THE GAME PLAN:
Everyone on our team has a part to play

Be a player-coach manager of a team of analysts to produce regulatory reports and compliance-related analyses and models (includes Anti-Money Laundering, identifying and monitoring prohibited players, and more)
Contribute to company analytics and data strategy, ensuring they reflect priorities for your team and stakeholders
Own tools and models that govern measurement of compliance KPIs, ensuring they are complete, accurate and regularly reviewed and refreshed
Audit, review, and help guide the development of our reporting suite to meet stakeholder needs in an effective and efficient manner
Provide answers to regulator requests with a high degree of speed and accuracy, sometimes requiring effort outside of typical work hours
Review team's output ensuring insights are summarized and tools are checked before communication to stakeholders
Own the day to day management of requests and tasks of your direct reports
Ensure projects and resources are aligned with current departmental priorities
Review other analytical languages for correctness and provide feedback
Provide line management, coaching and professional development to analysts in your team
Work collaboratively with the other managers on the Security, Risk & Compliance Analytics team on team related matters
Be a productive member of the overall analytics organization, including sharing work and collaborating with other competencies
Identify and grow top talent within the analytics team

THE STATS:
What we're looking for in our next teammate

Minimum of 5 years of relevant work experience in an analytical, technical or commercial field preferred; experience in a regulatory environment is a plus
Minimum of 1 year of managing and coaching analysts, data scientists and/or data engineers
Bachelor's Degree in a highly numerate major (Math, Stats, Econ, etc.) or relevant experience in data and/or business analysis
Ability to organize and prioritize workload for a team of direct reports
Proficiency in SQL, Python and Excel required
Demonstrated experience using data visualization software to convey analysis in an easy to digest format. Preferred experience working with Tableau for data visualization
Strong verbal and written communication skills - demonstrable track record of influencing up, down and across organizations
Experience collaboratively working with colleagues in other countries and time zones
This position has some hybrid-work flexibility but applicants must be able to commute to New York office

Job Title: Credit Risk Management Services Business Unit Manager, SVP (Hybrid)
Job Description:
Citi is undergoing a Transformation to modernize and simplify the bank. We’re raising the bar and taking the opportunity to reevaluate the way we do business. This includes fostering a culture of curiosity and excellence and shifting our mindset to be simpler and data driven, making Citi an easier place to work and improving client experience. If you’re ready to be at the forefront of Transformation while taking your career to the next level, we invite you to come and join us!

Institutional Credit Management (ICM) Lending Product Management (LPM) Credit Risk Management Services (CRMS) is seeking an experienced professional to help manage parts of Citi’s Wholesale Credit and Lending Transformation. The Business Unit Manager role requires close coordination and a significant understanding of the credit risk and lending processes changing regulatory landscape, policy implications, and data remediation concerns. You will create presentations and plans which express the strategy and progress for regulators, senior leadership, and the user community ensuring that our execution strategy meets the ongoing obligations of the firm while enabling Citi to meet the objectives of the future state.

The Business Unit Manager requires an in-depth understanding of how each pillar in ICM Lending Product Management collectively integrate as a function in the Wholesale Credit Risk operating model. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to guide, influence, and convince stakeholders, in particular colleagues across other areas of the organization. They will have full managerial responsibilities to ensure the quality, timeliness, and delivery of end results across both organizational and regulatory commitments.

Responsibilities:

Direct and connect strategic initiatives for Wholesale Lending, working across business lines and functional areas to achieve business and regulatory obligations

Champion the strategic goals of the program, and work with the user community and stakeholders to balance short term goals and strategic objectives

Own and manage projects from ideation through implementation, engaging users, technologists, and management consistently

Follow and drive solutions in line with internal policy, industry and regulatory developments. Provide the appropriate levels of transparency and communication with Sr. Management, users, functional support and technologists, including regular governance meetings with stakeholders and leadership

Manage, supervise, and coordinate day-to-day activities in the unit Ensure and monitor the accuracy and completeness of service offerings within the Lending Product Management organization

Support the Global Head of Credit Risk Management Service in accommodating requests related to the Lending Product Management organization, including providing requested data from auditors, and other related parties

Complete and ensure timely submission for deliverables related to the WCR Transformation, ICG Risk & Control, Internal Audit, and/or stakeholders, as required

Pro-actively manage risk, identify & correct control gaps

Support global standardization efforts as per operations guidelines

Actively identify and implement process improvement opportunities

Support internal communications.

Qualifications:

At least 10 years of Product Management, Business Analysis, or In-Business wholesale lending experience for a financial or other regulated institution

Experience in wholesale credit from a Banking, Product Management, Risk Management, or Operational capacity

Strong knowledge of loans and credit enhancement products. History of partnering closely with engineering, operations, and/or risk to drive change in an organization

Experience in executing major strategic projects or software implementations for a large organization

Experience in defining controls or implementing policy changes

Expert PowerPoint and Excel skills

Strong written and verbal communication skills

BA/BS required. MBA/MS preferred

Summary
The Mizuho US Operations (MUSO) Treasury Office is seeking a Treasury Transformation project manager to lead a significant project portfolio.
The Americas Treasury Department (ATD) is responsible for ensuring the financing of the banking entities across the Region conducted primarily through the NY Branch and Mizuho Bank (USA). ATD fulfills its role of pursuing stability and efficiency of ALM, ensuring stable funding, diversifying secured and unsecured funding sources, establishing and managing appropriate Funds Transfer Pricing framework.
The NY Branch is a New York state-chartered branch which primarily engages in wholesale commercial banking services, including lending and credit extension, trade finance services, market and foreign exchange transactions, deposit services, cash management and settlement services and a limited number of derivative products.
Mizuho Bank (USA) is an FDIC-insured New York state-chartered wholesale commercial banking institution. BKUSA primarily engages in lending and corporate finance activities, deposit-receiving activities, leasing business, custody and trust business as well as other financial services with a broad range of corporate customers located in the United States.
Mizuho’s US Operations(MUSO) is taking the next step forward to transition from BHC to IHC an integral part in executing Mizuho’s Strategic road map and has been working on establishing practices in compliance with the IHC requirements of the FRB’s Regulation YY.
MUSO Treasury Office has been established in January 2023 to combine the Banking and Capital Markets Treasury group and enhance the overall ALM function and promote alignment, operating efficiencies and governance across MUSO. ATD and the Treasury Office shall play a key role in ensuring all regulatory requirements are met.
Responsibilities
The candidate will become a core member of the Treasury team and will lead transformation initiatives, as well as update policies, procedures, and other tools to enhance sound financial management. The candidate should be comfortable with interacting with senior management across various legal entities, business lines, and functions.
The ideal candidate will have a track record of leading large cross-functional initiatives through end-to-end operational and technological global implementations. Extensive background in banking, operations, regulatory engagement, technology deployment, and transformation planning and execution, incorporating leading-edge technology to provide bottom line impacts across organizations.
This front office role is tasked with spearheading projects for Treasury. The role will entail working with both Banking and Capital Markets Treasury teams along with the project management office, understanding the project, working with both first and second lines of defense to gather requirements, draft BRD’s work with IT to get the requirements built, and participate in testing of the build.
Facilitate various projects in relation to treasury business in ATD and MUSO such as expanding business, establishing IHC, enhancing ALM and government framework of MUSO Treasury Office.
Job Description:
We are seeking a well-rounded finance change analyst who can be deployed into various Treasury initiatives/programs – be it tactical or strategic, covering systems and processes that affect reporting from both a Financial, Regulatory and Management Reporting perspective.
The ideal candidate should have a good understanding of the various financial markets that MUSO is involved in, such as Money Market, Fixed Income and the financing business as well as financial regulations. The candidate should also have excellent experience and capability in project management and policy writing.
Skillsets Needed:
We are seeking a change agent with strong troubleshooting skillset / solution oriented mindset and experience implementing best practice solutions.

OVERVIEW OF THE COMPANY
Fox Corporation
Under the FOX banner, we produce and distribute content through some of the world’s leading and most valued brands, including: FOX News Media, FOX Sports, FOX Entertainment, FOX Television Stations and Tubi Media Group. We empower a diverse range of creators to imagine and develop culturally significant content, while building an organization that thrives on creative ideas, operational expertise and strategic thinking.
JOB DESCRIPTION
Under the FOX banner, we produce and distribute content through some of the world’s leading and most valued brands, including: FOX News, FOX Sports, the Fox Network, and the FOX Television Stations. We empower a diverse range of creators to imagine and develop culturally significant content, while building an organization that thrives on creative ideas, operational expertise and strategic thinking.
ABOUT THE ROLE
The 'New' Fox Corporation Information Security team drives security initiatives across all of Fox's US based businesses, including Fox Broadcasting Corporation, Fox Sports (FS1 & FS2), Fox Business and Fox News. Fox is one of the nations largest broadcast groups and premier sports brands. The newly formed Fox Corporation is heavily focused on producing high-quality live events and high volume direct to consumer digital distribution.

Are you ready to join a more agile company ready to rapidly innovate and build new systems? Fox is building an innovative security operations center and is looking for a Senior Security Operations Analyst to elevate our detection, investigation, and threat hunting capabilities for our world class incident response. This analyst will collaborate with other members of the team to help simplify, streamline, automate and enhance the overall security capabilities of Fox’s Security Operations. This role is highly technical and requires advanced skills in intrusion detection and threat hunting to identify credible risks/adversaries to all Fox’s systems before a potential breach. Collaboration with security engineers, developers, and business units to constantly improve the overall security posture will be the key to success at Fox.

We are interested in someone who is willing to challenge the status quo. We believe automation is king – we use it not only to simply enrich our data, but to perform remediation and tasks at a scale that would otherwise be impossible. Fox’s security operations has less noise than any SOC out there – and we intend to keep it that way. How can we apply threat modeling to daily security operations? How can we automate remediation and incorporate the human judgement from users? What open source technology and OSINT can be applied as part of our toolset? Bring it all to the table.

A SNAPSHOT OF YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
Provide incident response and be a key point of contact during all incidents. The analyst will own the incidents from start to finish, which includes investigation, correlation, triage, response, mitigation, ticketing, documentation, postmortem analyses and forensic analysis
Monitor our alert channels, SIEM/SOAR notifications and EDR/IDS/IPS solutions for incidents, threat hunt for malicious activity, triage as needed on a 24x7 basis and continuously tune rules to reduce false positives
Grow and mature our threat intelligence program - gather, analyze and assess threat intelligence to report on the current and future threat landscape, and provide a realistic overview of risks and threats in the enterprise environment
Enhance our detection capabilities with correlation, situational awareness and intel enrichment
Develop strategies to detect new threats as they emerge, including those from the most sophisticated threat actors
Apply knowledge of monitoring, analyzing, detecting and responding to cyber events to develop clever, efficient methods for the SOC to handle all incident types and to weaponize our threat hunting capabilities
Assist in the tuning of EDR/IDS/IPS solutions to improve detection, reduce noise, add IOAs, etc.
Document playbooks and train other team members on new IR processes
Provide integral feedback and guidance on the integration of new playbooks, use cases and workflows to be adopted across the entire InfoSec team, as well as other parts of the organization
Work with developers on the InfoSec team to build security automation workflows, enrichments and mitigations
Evaluate SOC policies and procedures and recommend updates to management as appropriate
Work with the security engineering team to improve tool usage and workflows, as well mature monitoring and response capabilities.

WHAT YOU WILL NEED
Experience working in cybersecurity operations and incident response, to include utilizing Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) platforms, Intrusion Detection/Prevention Systems (IDS/IPS), and Vulnerability Management and Threat Intelligence applications
3+ of the following certifications: CEH, CISM, GIAC, GCIH, GCIA, GSLC, GICSP, GSEC, CEH, GWAP, CompTIA Net+, CompTIA A+, CompTIA Security+, CASP CE, SEC+, Splunk Core, OSCP, etc.
Proficient operator of security tools such as end point protection/EDR, SIEM, IPS/IDS, HIDS/NIDS, Networking, firewalls, WAFs, Edge/endpoint security, DNS security, layered security, defense in depth practices, vulnerability scanning, malware analysis tools, networking tool for full packet analysis, data encryption, data loss prevention, etc.
Forensics and/or malware analysis experience is a plus, which includes hands-on experience completing malware analysis, memory analysis and disk forensic
Programming/scripting experience (bash, python, PowerShell)
Linux/Unix OS, Windows and Mac administration skills
Intimate understanding of technology and be motivated to constantly learn new technologies
Strong ability to learn and research new things, including tools, languages, frameworks, etc.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Collaborative mindset that thrives in fast paced environment

The Financial Information Services Agency and the Office of Payroll Administration (FISA-OPA) seeks to hire a Business Analyst to work in the Payroll Operations Support Unit to support City of New York citywide systems that include the Payroll Management System (PMS), the CityTime Application (CT), the Pension Payroll Management System (PPMS), the Workers Compensation System (WCS) and FISA/OPA (New York City Office of Payroll Administration) functions / systems including the City’s tax reporting and filing systems (W2, 941, RACS). Under the general direction, the primary responsibilities of the position are to:


Analyze, research and document business requirements that include, as needed, creating business, domain and activity models/diagrams.

About Us

Imagine: 30 unique restaurants to order from, brought to your door in under 30 minutes. That's what our customers experience.

At Wonder, we want to make world-class food within reach, no matter where you live. That's why we've created a vertically integrated, new standard of dining that will allow you to enjoy menus from award-winning chefs and iconic restaurants across the country, all in one place. Our elevated brick + mortar locations will offer pick up and dine in options, as well as delivery to your home.

As a food-tech startup backed by top-tier venture capitalists and led by a team of experienced entrepreneurs—including some of the most accomplished leaders in the technology, culinary, and logistics industries—we're growing. Join us in pioneering a new category of dining called "Fast-Fine", and revolutionizing the way people eat.

About the role

Inventory operations at Wonder is the core of our customer-facing business. Being able to deliver our amazing food experience to customers is predicated on all our restaurants having timely and accurate inventory data. We're looking for a detail-oriented, highly analytical (and food-loving) self-starter to join our team as an Inventory Product & Operations Analyst. You will own the organization and accuracy of our inventory data as well as develop analysis and reporting to support and improve our operations and systems. The expectation for this role is to be a driver of change, not just an analyst reporting on data.

Organize our inventory data within dbt and Snowflake to enable fast and easy reporting and analysis for operations as well as for use by other operational systems (such as Forecasting)
Understand our inventory management processes in order to ensure the reality of our inventory transactions is accurately reflected in our data
Create inventory accuracy dashboards to enforce inventory management compliance
Create, report on and deep dive into our KPIs – inventory accuracy, waste and stockouts
Develop automated RCA processes for waste and stockout events. When a single item goes out of stock, an automated report should be able to instantly report on the RCA (i.e., the 5 whys)
Perform deep dive analysis on our inventory flows and data to identify opportunities to reduce food waste and reduce stockouts
Create product analytics reporting for our internal inventory management product
Spend time at some of our restaurants in order to gain an intuitive understanding of our inventory operations

The experience you have

5+ years of analytics experience in Operations, Finance, Management Consulting or any data-heavy analytics role
Highly analytically rigorous problem-solver; bias to data in decision-making. Ability to translate data into action and insights.
Expert SQL skills and knowledge; can write complex queries, comfortable with window functions and can design / have strong opinions on database design/schema
Demonstrated experience with Python or R either to perform advanced analysis or to automate some existing data/analytical/reporting process
Experience with dbt and Snowflake
Experience with Looker or other Data Visualization tools

The way you work

You craft positive approaches with the pursuit of excellence for our people and customers in mind
You solve problems and make decisions informed by data, insights, and good judgement
You gain trust through open dialogue, embracing change, and actively seeking feedback

Benefits

We offer a competitive salary package including equity and 401K. Additionally, we provide multiple medical, dental, and vision plans to meet all of our employees' needs as well as many benefits and perks that are not listed.

Base Salary Range: $136,500 - $170,625

About Harry's

Harry's Inc. started in 2013 with a specific goal: disrupt the shaving industry by creating an innovative, everyday product at a fair price. Since then, Harry's has expanded to Canada and Europe, developed relationships with retailers such as Target and Walmart, expanded our grooming brand into a personal care powerhouse, launched two new brands including Flamingo and Cat Person, and made our first brand acquisition with Lumē.

The key to our success? Our amazing people. From chemists, mechanical engineers, CX associates, to creative directors, sourcing managers, and logistics specialists, the Harry's team is composed of some of the most brilliant, diverse, and humble people you'll ever meet.

Our brands answer unmet consumer needs, but our company is a place of inclusion and innovation that attracts some of the brightest minds across industries, geographies, and backgrounds. Whether we have a team of 5 or 500, our core values and our startup mentality remain; we value continuous improvement and learning, teamwork and collaboration, creative problem solving, and open and direct dialogue and feedback.




About the Team

The Centralized Insights & Analytics (CIA) team is a critical function that drives proactive insights to action within the US Personal Care organization. The CIA organization unites capabilities across data science, analytics, insights, and category management into an integrated function to drive insights into action for everyday decisions and more complex business questions that help shape the future of our business strategy that enables us to best serve our customers. Capabilities built by this team will meaningfully impact the business through marketing optimization, channel strategy, site optimization, selling stories, thought leadership, innovation, and overall consumer/shopper experience.

About the Role

As the Senior Data Analyst for Business Insights you will help build and drive company-wide reporting. You will be responsible for building, designing, and reporting KPIs spanning functions from retail distribution (e.g. fulfillment rates) to painting the entire picture of our Omni channel performance. You will flex your analytical skills by diving into data sets in search of more insights. We need someone with both a strong business acumen, excellent storytelling skills, and a robust technical toolkit. You'll work with key decision-makers throughout the company, and also share your insights and recommendations with all levels of the business. This is a very hands on role.

Here's what you'll accomplish:
Synthesizing data on a regular basis to provide leadership with portfolio-level insights on business health, breaking down the silos that exist today within business units
Plan, design, and implement reports that highlight key performance indicators of new or rapidly iterating processes
You will develop an understanding of our P&L, and how our data translates to reporting, to allow you to improve our business with data
Leverage our BI tool Looker to build, maintain, and own dashboards that empower the business to interpret and act quickly. (e.g. Track inventory issues across retailers and build actionable alerting.)
Build reporting from start to finish. Hands-on!
Explore new data and define and build business cases (e.g. retail store distribution performance across brands)
Use our cloud ETL tool Ascend.io or Fivetran to bring in new data sources
Sling Python, Pyspark and SQL to transform and model the data
Collaborate with stakeholders across the organization to bring reporting to life
Work closely with Retail, Strategy, and Supply Chain to identify and solve data pain points
Gain a strong understanding of their data problems and use our Analytics tool kit to find a solution (What data do we need, how can we get it and how can we automate reporting?)
Driving deep analysis of the whats and whys of key drivers to surface hypotheses for action
Background and Experience:
3+ years of overall experience in the Data Analytics or Data modeling
Proficient Technical Skill - You are fluent in writing SQL and Python to query and manipulate datasets, answer questions, and drive end-to-end complete analysis that help accelerate the business. You have a history of creating effective visualizations to clearly drive your point across to various stakeholders using visualization software, like Looker, Tableau or Mode.
Strong Business Acumen – You think deeply about business strategy and profitability, and have experience translating the business ins and outs into data driven problems. You can proactively identify and investigate potential areas of opportunity with independence
Engaged Analytical Thought Partner – You are excited about partnering with coworkers to figure out how analytics can solve problems. You are skilled in translating business questions into data analysis visions to execute. You are great at communicating in order to both fully understand someone's business needs and to communicate potential limitations of your approach
Tactical Problem Solver – You have experience boiling down medium and large scope data problems into measurable and achievable blocks of work. You have the foresight to identify and dismantle potential roadblocks ahead of time. Furthermore, you're pragmatic: you can identify and work on the most important problems first and you want to find the highest-impact lowest cost solution
Clear and concise communicator – You know how to communicate complex concepts effectively and concisely and are comfortable presenting and debating in large groups. We're looking for strong data advocates who can plug into cross-functional working teams seamlessly and drive cultural pushes for the organization to become more data driven

Values that might describe you:

You like to solve problems - You push yourself to solve problems in novel, scalable ways so that you are never solving the same problem twice
You are curious and a learner - You are always seeking to improve yourself and your team, and you love to learn new things while going deeper in the areas you know
You thrive on direct, honest, and supportive communication and feedback
You are infectiously optimistic - To you, there's nothing more exciting than a new challenge. Hard things are hard, but you don't let that get in the way

Who you will work with:

You will report into the Senior Manager, Business Insights
Within the broader Data org, you'll work most closely with the other data analysts and analytics engineers on the team.
Within the larger H' org, you'll work closely with our Inc leadership team, Retail team, Brand leadership teams, and Finance / Operational Planning teams

Who We Are:

EmpiRx Health is a disruptor in an ever-changing healthcare industry, offering a market-differentiating, value-based pharmacy benefits management solution. We are bold and fearless in our approach to healthcare, how we talk about ourselves, and our use of advanced technology and analytics.

What We Do:

We partner with HR and Benefits managers nationwide to ensure our membership has access to the best pharmacy benefits available. We place more emphasis on member care than any other PBM by focusing on health outcomes first. Our pharmacists and clinicians are at the center of everything we do―and our population health solution delivers tailored strategies for our clients. Our pharmaceutical staff daily consults with physicians to drive the greatest clinical and financial outcomes.

Employee-Centric Culture:

At EmpiRx Health, our employees are our most valuable asset. We've earned recognition as an award-winning leader in healthcare by investing in our employees. Our leadership teams drive the employee experience with a strength-based learning and development approach. By leveraging Gallup's Clifton Strengths assessment, we empower our teams to excel and unleash their full potential. We've fostered an environment where every voice is heard, and talents are nurtured. At EmpiRx Health, we celebrate groundbreaking ideas, encourage collaboration, and value open dialogue and continuous improvement.

Who We're Looking For:

EmpiRx Health is in unprecedented growth, and we're seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Business Intelligence Analyst. In this critical role, you will interpret and present data related to market trends, customer behavior, financial analysis, or operational efficiency in a clear and meaningful way. You understand that data drives today’s decisions and when it comes to healthcare and pharmacy claims. You relish change and thrive in an environment of dynamic resilience. SQL is your tool of choice when it comes to pulling data sets and you are able to paint a great visual picture of the insights that this data brings through your expertise in Domo, Power BI, Tableau etc.

If you are a highly motivated Senior Business Intelligence Analyst with a strong background in analyzing complex data, identifying trends, and providing insights that can help in decision-making processes, and you are passionate about making a meaningful impact in the healthcare industry, we encourage you to apply.

What You'll Do:

As a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, your role will encompass a wide range of responsibilities:

Develop and manage strong relationships, collaborating with internal customers in a consultative manner, including proactively offer them insights and suggestions.
Create accurate, timely and actionable reports, dashboards and analytics using BI tools and communicate them to the business
Working with end users, conduct data analysis, identify data trends, patterns, and insights (e.g., customer performance risks, savings opportunities, look-ahead trends and market dynamics that affect client performance, to inform business decisions.
Work with business teams to tailor the right narratives around client stories that can be derived from the data.
Liaise with business leaders to explain the possibilities and limitations of data analysis and support end users on functionality and navigation of reports and information
Assist in researching solutions and recommending actions to achieve higher levels of efficiency for the business drivers such as clinical interventions strategies, clinical savings, financial pricing models, client performance metrics and risk metrics.
Design and implement data quality controls to ensure data accuracy.
Research new analytical trends in industry (e.g. Machine Learning, AI-assisted data analysis) and apply innovative solutions to the current workflow.

What You Need:

5+ years of analyst experience in a dynamic environment
2+ years of experience in business intelligence
2+ years of experience in presenting data to internal and external stakeholders
2+ years of experience on handling large data sets for Ad-Hoc Analysis and accurately merging multiple data sources
2+ years of experience working in a healthcare environment
Advanced proficiency in BI tools such as Domo, Looker, Power BI OR Tableau
Advanced SQL and Excel skills
Independent working ability with strong time management skills
Outstanding presentation and written communication skills with the ability to communicate complex ideas through storytelling
Experience with a wide variety of analytical or statistical methods
Experience working with healthcare claims data and/or pharmacy data

Preferred Background:

Certificate in business analytics, data mining, or data science
Prior experience with, R, Python languages.
An understanding of data frames with Databricks and Spark SQL based technologies

Comprehensive medical, prescription, vision, dental, life, and disability insurance, with coverage for domestic partnerships.
A 401K program to secure your financial future.

Student loan reimbursement.

Job Description
The Division of Information Technology at Stevens invites applications for the position of Business Intelligence Analyst to join a team of talented colleagues to shape the data, analytics, and business intelligence landscape at Stevens. This position has responsibility for the analysis of university data and development of business intelligence and analytics solutions and will aid in data governance and data management efforts in tandem with other IT colleagues and campus partners in support of the data service program.
The successful candidate will use knowledge of the overall enterprise data landscape to work collaboratively both with IT team members as well as representatives from academic and administrative units to determine needs for datasets, reports, dashboards, and analytics, and provide solutions to meet those needs. You will work with a team of data professionals as well as data stewards, data analysts, and data consumers across Stevens toward the common goal of using data sharing to enable business objectives and produce insights to support decision-making, performance measurements, and student success. A combination of strong analytical, problem-solving, and interpersonal skills, creativity, project management, and customer-centricity are key characteristics of a successful candidate for this position.
Responsibilities
Identifying all institutional data sources and information assets and developing solutions to utilize those assets, to support enterprise data warehouse and business intelligence projects
Contributing to the implementation and expansion of Stevens’ next generation cloud data warehouse, predictive analytics, and business intelligence platform through the analysis of business requirements and knowledge of data
Designing and developing data models for the enterprise data warehouse to meet both present and future business needs by integrating a variety of data from disparate source systems
Writing queries and building reports, dashboards, and other data visualizations
Creating and maintaining documentation and diagrams of data architecture, data modeling, and data mappings
Evaluating business needs and goals in order to formulate information availability and data analytics solutions, and supporting continuous improvement for the entire data and analytics space
Collaborating with campus constituents to promote awareness of data governance and aiding with the creation and maintenance of data definitions and metadata, as well as processes for data management and sharing, to maintain data consistency and data quality
Working closely with other Information Technology staff across the organization to recommend, plan, implement, and support innovative technology solutions by providing subject matter expertise in the areas of data analysis and other related activities
Proactively and continuously pursuing professional development and training to acquire new knowledge and skills
Performing other duties as assigned.
Breakdown of Essential Duties and Responsibilities
35%: Data analysis
35%: Data/BI/analytics development
20%: Data governance
10%: Other duties as assigned in support of overall IT strategic goals and synergy within IT
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree, preferably in the field of information management, information science, or another data-related field; equivalent training and experience considered

As the business analyst, you will be the primary liaison between Gen II’s Treasury and Information Technology teams focusing on the development, implementation, and continuous improvement of GEN II’s treasury management system (TMS). Key areas to include automating wire-based payments, integrating data from multiple banks, implementing interfaces between the TMS and Gen II’s accounting systems, and rolling out new functionality to the end-user community.




The role of the business analyst also includes end-user technical support and training as well as the maintenance, improvement, and integration of fund accounting platforms with the TMS. You will act as a partner to business operations teams to collect and document their needs on various initiatives, and you will participate in the technical development lifecycle of new solutions.

Primary Responsibilities Will Include:

Business analysis:

Leads the identification and documentation of business requirements for the integration between existing Gen II systems and the TMS.
Analyzes and challenges business requirements to implement new features in the existing TMS (Bank reconciliation, payments, bank statements…)
Works on the interface between the TMS and the banks to be integrated (Mapping, Data analysis, Testing…)
Identifies and helps to prioritize possible enhancements across existing systems.
Assesses the impact of proposed technical and operational changes on our core business (Private equity, Accounting, SWIFT Payments…)

Business support:

Become the in-house subject-matter-expert (SME) on system functionality and process workflows.
Provide guidance and support to business teams with new-client onboarding activities.
Assist client service teams with day-to-day requests and inquiries.

Project management:

Maintain detailed project plans and timelines covering all IT related project activities in partnership with Treasury management to ensure consistent messaging.
Take a leadership role in new projects supporting Treasury Management System, fund accounting platform, data migrations…
Manage a portfolio of active projects/tasks and be able to manage/communicate the daily progress.
Collaborate with the different project actors across the organization and at different levels.

Development:

Work closely with the IT development team to develop and maintain data interfaces between existing fund accounting platforms and the TMS.
Design any necessary new reports and features in accounting/reporting platforms.

Job Requirements, Skills, Education and Experience:

Masters/ Bachelor’s degree in engineering, computer science, IT or project management.
2+ years of experience.
Understanding SWIFT messages (MT101, MT103, MT940.)
Ability to manipulate large sets of data.
Strong understanding of cash management, investment management processes and related accounting rules.
Knowledge of a treasury management system.
Ability to work independently and effectively prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to prioritize, think independently, and handle multiple tasks at a time.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to think creatively and outside the box.
Superior written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present complex information in a clear and concise manner.
Strong attention to detail and project management skills, with the ability to lead cross-functional teams and drive projects to completion.
Fluent in English.

Nice to have:

Knowledge of Hazeltree Treasury Management platform is strongly preferred.
Knowledge of Allvue, Sage Intacct, eFront or any other Fund Accounting platform.
Knowledge of Private Equity/Real Estate or corporate finance.
Knowledge of at least one coding language (Javascript, VBA…).
Experience/Knowledge of programming in SQL.

The salary range for this position is $120,000-$150,000, in addition to a comprehensive benefits package. Please note that the actual salary offered within that range will depend on the candidate’s experience level.

Gen II Fund Services, LLC is one of the largest global independent private equity fund administrators, administering over $1 trillion of private capital on behalf of its clients with offices in New York, San Francisco, Boston, Stamford, Dallas, Denver, Vancouver, and Luxembourg. Gen II offers private fund sponsors a best-in-class combination of people, process, and technology, enabling fund sponsors to most effectively manage their operational infrastructure, financial reporting, and investor communications. The Gen II team is the most experienced and longest tenured team in the private equity fund administration industry, with broad expertise across buyout, funds of funds, real estate, energy, infrastructure, credit, co-investment, hybrid funds, feeder funds, venture capital, retail, and managed accounts.

Administering over $1T in assets

The most experienced and best performing team in the industry

Job Title: SmartStream TLM Collateral Management Technical BA
Job Description:
Project Description

Our client is a US subsidiary of a global financial house working in multiple markets and asset classes.
They have an exciting opportunity for an experiences Collateral Mgmt Tech Analyst to join the Settlement , Collateral and Controls function within Operations Technology. The main focus of the role is to support the business and the project business analysts to understand and resolve issues being faced by the collateral management. The key piece of the software used by the global team is TLM Collateral Management providing margining functionality for Repo and Securities Lending. The candidate will need to be able to translate the teams issues into the technical solutions that can be developed in-house or with customizations to the TLM Collateral Management system provided by the vendor.

The project will require an updated to the TLM Collateral Management solution which will involve configuring all the components within the application including the core software modules, IIS web components and databases.

The candidate would need a strong collateral management "hands on" technical support knowledge using the TLM Collateral Management system with an understanding of the margining requirements across repo and securities lending products

For New York we offer salary range depending on experience: 80000-160000 USD Gross Per Year.
For Toronto and London we offer market standards depending on experience and work format

Responsibilities

Support the business and business analysts to understand and document current issues and inefficiencies in repo and MBS collateral management process.
Desing technical solutions to resolve business issues that are within the capabilities of the TLM Collateral Management System.
Upgrading TLM Collateral Management to a later version (once needed): configuring all individual software modules, upgrading various databases, setup and configuration of IIS websites, ownership of executing full UAT & regression testing of the system post upgrade including downstream feeds and outputs.
Working closely with the vendor to identify and implement changes to improve performance of the system.
Creating and updating in-house SQL extracts.
Optimizing batch processing to decouple margin types and reduce business/SLA impact when failures occur.
Must be willing to do travel/hybrid work from New York client office
Skills

Must have

3+ years of previous hands-on experience on similar role
Extensive Experience in support of the SmartStream TLM Collateral Management application for OTC derivatives, repo and MBS margining
An understanding of bank collateral management obligations including variation margin, initial margin
Product knowledge of OTC derivatives, repo and SBL
Experience in configuring IIS websites and authentication.
Strong SQL knowledge including the creation of stored procedures.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Experience with XML and MQ messaging
Ability and experience of working under the pressure - both autonomously and within a team
Ability to liaise with business and IT stakeholders at all levels of the organization

Nice to have

Control-M, Java code reading
Languages

English: C1 Advanced

Seniority

Senior

Relocation package

If needed, we can help you with relocation process.

Vacancy Specialization

Business Analysis

Ref Number

VR-99151

SENIOR TECHNICAL BUSINESS ANALYST
Agency: HRA/DEPT OF SOCIAL SERVICES
Posted on: 08/21/2023
Job type: Full-time

Location

MANHATTAN

Title Classification: No exam required

Department

Mgmt Information System-NM

Salary range: $75,000.00 – $118,000.00
Job Description
The Department of Social Services (DSS) is comprised of the administrative units of the New York City Human Resources Administration (HRA) and the Department of Homeless Services (DHS). HRA is dedicated to fighting poverty and income inequality by providing New Yorkers in need with essential benefits such as Food Assistance and Emergency Rental Assistance. DHS is committed to preventing and addressing homelessness in New York City by employing a variety of innovative strategies to help families and individuals successfully exit shelter and return to self-sufficiency as quickly as possible.

Information Technology Services (ITS) is DSS’s technology services organization. ITS mission is to support the daily, emergent, and long-term needs of both agencies. ITS creates and enhances the technology infrastructure and computer applications that support HRA and DHS and develops applications, including a variety of client eligibility and recertification systems, case management systems, housing systems, employment/work engagement services, revenue producing computer matches, claiming systems, and personnel systems.

The Office of Enterprise Solutions Engineering within ITS consists of five divisions – DHS Technology, HRA Technology, DSS Technology, External Agency Technology, and Quality Assurance – that supports the analysis, design, development, testing, and implementation of hundreds of web and mobile applications, which run on Linux and Windows Servers and are hosted in a hybrid cloud and on premises data center. Additionally, this office maintains agency-wide Imaging repository containing over a billion client-related documents.

The DHS technology unit within the Office of Business Solutions is responsible for creating and/or purchasing Commercial Off the Shelf (COTS) web and mobile applications required to support the agency’s mission of preventing and addressing homelessness. The unit is also dedicated to the testing of administrative systems that it either develops or purchases, as well triaging and responding to data and analytics request necessary to monitor and report on key performance indicators such as capacity, census, and critical incidents occurring in the shelter system. Many of the applications from the DHS technology unit, communicate with both internal and external systems and platforms like the NYC Opportunity Common Client Index, NY State Welfare Management System (WMS), and other diverse data sources. This unit is responsible for maintaining standard frameworks for designing and developing web and mobile applications.

Under executive direction of the Assistant Deputy Commissioner for DHS Technology, with wide latitude for the exercise of independent judgment, and decision-making, the Senior Technical Business Analyst for DHS Technology combines IT expertise in requirement gathering and elucidation with in-depth business knowledge to manage major areas within the application development lifecycle, from design to development, quality assurance, user acceptance testing, deployment and maintenance support, with great ingenuity.

Information Technology Services (ITS)/ Office of Business Solutions/ DHS technology is recruiting for one (1) IT Project Specialist, to function as Senior Technical Business Analyst, who will:


Determine system efficiencies, features, and functionalities for a variety of administrative systems –
such as those used to conduct shelter and subsidy offer inspections, to create agency reports on
key performance indicators, and to track shelter client exits into the community by liaising with
end-users across multiple program and business units. Efficiently integrate new systems,
programs, and applications with business operations and services. Gather business requirements
and turn them into groomed user stories for development. Develop wireframes and mockups of
new features and functionalities.


Perform system analyses on database, web and mobile applications, and web services specific to
the DHS Technology portfolio. Develop end user acceptance test scenarios. Analyze and improve
performance of mobile and web-based systems.


Develop written formal and informal documentations such as presentations, functional design
document, non-functional requirements document that illustrate specific system features, for a
variety of ITS and non-ITS audiences. Coordinate, track, and report on progress being made on
project tasks across any of the systems, to management, stakeholders, and relevant teams.


Conduct demonstrations of new features and functionalities, to ensure end-user proficiency with
new and existing systems, programs, and applications across departments.


Provide day-to-day support to various project teams including those working on the agency’s
rehousing management system (HOME), shelter management system (CARES), system to
validate that a particular hosing offer for a city subsidy has no existing violations (Inspections web)
and asset management system (EAM).

Minimum Qualifications


1. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college in computer science, engineering, human computer interaction, interactive media, digital and graphics design, data visualization, communication or a related field, and four years of satisfactory full-time experience related to the area(s) required by the particular position and a specialization in a relevant technology, process, methodology and/or domain; or

2. An associate degree from an accredited college in computer science, engineering, human computer interaction, interactive media, digital and graphics design, data visualization, communication or a related field, and six years of satisfactory full-time experience related to the area(s) required by the particular position and a specialization in a relevant technology, process, methodology and/or domain; or

3. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college, and eight years of satisfactory full-time experience related to the area(s) required by the particular position and a specialization in a relevant technology, process, methodology and/or domain; or

4. Education and/or experience which is equivalent to "1", "2", or "3" above.


Preferred Skills

- Extensive practical experience delivering on technical business analysis in an agile setting and for a social services industry. - Advanced knowledge and experience with using the following tools Visio, JIRA, Axure or Balsamiq, SQL or Oracle. - Demonstrated experience providing technical Business analysis support on any one or more of the following: Commercial off the Shelf (COTS), web applications designed in .NET and Angular, mobile applications designed in React native, and web applications designed in Curam and Angular. - Experience with advising end users on technical approaches for a solution and negotiating on aspects of the requirements that may not prove useful for the desired solution. - Excellent ability facilitating end-user proficiency on systems, programs, and applications and ensuring optimal system functionality via multiple rounds of testing. - Ability to build partnerships across multiple stakeholders, including the business end users and IT divisions such as Infrastructure and Operations and Service Management. - Excellent analytical, strategic conceptual thinking, planning, and execution skills verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to explain technical concepts and technologies to business leaders and business concepts to the IT workforce.

Who are we?

We're Bluecrux. Pleased to meet you! Founded in 2011, Bluecrux is a value chain consulting and technology company. Our experts and software solutions help to transform today’s supply chains into smart, efficient, and fully integrated value chains. We believe that only true collaboration leads to innovation by converging at the intersection of our knowledge and our customers’ ambition and linking expertise with technology and problems with solutions. We’re a community, a movement that’s built at this intersection, which we call “the Cutting X”: it’s where supply chains evolve and value chains are forged. Our client portfolio includes some of the world's largest companies, including Johnson & Johnson, GSK, Roche, Bridgestone, Oatly, and many more. Our desire to work closely with them is also reflected in our global presence, with offices both in the US and Europe.



What will you be doing?
You'll start immediately in a visible, autonomous role as a project member of one of our running supply chain planning projects within different industries such as life sciences, chemicals, food & beverages, and manufacturing.
You'll see yourself working on and contributing to the main project phases. Here's an idea of what to expect:
In general, you will always be analyzing, mapping and conducting existing business processes in the Supply Chain and Operations.
To refine your analysis, you will prepare and project interviews to better understand the client's needs. You will become aware of the customer organization and be part of the change in their organization and their ways of working.
You'll track KPIs and report and present them accurately to the customer project team.
You are responsible for the qualitative documentation of all your project tasks. You'll contribute to delivering the most important customer and project deliverables, such as meeting notes, playbooks, and training materials.

Is it you that we are looking for?
You have that interest in or have a first working experience with Supply Chain Processes. Ideally, you have had an introduction to Supply Chain Processes in a minor or major within degrees like business engineering, civil engineering – operational research, applied economics or within an MBA program.

You can demonstrate profound analytical and problem-solving skills.
You're a team worker and - player who can also perform well without much supervision.
You're open to feedback and always on the lookout to enhance your collaboration.
You like to be challenged daily and thrive in a fast-paced environment.
You are flexible and willing to travel as our projects can occur worldwide at our customers' offices.
What you'll love about working for us.
A great place to work with lots of growth opportunities, where we make room for initiative and allow you to enhance your personal and professional skills, but most importantly, there is room to be yourself!
You will be part of a great team of hands-on, inspiring and enthusiastic supply chain colleagues.
A competitive compensation package, including a generous PTO program, medical and optional dental insurance, a bonus program, and a 401(k) plan with fixed employer contributions.
A hybrid workplace: a combination of home office and on-site (in the Jersey City area).
We know you by your first name, and don't let titles or levels withhold us from being truly aware of your talents.
Team events & fun such as team building & sports activities.
Please note that sponsorship for a visa is not available.

Job Description
The New York City Taxi and Limousine Commission (TLC) is the nation’s largest for-hire transportation agency, licensing and regulating the City’s yellow and green taxicabs, for-hire vehicles (including apps like Uber, Lyft, and Via), commuter vans, and luxury limousines. TLC develops and enforces rules to promote safety, transparency, as well as consumer and driver protection for a vital mode of transport in New York City. The vehicles, businesses, and drivers licensed and regulated by the agency move over one million people a day. With the introduction of new apps and technologies, TLC is on the front lines of a changing mobility landscape in New York City. TLC collaborates with renowned universities on data analysis, builds partnerships with leaders around the globe on the future of transportation, and works to streamline agency operations to meet the demands of a changing industry. TLC is a committed partner of the Mayor’s Vision Zero initiative to promote safe driving and a leader in city-wide initiatives, including open data and the growth of the City’s wheelchair accessible taxi and for-hire vehicle fleets.

Duties and Responsibilities:
The TLC Information Technology (IT) department is looking for a Product Owner to join the Product Team who will help the agency achieve its goals through research and analysis for IT initiatives and projects that address complex business needs. Reporting to the Chief Product Officer, the Product Owner will work closely in partnership with TLC divisions to understand and document requirements for IT requests, help prioritize the request backlog, and clearly communicate with IT teams, business stakeholders, and executive management throughout the implementation lifecycle.

The successful candidate is an analytical leader who thrives in a highly collaborative workplace and actively engages with teams throughout the software development lifecycle. S/he will be smart, self-motivated, detailed, and comfortable working in a fast-paced and continuously changing environment. This role requires a strong technical background.

Responsibilities:

Evaluate requests from stakeholders for enhancements and projects, perform research and analysis to understand the request and potential impacts.
Meet with business stakeholders as needed to understand and document requirements for IT enhancements and projects, including but not limited to cyber security projects and enhancements.
Assist stakeholders in managing and prioritizing their product backlogs. Provide expertise on advantages and disadvantages of prioritizing one request over another and help build consensus among various stakeholder groups.
Assist IT teams in developing innovative technology solutions that address business needs.
Communicate clearly and frequently with IT teams, business stakeholders, project sponsors, clients, external vendors, and executives on the status of requests.
Monitor progress of IT initiatives, including but not limited to cyber security projects and enhancements, and regularly communicate status to stakeholders.
Actively participate in IT projects and sprints to articulate business requirements and clarify business needs. Solicit feedback from stakeholders as needed to facilitate project or enhancement implementation.
Coordinate with stakeholders to ensure user acceptance testing (UAT) is performed.
Serve as a subject matter expert in the development of content for cyber defense tools.
Coordinate with enterprise-wide cyber defense staff to validate network alerts.

Minimum Qualifications


1. A baccalaureate degree, from an accredited college including or supplemented by twenty-four (24) semester credits in cyber security, network security, computer science, computer programming, computer engineering, information technology, information science, information systems management, network administration, or a pertinent scientific, technical or related area; or

2. A four-year high school diploma or its equivalent approved by a State’s department of education or a recognized accrediting organization and three years of satisfactory experience in any of the areas described in “1” above; or

3. Education and/or experience equivalent to “1” or “2”, above. College education may be substituted for up to two years of the required experience in “2” above on the basis that sixty (60) semester credits from an accredited college is equated to one year of experience. In addition, twenty-four (24) credits from an accredited college or graduate school in cyber security, network security, computer science, computer programming, computer engineering, information technology, information science, information systems management, network administration, or a pertinent scientific, technical or related area; or a certificate of at least 625 hours in computer programming from an accredited technical school (post high school), may be substituted for one year of experience.


Preferred Skills

The preferred candidate should possess the following: - 4+ years of business analysis and/or project management experience on information technology projects, including but not limited to software, network, security, and/or information systems projects. - Experience documenting business requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria - Excellent interpersonal skills including, collaborating, team building, facilitation skills, negotiation skills, and conflict resolution skills - Exceptionally curious and detail-oriented able to analyze requirements and think outside the box to develop innovative solutions to meet business needs - Strong analytical, planning, and organizational skills - Excellent oral and written communication skills when interacting with both business and IT individuals at all levels - Knowledge of Agile principles and values and experience participating in or leading agile/scrum projects - Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Project, Excel, PowerPoint, and Word), SharePoint - Professional/Certified Scrum Master or Certified Scrum Product Owner certification desired - Understanding of cyber security concepts, processes, and strategies a plus - Knowledge of TLC operations and processes preferred
