Job Title: Vice President, Technology Lead Business Analyst-Hybrid-IMM-conversion
Job Description:
As a bank with a brain and a soul, Citi creates economic value that is systemically responsible and in our clients’ best interests. As a financial institution that touches every region of the world and every sector that shapes your daily life, our Enterprise Operations & Technology teams are charged with a mission that rivals any large tech company. Our technology solutions are the foundations of everything we do. We keep the bank safe and provide the technical tools our workers need to be successful. We design our digital architecture and ensure our platforms provide a first-class customer experience. Our operations teams manage risk, resources, and program management. We focus on enterprise resiliency and business continuity. We develop, coordinate, and execute strategic operational plans. Essentially, Enterprise Operations & Technology re-engineers client and partner processes to deliver excellence through secure, reliable, and controlled services.

Global Functions Technology is a diverse organization comprised of more than 15,000 talented professionals with some of the brightest minds – all working together to realize Citi’s Vision of growth and economic progress. As a group, we partner with the Finance, Risk, Compliance, and Human Resources teams to drive the delivery of innovative technology solutions using common data, analytics, and platforms. Our technology operates in real-time environments, capturing and managing market, transaction, and accounting data, as well as the data from millions of customers daily. Our solutions cover all products and geographies in which Citi does business. We are the backbone for reporting across the bank, satisfying our regulatory commitments, enabling our businesses to be nimbler and helping to safeguard customer assets through highly effective controls.

Our commitment to diversity includes a workforce that represents the clients we serve globally from all walks of life, backgrounds, and origins. We foster an environment where the best people want to work. We value and demand respect for others, promote individuals based on merit, and ensure opportunities for personal development are widely available to all. Ideal candidates are innovators with well-rounded backgrounds who bring their authentic selves to work and complement our culture of delivering results with pride. If you are a problem solver who seeks passion in your work, come join us. We’ll enable growth and progress together.

Genesis Team Lead is responsible for overseeing the design and support of data integration between Finance and Risk platforms. This includes models developed in support of a global data warehouse and reporting databases as well as transactional databases for use by Finance, Enterprise Risk and Compliance across all lines of business. Analyst will be responsible for all deliverables associated with the models, including source to target mappings and data consumption. Analyst will also support development, testing, and production of the data warehouse as part of the Data Consumption team.

Responsibilities:

Develop transformation logic to support the data consumption requirements
Assess the quality of data during development and test phases of the projects, and own the resolution of the data quality issues by working with development teams
Work with technology/business teams to provide standards based solution
Develop or enhance standards for logical and physical model development.
Develop mappings of sources to target databases, including documentation of transformation rules.
Communicate regularly with architects and modelers working in parallel tracks to maintain consistency of models and other deliverables.
Oversee the development of scripts to correct bad data or to implement data model changes as required.

Knowledge / Skills Required

6+ years of data analysis experience
6+ years experience building large Data Warehouses (30+ TB) and back-office systems.
5+ years RDBMS experience: Netezza, Teradata, and Oracle preferred.
3+ years experience in implementing Financial GL and sub-ledger systems.
Past experience with banking products such as deposits, loans, securities, derivatives, etc.
Past experience preferred with Basel RWA/EAD calculations
Domain knowledge in Accounting, Finance, Risk Management and/or Regulatory Reporting in the Banking industry.
Ability to write complex SQL needed to investigate data issues, repair damaged data, and migrate data to new structures.
Excellent written and oral communication skills, including use of Excel for presentation of data and mappings.
Demonstrate Complete System Development Life Cycle experience for large scale complex projects with various industries.
Ability to work independently under strict deadlines.
Passion to deliver results in a complex enterprise application / environment
Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology or equivalent work experience

This role will require the ability to understand, synthesize, and document constantly evolving company learnings to enhance and/or expand our ability to provide high quality and timely service to our customers. Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Liaise between various business departments internal personnel and sometimes external stakeholders

Job Description:

About us:

Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world's largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America's largest newspaper by paid circulation; Barron's, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Investor's Business Daily, Factiva, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, OPIS and Chemical Market Analytics. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).

About the Role

You will be responsible for several high priority business unit stakeholder initiatives, including collaborating on designing and managing new and existing technologies and processes. You will empower the ability to provide world class, innovative service to Dow Jones across a variety of value-added initiatives. You will identify and implement business process improvements and efficiencies to support Dow Jones performance and help inspire creativity. You will work with and develop strong business partnerships across Dow Jones and other business units to identify long-term strategic and short-term tactical opportunities to create greater efficiencies in Workday related HR processes, systems and resource optimization. As a change agent, you will help create a new center of excellence program to focus on continuous improvement and transformation initiatives across HR systems. You will report to the Supervisor, People Strategy & Enablement and be based in our New York City office.

You Will:

Work with stakeholders and senior members from the business to further define the People Strategy & Enablement group’s standards and governance, tools, and methodology; build the project pipeline and prioritization criteria; establish communication and training plans; and commence process improvement projects
Partner on a diverse variety of key strategic People projects along with supporting BAU systems issues, troubleshooting and solutions
Partner with subject matter experts from People, legal, compliance, payroll, benefits and the business to create and implement process improvement and transformation projects across new and existing People workflows, documenting those workflows, diagnosing inefficiencies, and ensuring the completion of projects to work towards an optimized future state
Identify opportunity areas where HR process management and reengineering can significantly impact efficiency, quality, profitability, and customer satisfaction
Be an “internal consultant” to assist the People team, the business and the downstream consumers in solving complex problems, managing key projects, and driving toward solutions that add net present value (NPV) across the organization
Support process owners, stakeholders and subject matter experts through the improvement process and manage expectations
Assist in transition planning and assess organizational change readiness, perform needs assessments
Support process improvement meetings and workshops, including business process requirement gathering sessions, brainstorming sessions, and design playback sessions
Focus on improvement opportunities by evaluating, in detail, a current operation from start to finish, analyzing this information to find areas of redundancy, duplication and frequent errors, developing a plan to implement changes, monitoring the results of the changes to ensure they are working, making continuous improvements and adjustments to maintain efficient operations
Recommend and clarify priorities and coordinate cross-organizational association where common needs have been identified; assess upstream and downstream impacts and integrations
Be involved in user acceptance testing for change delivery every sprint and release cycle for all BAU and optimization changes
Develop and coordinate preparation of internal process documentation, user guides and quick reference guides for changes delivered in People systems and for end-to-end workflows and processes
Assess the level of change management required and make decisions on release dates, preparation of comms and change management
Develop, implement, update, and maintain strategy, documentation and methodology for business process excellence/continuous improvement
Bridge understanding across technology and business stakeholder groups, assuring value realization of technology projects and support

You Have:

Experience with Workday, ServiceNow and other HR technologies (preferred)
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Finance, Strategic Planning, or technology-related discipline or equivalent related experience
3 years of experience in Human Resources or related field with responsibility supporting process improvement projects
Ability to motivate team members, foster strong relationships, drive change, and facilitate problem solving discussions
Project management experience, strong time management and organization skills with the ability to lead multiple projects and streams of work
Exceptional interpersonal, communication and interaction skills, including oral, written, facilitation, mediation, collaboration, and presentation skills with all areas of the business
Demonstrated competence in collecting, analyzing data and developing appropriate conclusions and recommendations
Ability to provide clear direction, coaching, and constructive feedback
Overall business acumen with the ability to find the simplest, best path to solutions
Experience analyzing business processes, business process modeling, and in process improvement methodologies and tools
Negotiation experience

Since 1882, Dow Jones has been finding new ways to bring information to the world’s top business entities. Beginning as a niche news agency in an obscure Wall Street basement, Dow Jones has grown to be a worldwide news and information powerhouse, with prestigious brands including The Wall Street Journal, Dow Jones Newswires, Factiva, Barron’s, MarketWatch and Financial News.

Job Title: Business Analyst & System Administration - Workplace Technology - Workplace Operations & Supply Chain
Job Description:
The energy of a newsroom, the pace of a trading floor, the buzz of a recent tech breakthrough; we work hard, and we work fast - while keeping up the quality and accuracy we're known for. It's what keeps us inventing and reinventing, all the time. Our culture is wide open, just like our spaces. We bring out the best in each other through collaboration. Through our countless volunteer projects, we also help network with the communities around us, too. You can do amazing work here. Work you couldn't do anywhere else. It's up to you to make it happen.

What's the role?

Workplace Operations & Supply Chain, through our services and applications provide an employee experience that drives innovation, collaboration, productivity, and transparency. Our Global Employee Operations Team is central to this effort by providing platinum support to 21,000 employees and over 500,000 annual visitors in over 170 state-of-the-art offices worldwide!?

We are a close-knit, hardworking team who rely upon a complex set of proprietary and third-party systems to deliver the services we provide; and those systems are the key to understanding where we are successful, and where we can develop. ?The team strives to continually improve and elevate the employee experience, while continually improving operationally. ?

Our 21,000 employees generate more than 550,000 service requests each year through a ticketing system and chat that drives both human and automated services related to Employee Operations, Workplace Operations and Supply Chain employee support and internal cross departmental workflows. ?Support Services through these systems are comprised of supporting approximately 400+ software titles, monitoring our entire corporate network that consists of 28,000 PCs with peripherals, 50,000 screen displays and 120,000 network connections; enhancing and maintaining our 170 offices globally, overseeing over 7,000 moves annually; and the Planning, Manufacturing, Logistics, and Warehousing from 22 global locations to distribute equipment to over 190 countries.?
?
We are looking for a Business Analyst to identify. develop, implement, and drive strategic initiatives globally that automate processes and workflows for the products and services we provide to support employees. More specifically, leveraging Bloomberg developed no code/low code tools to orchestrate service request automation and digital process transformation, and continuous improvement initiatives across employee support workflows.

This individual is responsible for assessing the internal and external factors that can affect project outcomes, leverage problem solving skills to ensure project plans deliver on time as well as work with stakeholders to inform the strategy and roadmap for technology initiatives. In addition, overseeing all aspects of a project such as timelines, scope, requirements, and sprint management to ensure the initiatives stay on track.?

We'll trust you to:
Through an agile framework, deliver system workflow changes, taking a hands-on approach to driving incremental change and improvements
Manage system enhancement requests that streamline product and workflow problems, make decisions, and prioritize work to stay on track towards business deliverables?
Responsible for the upkeep, configuration, and reliable operation of our e-Builder® Construction Management System and other Integrated Workplace Management Systems (IWMS)
Coordination and delivery of training including content and materials
Develop a roadmap for automation opportunities-Leverage data/evidence-driven approach to determine project success criteria, monitor results, and measure impact
Communicate with and manage business and cross departmental stakeholders at all levels
Leverage your customer service skills to provide customer service to Workplace Operation employees via our internal ticketing system
Identify impediments and take a proactive approach at finding ways to remove roadblocks?
Effective decision-maker to balance risks and benefits for overall good of the organization
You'll need to have:
Minimum 5 years' experience
Bachelor's Degree
Proven experience with e-Builder® workflows and accounts configuration and administration is necessary
Experience with SAP® system is necessary
Experience writing both functional and technical documentation
Proven track record leveraging data to make insights and inform the project strategy such as Excel to analyze data?
The ability to articulate ideas and garner support for initiatives
Ability to build strong relationships
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with a positive attitude?
Consistent track record to work autonomously
We'd love to see:
Experience with Tririga®
Experience with construction management
Experience with python

We are seeking a skilled Warehouse Operations Analyst to join our MGX Beverage warehouse team. The primary focus of this role is to generate and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure operational effectiveness. The Operations Analyst will play a vital role in providing meaningful insights to the business, utilizing data modeling and visualization techniques to communicate the story. This role is responsible for analyzing and evaluating various aspects of the warehouse, including inventory control, order fulfillment, labor utilization, and overall process improvement. The Operations Analyst uses data-driven insights to identify opportunities for optimization, implement solutions, and drive continuous improvement initiatives within the warehouse environment.

Essential Functions:

Generate and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure business performance: Develop and maintain a comprehensive set of KPIs to measure operational effectiveness and efficiency in the warehouse environment.
Provide meaningful insights: Collect and analyze data related to warehouse operations, including inventory levels, order volumes, picking and packing efficiency, and labor utilization. Identify patterns, trends, and areas for improvement based on data analysis, and provide regular updates and insights to business stakeholders
Process Evaluation: Evaluate existing warehouse processes and workflows to identify bottlenecks, inefficiencies, and areas of improvement. Conduct time and motion studies, analyze order processing workflows, process mapping, and root cause analysis to identify opportunities for optimization. Identify opportunities to reduce order processing time, improve order accuracy, and enhance customer satisfaction.
Warehouse management systems (WMS): Leverage expertise in warehouse management systems (WMS) to extract and analyze data, identifying trends and areas for optimization.
Reporting and Communication: Prepare regular reports, dashboards, and presentations to communicate insights and recommendations to management and stakeholders. Present findings, progress, and improvement initiatives in meetings.
Data modeling and visualization: Utilize data modeling techniques and advanced Excel skills to create models, charts, and graphs that effectively communicate complex data sets to business stakeholders.
Training and Support: Provide training and support to warehouse staff on process changes, system updates, and best practices. Ensure that employees understand and adhere to standard operating procedures (SOPs) and safety guidelines.
Data integrity maintenance: Ensure the accuracy, completeness, and consistency of data by implementing quality control measures and data validation techniques.
Cross-functional collaboration: Collaborate with various teams such as inventory control, inventory management and warehouse management to gather data, understand requirements, and develop solutions for operational challenges.
Profit-minded approach: Identify opportunities for cost reduction and operational efficiency improvements through data analysis and collaborate with relevant stakeholders to implement appropriate measures. Apply a profit-minded mindset to all analyses and decision-making, focusing on improving financial performance and contributing to overall business profitability.

Skills and Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Operations Management, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or a related field; applicable experience in lieu of degree.
Proven experience as an Operations Analyst or in a similar analytical role.
Prior experience in a warehouse or distribution environment is preferred.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate data into actionable insights.
Proficiency in data analysis tools, techniques, and software, including advanced Excel functions and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Familiarity with warehouse management systems (WMS) and their data structures.
Strong knowledge of enterprise resource planning systems (ERPs), previous experience with MS Navision is preferred
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data findings in a clear and concise manner.
Detail-oriented with a focus on data accuracy and integrity.
Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to work on multiple projects and priorities simultaneously.
Continuous learning mindset to stay updated with industry trends and emerging analytics techniques.

Job Title: Senior Business Intelligence Developer (Senior Consultant MIS- Level B) , Data Sciences and Support
Job Description:
About NYC Health + Hospitals



Empower Every New Yorker — Without Exception — to Live the Healthiest Life Possible

NYC Health + Hospitals is the largest public health care system in the United States. We provide essential outpatient, inpatient and home-based services to more than one million New Yorkers every year across the city’s five boroughs. Our large health system consists of ambulatory centers, acute care centers, post-acute care/long-term care, rehabilitation programs, Home Care, and Correctional Health Services. Our diverse workforce is uniquely focused on empowering New Yorkers, without exception, to live the healthiest life possible.

At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.

Job Description



The Sr. BI Developer will create visually appealing and interactive data visualizations to convey insights and support data-driven decision-making. The developer will use expert data analysis and transformation skills to fully leverage and optimize our data and analytics portfolio. This allows stakeholders as much flexibility as possible to view and dig into their metrics through the proper lens. This role will use strong analytic and problem-solving abilities to translate business requirements into effective visualizations.

General tasks and responsibilities will include:



Responsible for the design, creation, and maintenance of complex reporting solutions to support business needs across the organization
Explore and analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can inform business strategies
Develop an understanding of business processes and operational tools in order to create meaningful dashboard designs
Design and develop creative and complex interactive visualizations utilizing BI applications such as Tableau & Develop multiple prototypes, mock-ups and conceptualization of ideas that bring simplicity and context to complex design challenges
Oracle/SQL skills to create complex joins and awareness of functions & cursors
Good understanding of DataMart/Data warehouse concepts
Analyze, study and understand business domain data requirements, user task flows and objectives and create pixel perfect design solutions for visual data delivery and analysis
Work with the Director of Business Intelligence to create and enforce guidelines and standards
Partner with stakeholders to plan, communicate, and deliver data solutions successfully and timely
Minimum Qualifications



1. A Baccalaureate Degree from an accredited college or university with a major in Computer Science, Systems Engineering, applied Mathematics, Business Administration, Economics/Statistics, Telecommunications, Data Communications, or a related field of study; and
2. Five (5) years of progressive, responsible experience in the field of data processing, computer systems and applications.
Operations Specialty requires supervisory experience (5 years).
Network Services requires a telecommunications background and experience.
3. Broad knowledge and expertise in the characteristics of computers, peripheral devices, communications systems and hardware capabilities, programming languages, E.D.P. applications, systems analysis methodology, data management and retrieval techniques; or
4. A satisfactory equivalent combination of training, education and experience.

Department Preferences
Ability to display complex quantitative and qualitative data in a simple, intuitive format to present findings in a clear manner
Ideal candidate has 5+ years of Business Intelligence experience and 3+ years in dashboarding, reporting, or data analysis
Ability to think about customer and employee needs when evaluating possible solutions
Reflects high ownership and accountability for assigned projects and tasks and meeting tight timelines
Knowledgeable in data visualization best practices and data mining and analysis tools
How To Apply



If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

If applying online, please include your cover letter in the same file attachment with your uploaded resume.

NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
Multiple employee discounts programs

The Role:

We are looking to add a new member to our Operations team. The Analyst will have the opportunity to work closely with Xtract Research’s legal, sales, and client relations groups. The potential candidate should expect to gain an extensive understanding of high yield bonds and leveraged loans.
In this role, the potential candidate will benefit from close collaboration with senior lawyers and management in an entrepreneurial environment while becoming familiar with various types of fixed income securities. This position offers the opportunity for a motivated individual to take ownership of current and developing projects within the operations group as well as gain familiarity with sophisticated legal subjects in fixed income finance.

Key Responsibilities
Maintaining Xtract’s client-facing databases of fixed income covenant data
Collecting data on key features of loans and bonds
Reviewing confidential financial documents and calculate various ratios
Communicating with clients via email and phone in response to enquiries
Receiving, logging, and tracking status of client enquiries
Proof-reading covenant analysis reports prepared by attorneys
Bookmarking key clauses in bond and loan documents
Testing new and existing website functionality

Outstanding reading and writing skills which demonstrate the ability to comprehend sophisticated legal language

Ability to quickly analyze and interpret diverse qualitative and quantitative data
Proficiency with all Microsoft Office software especially Excel

Meticulous attention to detail
Pride in work product

Over 2,000 of the world’s leading corporations, including 50% of the Fortune 500 and 30% of the world’s central banks, trust ION solutions to manage their cash, in-house banking, commodity supply chain, trading and risk.

Primary Responsibilities:

Lead ad-hoc sales operations projects

In-depth knowledge of SalesForce.com
Shown experience in change management principles
Excellent analytical and financial skills; Strong ability to take analysis and synthesize into recommendations which result in executable solutions
Experienced data leadership skills with capability to review, interpret, reconcile and report on large amounts of data
Experience with SQL queries and data visualization tools, a plus

Thinks strategically and analytically, grasps new and ground breaking concepts quickly, and vigilantly finds creative solutions to sophisticated problems

Job Description:
MSK is transforming and modernizing its data centers to a Software Defined Network environment. Do you have proven foundational knowledge and experience with data center-centric networking concepts and technologies? If you are hardworking and interested in being part of an innovative team, this is the perfect role for you!
You will be encouraged to explore the newest technologies available to meet the Hospital’s future needs. The role focuses on modern campus network virtualization, convergence, and security.

You will:
Troubleshoot any switching and routing issues.
Be responsible for installing network equipment, including data racks, patch panels, cable trays, network devices, and components.
Replace faulty network hardware components as needed.
Provide support data center networks using Cisco's Nexus platform, i.e., 7K, 9K, FEX, and Cisco’s Catalyst platform, i.e., 9000- and 4500-series.
Provide support data center networks using Arista platforms, i.e., 7500, 7800, and 7280 series.
Provide support optical networks using Ciena platforms, i.e., 6500 series and 5171.
Communicate with server administrators to quickly identify network-related issues.
You have:
Experience with optical platforms (i.e., Ciena 6500 and Ciena 5171)
Solid understanding of troubleshooting network-related issues (i.e., with span/mirror, tap aggregation, tcpdump, wireshark, etc.)
Experience in implementing large-scale networks with hierarchical (three-layer) internetworking model: access, distribution, and core layers.
Working knowledge in technologies used in Arista switches, i.e., MLAG, CVP.
Proven experience with layer 2 network security technologies, such as port-security, DHCP snooping, 802.1X, NAC, ARP inspection, etc.
Solid grasp of Layer 3 routing protocols, such as OSPF and BGP.
Strong understanding of network applications, i.e., TACACS, DNS, DHCP, IPAM, SMTP, HTTPS, Multicast, SNMP, Syslog, NetFlow, NTP, certificate, etc.
Good understanding of layer 2 extension protocols; OTV and VXLAN.
Nice to have:
Have experience in Linux/Unix and MS Windows servers, Active Directory and LDAP, VMWare, and open-source applications
Basic knowledge of data center areas, including, but not limited to, storage environments (i.e., Islion, NetApp), virtual environments (i.e., dvSwitch, dvPortGroup, VMware), and backup environments (i.e., Cohesity).

Job Title: AVP, Trading Desk Quant (Swaps), Global Markets IT Solutions Team
Job Description:
Do you want your voice heard and your actions to count?

Discover your opportunity with Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), the 7th largest financial group in the world. Across the globe, we’re 160,000 colleagues, striving to make a difference for every client, organization, and community we serve. We stand for our values, building long-term relationships, serving society, and fostering shared and sustainable growth for a better world.

With a vision to be the world’s most trusted financial group, it’s part of our culture to put people first, listen to new and diverse ideas and collaborate toward greater innovation, speed and agility. This means investing in talent, technologies, and tools that empower you to own your career.

Join MUFG, where being inspired is expected and making a meaningful impact is rewarded.

This is a hybrid position. The selected colleague will work at an MUFG office or client sites up to four days per week and work remotely the remaining day(s). A member of our Talent Acquisition team will provide more details.

Job Summary

The main objectives of this Markets Trading Desk Quant (Swaps) in the Global Markets Division of the Americas (GMDA) will be to support the swaps trading desk environment. This role will require a skill set of business analysis and knowledge of Derivatives (Interest Rate Swaps). You will have the opportunity to learn and work closely with Sales, Traders, and various teams in the markets team. You will work in a front office environment, must take initiative to drive results, and support our business.

Major Responsibilities

Expanding pricing tools and improving evaluation models by utilizing quantitative analysis tools and skills such as VBA programming, data mining software, and Object or component-oriented development software to support the swaps trading desk environment;
Leveraging programming (i.e. Python) abilities to extract useful information from imperfect data; Executing statistical analysis with that data. Present statistical and nonstatistical results, using charts, bullets, and graphs, in meetings
Validating the bank's Credit Valuation Adjustment (CVA) and Funding Valuation adjustment (FVA) pricing models
Developing local FVA estimation calculation methodology for the New York branch;
Developing a trading platform for the trading team, working directly with derivatives traders, and liaising with internal technology teams;
Utilizing strong analytical abilities, risk methodology knowledge, and finance and banking knowledge in the development of the trading platform;
Integrating the developed trading platform at each MUFG group level and providing technical support to the trading team in the use of the platform;
Gathering, validating, cleaning, and organizing historical data for the Bank’s trading portfolios;
Applying business logic to a complex data environment, including each derivative products’ definition on the cash flow level based on linking information from different data sources;
Undertaking complex pricing modelling tasks, utilizing derivative products and financial evaluation modelling knowledge, often with sub-optimal or “spotty” data; and
Documenting systems and workflows for the Bank’s derivatives business lines.

Other (Project) Responsibilities:

Ability to take ownership and lead several projects or initiatives simultaneously
Assist with gathering business requirements, testing support and representing Global Market’s position on projects

Qualifications:

A Mathematics related master degree required
A minimum of 3+ years of related experience
Object or component oriented development software — examples C++ Hot technology ; Python Hot technology ; R Hot technology ; SAP PowerBuilder
Knowledge of liner algebra, partial differential equations, stochastic calculus, finite difference method, Monte Carlo Simulation
Knowledge on derivative products (Interest Rate Swaps),
Strong knowledge of MS Office – Excel.
Strong interpersonal skills, ability to work independently, as well as in a team setting.
Strong organizational, analytical and communication skills.
Ability to build strong relationships with various groups in NY and Tokyo.

Additional Preferred Qualifications:

VBA programming skills
Knowledge of SAS Hot technology –or- StataCorp Stata –or- The MathWorks MATLAB Hot technology –or- XLISP-STAT
Prior experience working on a Markets / Trading environment.

The typical base pay range for this role is between $110K - $145K depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience and location. This role may also be eligible for certain discretionary performance-based bonus and/or incentive compensation. Job Summary

The Business Analyst will document technical solutions to business challenges, to advance the company's efforts, by defining, analyzing and documenting requirements. The Business Analyst will follow the proper process and procedures by using the templated project artifacts and carrying out the project activities as stipulated by the IT Program Management Office.

Responsibilities

. Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task and workflow analysis.

. Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.

. Proactively communicate and collaborate with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements and deliver the following artifacts as needed: Functional requirements (Business Requirements Document), Use Cases, Use Interface Document, User Stories

. Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously and capable of managing projects of various sizes and complexity

. Work independently with users to define concepts and partner with Project Managers

. Drive and challenge business units on their assumptions of how they will successfully execute their plans

. Serves as the conduit between the customer community (internal and external customers) and the software development team through which requirements flow.

. Develop requirements specifications according to standard templates, using natural language.

. Create test cases from user scenarios and assume the testing lead role when necessary

. Ability to collaborate with senior leadership, senior technologists, Business Partners and people at all levels to define business processes, analyze operational efficiencies, implement creative solutions and measure delivery results

. Understands the business processes associated with the project and ensure the solution is designed and built to meet business requirements

. Act as the liaison between the business units, technology teams and support teams.




JOB REQUIREMENTS

Education

§ Bachelor's degree in Business (or Management), Computer Science, or related discipline, or equivalent work experience is required




Knowledge, Skills and Experience

. 4+ years of experience with formal Business Analysis



Certified Business Analyst Professional (CBAP) certification helpful
Strong process orientation with significant attention to detail and ability to document complex business processes
Effective interpersonal skills with ability to participate in and lead "Virtual" teams
Knowledge of relational databases, data warehousing, business intelligence and CRM tools helpful
Experience in using enterprise-wide requirements definition and management systems and methodologies required
Strong analytical skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts.
Advanced skills in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Visio
Working knowledge of collaboration and work management tools (Teams, Confluence, Jira, Smartsheet, etc.)
Working knowledge of Project Management processes, tools and techniques in an organization with multiple projects varying in size and complexity

Job Title

Technical Business Analysis - Professional II

What does a successful Technical Business Analyst do at Fiserv?

The Technical Business Analyst will facilitate requirement gathering, project consultations with end clients and turn those requirements into Service Requests to initiate project assignment by respective implementation teams. The role requires the candidate to process a specified volume of project intakes while leveraging their abilities to collaborate, coordinate and execute in a timely manner. A successful candidate can work independently, and as a member of a team, enjoying a fast-paced, problem-solving environment. The ideal candidate is analytical and capable of meeting the expectations of Fiserv’s financial institutions and management team.

The Card Services business at Fiserv provides complete debit, credit and ATM payment services to financial institutions as well as Accel®, a premier payments network. Our products, services and strategies allow our clients to maximize revenue, increase customer acquisition, improve retention, reduce expense, minimize risk and increase share of wallet.

What you will do:

Under direct supervision, support multiple client requests for product and service adds.

Works with our clients and Account Executives to gather the necessary details to execute accurate and timely Service Requests

Participates in client kickoff, requirements and data gathering sessions.

Drives implementation of SR tool requests

Attends weekly conference calls or meetings with business units, project managers, clients and other internal teams to provide status, report risks and review issues that jeopardize the installation timeline.

Comprehends, supports and follows the standard Card Services process for implementation and projects.

Communicates SR and project status to the appropriate internal and external departments.

What you will need to have:

Bachelor’s Degree with relevant work experience or 5-7 years of relevant work experience

1-2 years of experience in implementations, business systems analysis, project management or coordination.

1-2 years of experience working in a customer service oriented or time-sensitive environment driven by project timelines.

Strong analytical, organizational and time management skills.

Solid verbal and written communication skills. Ability to multi-task and manage multiple requests simultaneously.

Ability to maintain a professional attitude and demeanor in high pressure situations.

Experience working with the MS Office Suite of products: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook

Self-starter who can work effectively, both independently and in a team environment.

This role is not eligible to be performed in Colorado, California, New York or Washington.

Job Title: Senior Associate, Corporate Tax Lead Business Analyst (BA)
Job Description:
Overview
The Tax Compliance Quality Assurance (TCQA) Team is seeking a future team member for the role of Senior Associate, Lead Business Analyst. This role is located in New York, Hybrid.
The Business Analyst (BA) will interact with Business users, Relationship Managers, Senior Management, Operations, Technology and Support Teams regularly, to provide support for a newly launched U.S. Tax Form W-8/W-9 Documentation Tool. The BA will contribute to the continuous development and improvement of the Tool, set up grooming sessions to discuss future enhancements, and ensure rigorous testing is performed prior to any roll outs. The BA will also play a large role performing project management functions. Specifically, the BA will be tasked with driving business planning, ensuring projects stay on schedule and providing regular updates to the stakeholder community.

In this role, you’ll make an impact in the following ways:
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand and document the ‘current state’ of tax functions/processes, and any BAU challenges.
Conduct independent reviews of business processes, data quality issues, and propose process improvements.
Draft business requirements, functional documents, and technical user stories.
Work closely with team members to develop test plans and create detailed test cases in JIRA
Assist with User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and defect management.
Develop user manuals/documentation and provide training to stakeholders using the U.S. Tax Form W-8/W-9 Documentation Tool.
Assist with the onboarding and user provisioning of new clients to the U.S. Tax Form W-8/W-9 Documentation Tool.
Assist with data review and clean up exercises.
Lead periodic meetings with stakeholders and assist with updating monthly decks which includes timelines, project updates, accomplishments risks, issues, and dependencies.
Qualifications
Bachelor‘s Degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required.
Familiarity with project management methodologies including Agile and Waterfall.
Good organizational and time management skills.
Experience leading requirement gathering sessions, taking meeting notes and documenting any new requirements from those sessions.
Attention to detail and ability to work independently.
Proficiency in MS Office suite.
Analytical skills and proficiency in analysing exceptionally large datasets.
Experience with all phases of the Software Development Life Cycle
3-5 years of total work experience preferred.
1 - 5 years business/data analyst experience
1 - 5 years of project management experience

Preferred qualifications include experience/familiarity with:
Tax Information Reporting and Withholding (e.g., 1446f, FATCA, NRA, BUW, 8966 Reporting)
IRS Tax forms W-8/W-9, due diligence, and various tax onboarding, withholding reporting requirements.
Tax operating model transformation, including process improvements.
Project Management Professional (PMP) certification and/or Prince2 certification
Experience with PowerBI, Power Query, UIPath,

As a direct report to the Access Assurance Operations Lead within Data Protection, you will be a part of the team responsible for Data Defense and Access Assurance (DDAA). As a Senior Access Assurance Operations Analyst, you will be responsible for supporting the Access Assurance Operations Lead along with a team of cross-functional cyber, privacy, engineering, and data protection analysts to define, implement, manage, and measure controls to protect data in accordance with relevant geographical regulations, contractual commitments, and confidentiality requirements.

Responsibilities

Design global access management program that addresses data residency and fine-grained, role-based access requirements and controls as necessitated by business need and regulations
Build and review technical and functional requirements for in-house or external technologies to support access management and assurance needs, including applying appropriate security measures
Design and implement the access review process, ensuring that access is reviewed regularly both for appropriateness of access as well as privilege levels for all users
Implement and enforce mechanisms to proactively monitor, respond and report on inappropriate data access events
Interact with users to define access standards and/or necessary modifications to new or existing access policies or roles in support of data security standards
Develop and maintain data residency and data access requirements and controls as necessitated by business needs and regulations
Develop use cases and integrate access management technologies with related cybersecurity technologies (e.g., security incident and event management, data classification, vulnerability management)
Lead interactions with Risk and Compliance to understand control requirements and provide information to support findings for non-compliance with internal security policies
Responsible for designing and reporting key metrics and visualizations for weekly, monthly and bimonthly cadences across multiple audiences
Qualifications

Bachelors’ Degree or industry equivalent work experience
4-7 years applicable experience
Demonstrate ability to quickly assimilate to new knowledge and remain current on new developments in cybersecurity capabilities and industry knowledge
Experience building and growing a team to meet strategic and tactical objectives; mentoring and coaching staff
In-depth experience in designing and deploying access management technologies and controls in enterprise-class organizations, including the following:
Access management on Windows and Linux operating systems
Access management on multiple database types (e.g., MySQL, Hive, Redis)
Securing access to data across multiple geographical locations
Applications built on a microservices architecture
Role and policy based access controls to enforce the principle of least privilege
Provisioning, modifying, and de-provisioning account access
Ability to write scripts, configure tools, work with APIs and databases

Job Summary:
This position is responsible for analyzing, understanding and translating business needs into business/technical requirements. Leads and coordinates teams of other resources to ensure alignment of technical solutions with business requirements for medium to complex issues (quantity and magnitude).

Leads the validation of requirements against identified and defined business needs, maintaining requirements for future reuse, traces requirements from business case to implemented solution

Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) Certification or PMI Professional in Business Analysis (PMI-PBA) strongly preferred. If you do not have either certification it is strongly preferred that you obtain one within 18 months of hire.

Skills:

Requires excellent verbal and written communication skills
Requires knowledge of programming, development, and technical architecture

$93,000 - $127,050

Job Title: Senior Financial Analyst - Workplace Operations - Finance & Administration
Job Description:
The energy of a newsroom, the pace of a trading floor, the buzz of a recent tech breakthrough; we work hard, and we work fast - while keeping up the quality and accuracy we're known for. It's what keeps us inventing and reinventing, all the time. Our culture is wide open, just like our spaces. We bring out the best in each other through collaboration. Through our countless volunteer projects, we also help network with the communities around us, too. You can do amazing work here. Work you couldn't do anywhere else. It's up to you to make it happen.

What's the role?

Bloomberg's Workplace Operations business works hand-in-hand with internal functions to support them in achieving success and maintaining efficiency in keeping our workplaces well-maintained, moving our people safely between global locations and keeping our employees, assets and networks secured. Our CFO team provides critical financial advisory to the Workplace Operations, Real Estate and Supply Chain teams in support of the business.

We are evolving our Finance function and leveraging Finance Transformation as a tool to advance our output to Bloomberg and are seeking an experienced professional to join the team.

As a key contributor, you will have the opportunity to drive change while delivering a unique blend of financial and operational analysis, financial modeling, reporting, and senior management support for a fast-paced and pioneering technology based financial services business.

We'll trust you to:



Support development and prioritization of key finance transformation activities in order to track performance of business plans and strategic initiatives
Develop and maintain KPIs and business metrics
Draft quarterly financial updates, annual operating plans, and other business planning presentations
Manage FP&A requirements in adherence to corporate requirements and processes
Oversee resource management, resource allocations and resource related reporting and analysis
Support the development of members of the finance team



You'll need to have:




4+ years' experience in financial analysis
BA/BS in Finance or a related field
Advanced financial modeling and data visualization skills
Advanced excel, VBA including macros and desktop/process automation skills
Demonstrated experience driving finance transformation within established, fast-paced environments
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills
Excellent communication skills with the ability to influence outcomes of issues and projects
Experience carrying out complex work with autonomy and make decisions within scope of responsibilities

Degree in a quantitative subject: Finance, Economics, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics

Domain knowledge in commercial real estate, facilities, and infrastructure management
Flexibility to work in an entrepreneurial and fast-moving environment

Job Title: Senior Business Analyst (Fixed Income: Rates/Credits/Swap)-Vice President
Job Description:
SMBC Group is a top-tier global financial group. Headquartered in Tokyo and with a 400-year history, SMBC Group offers a diverse range of financial services, including banking, leasing, securities, credit cards, and consumer finance. The Group has more than 130 offices and 80,000 employees worldwide in nearly 40 countries. Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group, Inc. (SMFG) is the holding company of SMBC Group, which is one of the three largest banking groups in Japan. SMFG’s shares trade on the Tokyo, Nagoya, and New York (NYSE: SMFG) stock exchanges.


In the Americas, SMBC Group has a presence in the US, Canada, Mexico, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, and Peru. Backed by the capital strength of SMBC Group and the value of its relationships in Asia, the Group offers a range of commercial and investment banking services to its corporate, institutional, and municipal clients. It connects a diverse client base to local markets and the organization’s extensive global network. The Group’s operating companies in the Americas include Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corp. (SMBC), SMBC Nikko Securities America, Inc., SMBC Capital Markets, Inc., SMBC Rail Services LLC, Manufacturers Bank, JRI America, Inc., SMBC Leasing and Finance, Inc., Banco Sumitomo Mitsui Brasileiro S.A., and Sumitomo Mitsui Finance and Leasing Co., Ltd.


The anticipated salary range for this role is between $114,000.00 and $185,000.00. The specific salary offered to an applicant will be based on their individual qualifications, experiences, and an analysis of the current compensation paid in their geography and the market for similar roles at the time of hire. The role may also be eligible for an annual discretionary incentive award. In addition to cash compensation, SMBC offers a competitive portfolio of benefits to its employees.

Role Description

SMBC is in process of leading a Digital Transformation across our Americas Division as we continue to modernize our technology, focus on our data driven approach, grow and plan for the future. As a result of this expansion, we are seeking an experienced Technical BA to join our Front Office Technology team.

The Front Office Business Analyst is responsible for liaising between front office business users and technologists to exchange information in a concise, logical and understandable way in coordination with the Technology team. The objective of this role is to evaluate new IT developments and evolving business requirements and recommend appropriate systems alternatives and/or enhancements to current systems by analyzing business processes, systems and industry standards.

Role Objectives
Work closely with Sales & Trading, and Control Function departments
Provide input during development and implementation phases, including formulation and definition of system scope, objectives and necessary system enhancements for complex, high-impact projects
Identify and communicate risks and impacts and propose risk mitigation options, considering business implications of the applications of technology to the current environment
Work directly with the Sales & Trading Desk to help find remedies to alleviate day-to-day issues
Analyze gaps in current flows to help with analysis of move to potential new platforms
Work with vendors to verify functional requirements and testing of new or updates to existing software products
Qualifications and Skills
Essential skills:

5 years in Interest Rate and Credit cash/derivative trading/risk as a business analyst in front office
Solid knowledge of broker-dealer/investment banking environment, sales & trade flows and eTrading domain experience
Understanding of market data, market making, and pre-trade concepts
Analytical skills to troubleshoot a variety of symptoms, diagnose problems, and test, recommend and implement solutions to technology problems
Forward thinker who seeks to improve business processes that deliver better services
Ability to convey complex information to both technical and nontechnical audiences

Desired skills:

SQL and relational DB experience nice to have
Investment banking experience in the trading or pricing domains, with Front-office trading tools exposure and a good understanding of trade flow
Ability to take an organization to a position of industry leading innovation
Ability to engage and influence stakeholders at all levels within an organization, within and outside technology
Ability to work collaboratively and enjoy working in a fast-paced technical environment
Strong work ethic and dedication to meet target dates.
Strong negotiation, problem solving, time management and troubleshooting skills
Detail-oriented, independent and able to adjust to changing priorities
Additional Requirements

D&I Commitment

Responsible for fostering a culture of diversity and inclusion, holding leaders accountable for creating an inclusive environment through awareness and practice of equity in recruiting, developing, and promoting diverse talent.

SMBC’s employees participate in a hybrid workforce model that provides employees with an opportunity to work from home, as well as, from an SMBC office. SMBC requires that employees live within a reasonable commuting distance of their office location. Prospective candidates will learn more about their specific hybrid work schedule during their interview process.


We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. SMBC provides reasonable accommodations for employees and applicants with disabilities consistent with applicable law. If you need a reasonable accommodation during the application process, please let us know at accommodations@smbcgroup.com.

Job Title: Specialist, Business of IT Product / Business Analyst (Hybrid)
Job Description:
Job Description

IT powers our company to save and improve lives. Within our Company IT, the IT Strategy Realization team’s purpose is to lead value-driven outcomes and accelerate how we transform IT. ITSR does this by delivering on six core capabilities: IT Strategy, IT Value Management, IT Product Management, Talent Enablement, IT Communications & Change Management, and IT Continuous Improvement.

The Specialist, Product/Business Analyst is an entry-level role within IT Strategy Realization. This individual will support the analysis of business needs and assist in the development of digital and technology solutions. The Specialist will report to the Associate Director of Product/Business Analyst and will contribute to the achievement of our Company's IT Strategy goals.

A partial list of responsibilities includes the following:

Assist in gathering and documenting business requirements.

Perform basic analysis of existing business processes.

Support the design and development of digital and technology solutions.

Conduct research to gather information on industry trends and best practices.

Assist in project management tasks such as timeline tracking and resource coordination.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver project milestones.

Stay updated on emerging technologies and industry developments.

Support the execution of training programs for stakeholders.

Limited travel may be required.

Education Minimum Requirement:

High School Diploma required.

Required Experience and Skills:

1+ years of experience in business analysis, product management, or a related field (internships and entry-level positions can be counted).

Basic understanding of business processes.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Good communication and teamwork skills.

Preferred Experience and Skills:

Interest in the pharmaceutical or healthcare industry.

Experience with business process modeling.

Experience with developing user stories.

Experience with user-centric design.

Understanding of organizational change management principles.

Familiarity with agile methodologies and tools is a plus.

Experience working within a product organization.
