Job Title: Analyst, Sales Strategy and Operations Support, Investment Solutions Investor Relations
Job Description:
Basic information
Job Name:
Analyst, Sales Strategy and Operations Support, Investment Solutions Investor Relations
Location:
New York/OVA
Line of Business:
Investment Solutions
Job Function:
Investor Relations
Date:
Saturday, April 1, 2023
Position Summary

Segment Profile: Carlyle Global Investment Solutions (AlpInvest Partners)

Carlyle’s Global Investment Solutions (GIS) segment (known as AlpInvest Partners) helps investors meet their objectives through tailored portfolio construction and rigorous investment selection. AlpInvest ($65bn in AUM), seeks to provide investors with access to the global private markets through primary, secondary, and co-investment opportunities across a range of strategies. The Firm has Fund offerings in the Private Equity Secondary, Co-Investment, and Portfolio Finance markets, and also works with large institutional investors in Separately managed account / Fund-of-One structures. GIS approximately 180 employees based in New York, Amsterdam, and Hong Kong.





Fund or Department Description

The GIS Investor Relations (“IR”) team is responsible for IR-related activities across the segment, as well as new business development and fundraising activities across both Commingled Funds in Secondaries, Co-investments, and Portfolio Finance, and Separately managed / custom accounts (“SMA”) with large institutions. The IR team consists of 22 professionals with different nationalities, of which ten are female, working closely together on global business development and investor relations, based in New York, Amsterdam, Hong Kong and Tokyo.


Position Summary

The Carlyle Group seeks to hire a Senior Analyst within the Global Investment Solutions Investor Relations team. The position will primarily support GIS IR leadership team and the Carlyle Private Equity sales force in developing detailed, strategic marketing plans by region, client and product. The position will support the life cycle of a sale (from planning to closing). Finally, the position will periodically assist the GIS Product Specialists with responding to investor requests as needed. Interaction with limited partners and potential investors will be required to complete various assignments. This successful candidate must be able to prioritize multiple tasks and work under pressure in a deadline-oriented environment.

Responsibilities

Primary Responsibilities

IR Strategy / Sales Support
Assist IR leadership team with ongoing development and maintenance with Americas Sales Coverage plan, and driving its execution
Ownership of firmwide fundraising reports and updates to senior leadership
Assist leadership with evaluation of new product development initiatives
Assist with preparation of broader sales strategy, including integration / coordination of Carlyle relationship managers
Partner with consultant relations team in preparation and execution of firmwide sales approach as new products are approved
Assist Product Specialist team with cross platform / strategic proposals for custom partnerships
Assist the Carlyle Private wealth team in the onboarding of potential partners

Investor Meetings and Events, assist with onsite investor meetings and conferences by:
Creating and distributing pre-meeting briefings to meeting participants
Coordinating with presenters from other business units
Distributing marketing and other relevant materials
Attending meetings, preparing draft meeting notes for upload to DealCloud (CRM system), and following up on investor requests.
Developing and maintaining professional relationships with Client Relationship Managers, Fund Management and Legal

CRM Support
Working with individual relationship managers to develop marketing plans by investment and product. Leverage market research from Preqin and other sources
Addressing investor requests and coordinating with CRM to ensure clients are receiving timely and accurate responses to questions
Organizing and executing the many aspects required to launch a new fund to internal constituents and external investors
Coordinating amongst the sales force, to aggregate target lists, organize client outreach and follow up, and categorize investor interest for presentation to Fund Heads and Senior Management




Qualifications

Requirements

Education & Certificates

Bachelor’s degree required
Minimum 3.3 GPA

Professional Experience

2+ years of prior experience in Investor Relations, Financial Services or related field
Experience in investor relations at an alternatives investment firm, a alternatives placement firm, consulting firm, investment bank or other asset management firm preferred
A strong understanding of financial markets and experience working with fundraisers for private markets strategies
Demonstrated ability to work effectively as part of a team

Competencies & Attributes

Advanced Microsoft Office (including Excel and PowerPoint) skills
Advanced proficiency on CRM software (DealCloud/Salesforce)
Experience with Customer Relationship Management system
Organized and practical, can turn high level direction into tasks to execute
Strong organizational skills and detail oriented; attention to detail
Flexibility to handle multiple tasks and changing priorities
Thoughtful and client-savvy, able to understand nuances of sales / LP lifecycle
Proactive, can independently identify necessary information or materials for meetings
Support-oriented, willing to jump in, can perform basic analyses to drive insight
Resourceful and collaborative, can leverage resources across the function
Detail oriented and responsible; Self-Starter






Benefits/Compensation

The compensation range for this role is specific to New York City and takes into account a wide range of factors including but not limited to the skill sets required/preferred; prior experience and training; licenses and/or certifications.

The anticipated base salary range for this role is $125,000.

In addition to the base salary, the hired professional will enjoy a comprehensive benefits package spanning retirement benefits, health insurance, life insurance and disability, paid time off, paid holidays, family planning benefits and various wellness programs. Additionally, the hired professional may also be eligible to participate in an annual discretionary incentive program, the award of which will be dependent on various factors, including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance.

*****

Due to the high volume of candidates, please be advised that only candidates selected to interview will be contacted by The Carlyle Group.




Company Information

The Carlyle Group (NASDAQ: CG) is a global investment firm with $373 billion of assets under management and more than half of the AUM managed by women, across 543 investment vehicles as of December 31st, 2022. Founded in 1987 in Washington, DC, Carlyle has grown into one of the world's largest and most successful investment firms, with more than 2,100 professionals operating in 29 offices in North America, South America, Europe, the Middle East, Asia and Australia. Carlyle places an emphasis on development, retention and inclusion as supported by our internal processes and seven Employee Resource Groups (ERGs). Carlyle's purpose is to invest wisely and create value on behalf of its investors, which range from public and private pension funds to wealthy individuals and families to sovereign wealth funds, unions and corporations. Carlyle invests across three segments - Global Private Equity, Global Credit and Investment Solutions - and has expertise in various industries, including: aerospace, defense & government services, consumer & retail, energy, financial services, healthcare, industrial, real estate, technology & business services, telecommunications & media and transportation.


At Carlyle, we know that diverse teams perform better, so we seek to create a community where we continually exchange insights, embrace different perspectives and leverage diversity as a competitive advantage. That is why we are committed to growing and cultivating teams that include people with a variety of perspectives, people who provide unique lenses through which to view potential deals, support and run our business.

Job Title: Revenue Cycle Quality Assurance Analyst (Clinical Business Analyst Level 2), Revenue Cycle Administration
Job Description:
About NYC Health + Hospitals



Empower Every New Yorker — Without Exception — to Live the Healthiest Life Possible

NYC Health + Hospitals is the largest public health care system in the United States. We provide essential outpatient, inpatient and home-based services to more than one million New Yorkers every year across the city’s five boroughs. Our large health system consists of ambulatory centers, acute care centers, post-acute care/long-term care, rehabilitation programs, Home Care, and Correctional Health Services. Our diverse workforce is uniquely focused on empowering New Yorkers, without exception, to live the healthiest life possible.

At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.

Job Description



The Revenue Cycle Quality Assurance Analyst reports to the Director of Revenue Cycle Quality Assurance. This position supports quality auditing, analysis, reporting and the development of plans that lead to positive outcomes. The position also requires engagement in working on risk identification, diagnosing issues, identifying process improvement solutions and process improvement implementation methods utilizing sound principles. Continuous engagement and collaboration with leadership is essential.

Summary of Dutires and Responsiblities:

Coordinate and effectively deliver comprehensive quality audits for NYC H+H revenue cycle practices
Responsible for conducting routine quality audits based on both random and targeted sampling of data
Perform quality assurance (QA) reviews of revenue cycle operations and data integrity (i.e., end to end financial assistance screening, pre-registration/registration, financial clearance, insurance and denials management, claim and account detail) reviewing accuracy, timeliness and appropriateness standards.
Ensure quality standards are measurable and can be achieved
Ensure quality standards are met and maintained
Identify opportunities for improvement and provide recommendations to management
Collaborate with managers on monitoring quality of customer (i.e., patient, guarantors) phone calls
Solve moderately complex problems and/or conduct moderately complex analyses
Seek to achieve maximum quality and efficiency
Act as a central resource providing guidance and direction to departments regarding policies, regulatory topics, compliance requirements, quality standards and best practices.
Translate concepts into practice
Collaborate with the Revenue Cycle Institute for personnel requiring additional education
Work with facility managers to coordinate training needs for staff, including enrolling personnel in classes via NYC H+H’s ELM
Provide coaching and training feedback in a clear and concise manner, utilizing training/reference guides when applicable.
Support the analysis of quality auditing findings as it relates to business process information (e.g., metrics; analytics) to identify risks, key issues, trends, potential root causes, and performance improvement opportunities. Proactively communicate urgent risks, as needed.
Compile productivity data for employees who are subject to the QA review process, and prepare management communication reports.
Prepare and maintain resource materials, and tip sheets to support employees’ learning needs
Identify inefficiencies and process gaps that are contributing to decreases in performance, and recommend best practices for ongoing process improvement.
Promote concepts of accountability, proactive work, and prioritization.
Maintain QA files based on management guidance
Consult with manager on operational procedures which lead to improvement of the overall efficiency and quality of data and practices
Participate in the development of enterprise wide revenue cycle policies and procedures
Maintain in-depth knowledge of department policies and standard operating procedures (SOPs)
Commute to H+H facilities as designated by management to observe workflows, communicate standardize practices, and support staff on requirements.
Maintain a high degree of accuracy along with attention to detail
Have excellent oral and written communication skills, and strong interpersonal skills.
Work in a collaborative, ethical and professional manner across organizational lines.
Prioritize assignments and meet stringent deadlines
Perform related duties as assigned by manager.
Minimum Qualifications



1. A Masters degree or advanced clinical degree from an accredited college or university and one (1) year of experience gathering and documenting business, clinical, and/or functional requirements using interviews, document analysis, workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, scenarios, business analysis, task and workflow analysis or related in a clinical, allied health, non-allied health, behavioral health, information technology, information services, business, analytics or related area; or, one (1) year of experience in a relevant clinical and/or healthcare administration role/function; or
2. A Baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university and three (3) years of experience as described above; or
3. A satisfactory combination of education, training, and experience.
4. Specialty certification(s) issued by a national commercially available program, state, professional society, academic or technical institution in an area(s) listed above, may be credited on a month-to-month basis toward the required work experience for a total of one (1) year.

Department Preferences



Knowledgeable in:

Quality Assurance/Quality management (i.e., Six Sigma, Lean)
Statistical analysis
Facilitating meetings/sessions
KPI concepts
Problem solving skills
Healthcare Revenue Cycle Management
Commercial and government health insurance
Epic EMR

Computer Programs/Software Operated

EPIC
Microsoft Office Applications: Outlook, Power Point, Excel, Word, Visio
WebEx
PeopleSoft ELM
Reporting related software
How To Apply



If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

If applying online, please include your cover letter in the same file attachment with your uploaded resume.

NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
Multiple employee discounts programs

ABOUT UPCLEAR

UpClear delivers a SaaS revenue management platform that is used by some of the most recognizable consumer goods brands in the world. Our system supports Trade Promotion Management, Trade Promotion Optimization, Integrated Business Planning and Revenue Management.

We serve more than 80 brands in over 30 countries. Our growth is substantial and consistent; we have been on the Inc 5000 list of fastest growing private companies for nine years in a row.

UpClear's global headquarters is in New York City and we have satellite offices in London, Paris, and Hong Kong.


Responsibilities
support release process: testing, training, communication to business users (client success teams, clients' end-users)
develop business requirements for software evolutions, and present to solution and product teams
develop test scripts and execute user acceptance testing
work with product and engineering teams to resolve issues

Requirements

Bachelor's degree or equivalent
software experience, as system analyst or support associate
experience with software development tools (DevOps, Asana)
high attention to detail, excellent verbal and written communication skills

Benefits

Be part of a growing global SaaS company, with offices in NYC, London, Paris, Hong-Kong
Work on latest Cloud technology and build architecture for fast-growing Tech
Weekly happy hours, good office culture, global cross team collaboration, direct access to executive leadership for guidance.
Various Health Care Plans you can choose from to best fits your needs (Medical, Dental & Vision)
Retirement Plan with company match (401k, IRA)
Generous Paid Time Off package that grows with seniority (Vacation, Sick, and Public Holidays)
Paid Maternity leave
Paid Parental bonding leave
One month paid sabbatical after five continuous years of work at Upclear
Compensation: $60K - $90K

The salary range listed is a good faith determination of potential base compensation that may be offered to a successful applicant for this position at the time of this job advertisement and may be modified in the future. When determining a team member's base salary several factors may be considered as applicable including, but not limited to, relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority.

Job Title: Global Private Bank Lending Solutions Business Manager Vice President
Job Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION


J.P. Morgan Asset & Wealth Management Finance and Business Management (AWM F&BM) has a new opening for a Business Manager based in New York. This position will report directly to the Global Head Solutions Business Management with dotted line accountability to the Head of GPB (Global Private Bank) Lending Solutions. The Lending Solutions team provides tailored financing solutions to clients, ranging from securities-based lines of credit to custom financing.

As the GPB (Global Private Bank) Lending Solutions Business Manager, you will be part of a global team with a presence in New York, London, Hong Kong and India within the Finance and Business Management organization. You will partner closely with the Head of the GPB Lending Solutions business and manage strategic initiatives, prepare analyses for leadership presentations and support day-to-day activities. You will also collaborate closely with partners in the Front Office, Legal, Compliance, Finance, Technology, Operations and Marketing.

Job responsibilities:

Lead business agenda for GPB Lending Solutions while covering strategic initiatives, sales management, risk and controls
Champion GPB products and priorities by collaborating with markets and advisors on sales management
Represent Lending Solutions on various regulatory and control initiatives and coordinate/communicate changes to internal policies and procedures
Present fact-based findings and compelling recommendations in a business-friendly way that identifies issues, explains root-cause and identifies potential solutions
Act as a chief of staff for the Head of GPB Lending Solutions, managing agendas and follow-ups
Manage overall business risk by identifying inter-connectivity across processes and collaborating with partners and functions (e.g.Credit Underwriting, Risk, Credit Operations, Technology, Legal and Compliance) to resolve production, quality or risk related issues

Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills:

Ability to prioritize across multiple deliverables concurrently and execute within deadlines
Experience in presenting priorities, initiatives and updates to senior management
Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience
8+ years working experience preferred

Preferred qualifications, capabilities, and skills:

An interest in business management, project management, and business analysis
Knowledge of global markets and solutions used by affluent or high net worth individuals and families
Ability to understand and analyze business processes, products, and initiatives to identify risks, improve processes, and develop innovative solutions

As a member of Asset & Wealth Management Finance and Business Management (AWM F&BM) you are an integral part of our efforts to strategically manage capital, drive growth and efficiencies, maintain financial reporting and proactively manage risk. By providing information, analysis and recommendations to improve results and drive decisions, our teams ensure the company can navigate all types of market conditions while protecting our fortress balance sheet.

At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we’re building a Finance and Business Management organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. if you're ready to put your passion for Business Management to work in a way that makes a real difference, apply today.

ABOUT US

JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world’s most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents and perspectives that they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. Job Title: Senior Operations and Budget Analyst (Senior Systems Analyst (Finance)), Humanitarian Emergency Response and Relief Center (HERRC) *Temporary/Grant Funded*
Job Description:
About NYC Health + Hospitals



Empower Every New Yorker — Without Exception — to Live the Healthiest Life Possible

NYC Health + Hospitals is the largest public health care system in the United States. We provide essential outpatient, inpatient and home-based services to more than one million New Yorkers every year across the city’s five boroughs. Our large health system consists of ambulatory centers, acute care centers, post-acute care/long-term care, rehabilitation programs, Home Care, and Correctional Health Services. Our diverse workforce is uniquely focused on empowering New Yorkers, without exception, to live the healthiest life possible.

At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.

Job Description



NYC Health and Hospitals (H+H) has been tasked to operationalize and manage several Humanitarian Emergency Response and Relief Center (HERRC) facilities to offer direct service provision, resource navigation, and temporary respite for single adults, adult families, and families with children seeking asylum in the United States.

The Senior Operations and Budget Analyst will help ensure that the HERRC program is adequately developing and documenting financial systems and decisions. The Senior Operations and Budget Analyst will also help develop standard processes across operational areas including budgeting, reporting, and grant submissions.

Under supervision of the Assistant Director of Financial Planning and Analysis, the Senior Operations and Budget Analyst will be responsible for tasks including, but not limited to:

Summary of Duties and Responsibilities:

Collect and manage financial data in support of documentation for funding sources such as FEMA or OMB
Support budget modeling, financial reporting, and tracking and monitoring of budget versus actuals for internal and external stakeholders
Plan and facilitate meetings with finance, legal, HR, supply chain, and other H+H departments to ensure that program is able to meet operational and business needs for reimbursement
Ensure operational systems and reporting/data structures meet programmatic needs; support the creation of new reporting tools
Coordinate with administrative teams, programmatic teams, and relevant vendors to ensure clear, consistent, and achievable goals are set and met
Provide in-depth support on operational logistics including project management, team management, and vendor management
Minimum Qualifications



1. A Baccalaureate Degree in a relevant field from an accredited college or university; and,
2. Two years of experience in business, government, hospital, educational or a non-profit organization in analysis, development and implementation of systems and sub-systems. Familiarity with EDP applications and data processing programs; or,
3. A Masters Degree in Management, Business Administration or approved related fields from an accredited college or university may be equated to a maximum of one year of related experience; or,
4. A satisfactory combination of education, training and experience.

Department Preferences
Analytic and technical reporting capabilities.
Ability to work well under the pressure of deadlines and the stress of undertaking multiple projects at one time
Ability to distill complex issues into simple, coherent ideas
Strong organizational skills
Excellent interpersonal skills, with proven ability to forge and deepen effective working relationships across a broad set of stakeholders
How To Apply



If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

If applying online, please include your cover letter in the same file attachment with your uploaded resume.

NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
Multiple employee discounts programs

Analyzes, verifies, authorizes, processes and reports related financial information in support of a specific field or a business unit operation. Designs, develops and implements systems or procedures resulting in the accurate reporting financial or system data.

Job Responsibility

Analyzes, verifies, tracks and reports on financial indicators (e.g. accounts receivables, account coding and charging, cash flow, budgets, GL, P&L, statistical data and reserves) in support of a specific field or business unit operation.
Reports on results on monthly, quarterly and/or annual basis.

Responsible for maintaining proprietary databases including data integrity, timeliness of data input and accuracy of data.
Conducts internal audits to ensure compliance to departmental policies and procedures, and state and federal regulations.
Maintains compliance with various state, federal, and industry standards and regulations.
Operates under general guidance and work assignments are varied and require interpretation and independent decisions on course of action.
Performs related duties as required. All responsibilities noted here are considered essential functions of the job under the Americans with Disabilities Act. Duties not mentioned here, but considered related are not essential functions.

Job Qualification

Bachelor's Degree required, or equivalent combination of education and related experience.
1-3 years of relevant experience, required.
3-5 years of accounting experience in ledger reports, excel and analyzing data, preferred.

Overview:
Our team members are the heart of what makes us better.


At Hackensack Meridian Health we help our patients live better, healthier lives — and we help one another to succeed. With a culture rooted in connection and collaboration, our employees are team members. Here, competitive benefits are just the beginning. The Information Technology (IT) Solutions Analyst is responsible for matching potential technology solutions with defined business needs for incoming IT project requests for the Hackensack Meridian Health (HMH) network. Provides quick response to business partners and facilitates getting the correct information for the Project Intake Process by working with the operational requestors, internal Information Technology (IT) division team members, and outside vendors. This includes ensuring that sufficient information regarding the high level project scope and level of effort is collected to allow requests to be reviewed by the appropriate governance team for approval, rejection, or additional scoping.

This position is hybrid with 2-4 times per month onsite. Ideal candidates should be able to pivot quickly to be onsite if the need arises.

The ideal candidate will have demonstrated experience in gathering requirements for new/existing projects and has experience in the Healthcare industry.
Responsibilities:
A day in the life of a Information Technology (IT) Solutions Analyst at Hackensack Meridian Health includes:
Liaise between the IT division, business and clinical operational areas, and technology vendors.
Understand current technology portfolio and standards across the network.
Recognize the need to develop a new technology standard.
Analyze business needs to understand requested project scope.
Assess IT resource needs and level of effort to support requested project scope.
Collaborate with Business Analyst to develop high level project cost information to inform the appropriate IT governing bodies.
Analyze the design of technical systems and business models.
Match technological solutions to business needs.
Produce reports on project intake queues and escalate as needed to eliminate delays in the intake process.
Analyze data to inform business decisions.
Assist with preparing and delivering project request presentations to appropriate IT governing bodies.
Other duties and/or projects as assigned.
Adheres to HMH Organizational competencies and standards of behavior.
Qualifications:
Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required:
Bachelor's degree in computer science, business, management information systems, or other related field; or equivalent relevant experience may be accepted in lieu of a degree.
Minimum of 3 years of proven business analyst experience with a focus on project intake, resource estimation, demand management, project scoping or requirements definition.
Experience in facilitation of meetings related to project definition, reviews, decision-making, and other project related topics.
Working experience with deployments of production business or clinical applications, including in-house applications and third-party SaaS applications.
Experience with vendor management and communication.
Strong communication and presentation skills (oral and written) to shape messages to the appropriate level of audience.
Excellent problem-solving ability and critical thinking skills.
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
Ability to understand complex business flows.
Ability to communicate complex technical information in an easy-to-understand way.
Strong organizational and project definition/scoping skills.
Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Preferred:
Experience in the Healthcare industry.
Experience with researching technology solutions.
Knowledge and ability to effectively utilize project portfolio management tools and Microsoft Office and/or Google Workplace tools (Docs, Sheets, Slides, and Forms).
Experience with Agile and Scrum methodologies.
Licenses and Certifications Preferred:
PMI Professional in Business Analysis (PMI-PBA) or equivalent certification.
If you feel that the above description speaks directly to your strengths and capabilities, then please apply today!

Job Title: Staff Analyst/Transportation Planner Series (2331) - Operations Planning
Job Description:
Description



Title: Staff Analyst/Transportation Planner Series

First Date of Posting: 10/17/2023

Last Date of Filing: Open till Filled


Authority: OA/TA
Department: Operations Planning
Division/Unit: Ridership Analysis and Modeling
Reports to: Manager, Service Quality/Performance Analysis
Work Location: 2 Broadway, Manhattan
Hours of Work: 9AM to 5PM

The Ridership Analysis and Modeling unit inside the Division of Operations Planning taps into vast and diverse datasets to develop insights into ridership patterns as well as performance trends across the bus and subway networks. Our algorithms and analyses deliver insights to planners, schedulers, and leadership across NYCT. Projects include developing in-house ridership models to analyze ridership trends, utilizing transportation software such as Trans CAD to forecast ridership under different scenarios, and developing processes and reports to effectively share this data. Our work also includes exploring newly available ridership and performance data sources to develop new data pipelines and improve existing analytical tools. Insights from our analyses inform all scales of planning for New York City’s transit system, including schedule writing, service diversions, network redesigns, and large-scale capital projects.


Responsibilities:

This position may include validating new datasets, engineering backend data flows, designing visualizations for internal and external use, updating processes for modeling and measuring ridership, updating passenger-perspective performance metrics calculation, exploring new data collection technologies, and developing algorithms that integrate multiple data sources to produce actionable insights. These projects may involve data sources such as Automated Fare Card (AFC) records, Automated Passenger Counts (APC), anonymized mobile device data as well as bus and subway movement data. Specific tasks may include analyzing data using SQL and Excel, automating processes in Python or Java, designing reports to disseminate findings, and writing associated documentation.

Compensation


Transportation Planner Series (OA)

Principal Transportation Planner (OA): $91,050 - $120,924

Senior Transportation Planner (OA): $85,921 – $109,536

Transportation Planner (OA): $75,649 - $97,423

Assistant Transportation Planner (OA): $64,687 - $76,579Staff Analyst Series


Assoc. Staff Analyst (OA): $85,316 - $110,468


Assoc. Staff Analyst (TA): $77,356 - $100,155 (New Hire Rate: $67,264)


Staff Analyst II (OA): $75,475 - $84,060


Staff Analyst II (TA): $68,430 - $76,213 (New Hire Rate: $59,505)


Staff Analyst I (OA): $65,003 - $76,955


Staff Analyst I (TA): $58,934 - $69,771 (New Hire Rate: $51,245)


TA EMPLOYEES MUST BE PERMANENT CIVIL SERVICE ASSOCIATE STAFF ANALYST, STAFF ANALYST I OR STAFF ANALYST II IN ORDER TO BE CONSIDERED




Education and Experience


Principal Transportation Planner




A Baccalaureate degree from an accredited college with a major in one or more of the following: engineering, urban studies, geography, transportation science, urban planning, economics, business, public administration, political science or related fields; and five (5) years of full-time paid experience in transportation planning, scheduling or operations. A master’s degree in any of the fields listed for the baccalaureate degree may substitute for one (1) year of the required experience.


Senior Transportation Planner




A Baccalaureate degree from an accredited college with a major in one or more of the following: engineering, urban studies, geography, transportation science, urban planning, economics, business, public administration, political science or related fields; and four (4) years of full-time paid experience in transportation planning, scheduling or operations. A master’s degree in any of the fields listed for the baccalaureate degree may substitute for one (1) year of the required experience.


Transportation Planner


Must possess education as stated above plus two (2) years of full-time paid experience in transportation operations planning or a satisfactory combination of education and experience.


Assistant Transportation Planner




Must possess education as stated above plus one (1) year of full-time paid experience in transportation operations planning or a satisfactory combination of education and experience.


Associate Staff Analyst




A Master’s degree from an accredited college with a major in economics, finance, accounting, business or public administration, human resources management, management science, operations research, organizational behavior, industrial psychology, statistics, personnel administration, labor relations, psychology, sociology, human resources development, political science, urban studies or a closely related field, and ONE(1) year of satisfactory full-time professional experience in one or a combination of the following: working with the budget of a large public or private concern in budget administration, accounting, economic or financial administration, or fiscal or economic research; in management or methods analysis, operations research, organizational research or program evaluation; in personnel or public administration, recruitment, position classification, personnel relations, employee benefits, staff development, employment program planning/administration, labor market research, economic planning, social services program planning/evaluation, fiscal management or in a related field; OR
A Baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and THREE (3) years of satisfactory full-time professional experience in the areas described in 1 above.


Staff Analyst I & Staff Analyst II




A master’s degree from an accredited college or university in economics, finance, accounting, business or public administration, human resources management, management science, operations research, organizational behavior, industrial psychology, statistics, personnel administration, labor relations, psychology, sociology, human resources development, political science, or urban studies, or a Juris Doctor degree from an accredited law school; or
A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university and two years of satisfactory fulltime professional experience in one or a combination of the following areas: working with the budget of a large public or private concern in budget administration, accounting, economic or financial administration, or fiscal or economic research; in management or methods analysis, operations research, organizational research or program evaluation; in personnel or public administration, recruitment, position classification, personnel relations, labor relations, employee benefits, staff development, employment program planning/administration, labor market research, economic planning, social services program planning/evaluation, or fiscal management; or in a related area; or
An associate degree or completion of 60 semester credits from an accredited college or university and four years of satisfactory full-time professional experience as described in "2" above: or
A four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent and six years of satisfactory full-timeprofessional experience as described in "2" above; or
A combination of education and/or experience equivalent to "1", "2", "3", or "4" above. College education may be substituted for professional experience at the rate of 30 semester credits from an accredited college or university for one year of experience. However, all candidates must have a high school diploma.


Special Note:


To be eligible for placement in Assignment Level II, individuals must have, after meeting the minimum requirements, one additional year of professional experience as described in "2" above


All candidates must possess a baccalaureate degree in order to apply to this position.




Other Information

Pursuant to the New York State Public Officers Law & the MTA Code of Ethics, all employees who hold a policymaking position must file an Annual Statement of Financial Disclosure (FDS) with the NYS Commission on Ethics and Lobbying in Government (the “Commission”).


Equal Employment Opportunity

MTA and its subsidiary and affiliated agencies are Equal Opportunity Employers, including with respect to veteran status and individuals with disabilities.

The MTA encourages qualified applicants from diverse backgrounds, experiences, and abilities, including military service members, to apply.

Every day, we work together for what matters – bold, swift, and equitable climate action.

ABOUT THE ROLE

As a Senior Business Process Analyst with a strong focus on technology, you will leverage your expertise in business architecture and business process management to actively design and streamline critical technological processes that underpin our organization's operations. Your primary mission is to align these processes with our strategic technology goals, guaranteeing their efficiency, effectiveness, and scalability in the digital landscape. Additionally, you will play a pivotal role in disseminating industry-specific insights and advising on cutting-edge technology implementations, collaborating closely with technical and business stakeholders to achieve these objectives.

This is a full-time position reporting to the Systems Architect. We have a preference for this new team member to join us in a flexible hybrid work environment in one of our offices in San Francisco CA, Portland, OR, Portland, ME, or New York, NY. Highly qualified candidates located in other parts of the United States may also be considered.

WHAT YOU’LL DO

Conduct thorough assessments of technology architectures, pinpointing areas for enhancement to better align with the organization's strategic objectives, with a particular focus on MuleSoft integration
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather information on current business processes and understand business needs, requirements, and objectives
Recommend optimizations for current business processes based on your analysis and ensure suggested improvements contribute to operational efficiency and effectiveness
Establish performance metrics to measure the success and efficiency of business processes and support continuous improvement efforts
Collaborate closely with IT architects, business analysts, and data analysts to meticulously document the integration requirements of technology solutions within the framework of designed business processes, with a specific emphasis on MuleSoft
Ensure compliance with industry-specific regulations and standards across business processes
Support organizational change initiatives by providing data-driven insights and recommendations based on business process analysis
Manage and prioritize incoming requests from multiple business units related to process improvements and analyses
Provide mentoring and guidance to other team members on best practices for business process analysis
Coordinate with external contractors to guarantee alignment with MuleSoft-driven business process requirements and standards


ABOUT YOU

5+ years of experience in analyzing, documenting, and recommending improvements for business process design and optimization, preferably at the enterprise level
Proficiency in process mapping and documentation tools (e.g., Lucidchart, Visio)
Experience with customer journey mapping and user experience design
Expertise in business process modeling and notation (BPMN) or other process modeling languages like UML
Proficiency in applying specific project management methodologies, demonstrated through successful project planning, execution, and completion, adhering to defined methodologies and achieving predetermined project objectives and milestones
Demonstrated ability to negotiate effectively and resolve conflicts by achieving a minimum of a 90% agreement rate in negotiations and resolving 85% of conflicts within defined timelines, as measured through post-negotiation and conflict resolution assessments
Strong communication and presentation skills
Experience with business process management (BPM) tools and software
Ability to visualize and communicate the potential impact of proposed process changes
Knowledge of performance metrics and key performance indicators (KPIs)
Ability to facilitate workshops and meetings effectively
Ability to build relationships with stakeholders at various levels within the organization
Comfortable working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Familiarity with change management methodologies and practices
Basic understanding of information technology, systems, and integration principles
Familiarity with change management methodologies and practices
Degree in Business, Information Systems, or equivalent years of professional experience in a relevant field
One or more relevant certifications in business process management; Agile or Lean/Six Sigma preferred

HOW WE DEFINE SUCCESS

Within 30 days,

You will develop a deep understanding of the company structure, products, and risk policies
You will familiarize yourself with team makeup, long-term growth goals, lines of business, and current department system direction
You will quickly grasp how we deploy and utilize key technologies within the division, including Mulesoft, SQLServer, Salesforce, and NetSuite, understanding their functionalities and interfaces

Within 90 days,

You will play a key role within teams that own our business processes and technology alignment project portfolio
You will take point on existing business process optimization projects and help with scoping new process improvement projects
You will assist with developing a strategic roadmap and prioritizing key projects while considering business needs and company growth projections

Within 6 months,

You will launch a comprehensive and scalable process to collaborate on new and existing projects, helping to establish or refine process governance plans and performance metrics
Begin creating or refining comprehensive process maps that illustrate current state processes, and suggest potential future state improvements
Assume leadership roles in business process improvement projects independently, showcasing your ability to plan, execute, and deliver substantial results

Within 1 year,

You have established relationships with stakeholders across the organization, supporting them with data-driven insights and becoming a valued contributor in business process discussions
You will be the go-to internal resource for questions or updates regarding the company’s technology vision and strategy and be able to speak to your organization’s positive impact – internally and externally – on the company’s growth and mission, and those of its customers and partners
Work alongside the team to identify and mitigate process bottlenecks, providing analytical support to facilitate the successful implementation of process improvement projects

COMPENSATION & BENEFITS

Compensation: The starting base pay for this position is $84,700 to $126,000 in the US. The total compensation package for the successful candidate in this role may exceed the base pay as it includes other incentive pay. The base pay is dependent upon many factors such as location, transferable or job-related skills, work experience, relevant training, business needs, and market demands. The base salary range is subject to change and may be modified in the future
Benefits: this position is eligible for a benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, 401k, flexible paid time off, and more. Additional information regarding the benefits available for this position can be found at: https://jobs.jobvite.com/3degrees/jobs/jointheteam
Supplemental Pay: this position is eligible for discretionary bonus programs including the company’s profit-sharing program and an annual performance bonus based on personal, department, and company goals
This compensation and benefits information is based on 3Degrees’ good faith estimate as of the date of publication and may be modified in the future

We are committed to creating an inclusive environment where different perspectives contribute to better solutions. 3Degrees welcomes people regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity or gender expression, age, sex, pregnancy, marital status, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic information, or any other category protected by law.

The Business Analyst facilitates business process improvement via the methodical investigation, analysis, review, and documentation of functional business specifications. Defines and documents internal and external user interfaces and supports system and data requirement clarification and definition. The ideal candidate will execute on multiple projects across the software life cycle from business needs assessment to user support. Tasks will include, but are not limited to, documenting requirements for business process changes or reports for a particular business process, training, and supporting end-users.
In addition, the job will entail working with internal applications and integrating them with the Ellucian Colleague ERP platform. Specific duties include, but are not limited to, the following essential job functions:


Characteristics, Duties, and Responsibilities
Demonstrate a high level of subject matter expertise in functional area to bridge business requirements and IT solutions; provide technical direction and ensure compliance with best practice solutions.
Perform data analysis to support evaluation of system defects or to develop requirements for new functionality; triage and troubleshoot complex user-reported system defects; assist in various system trouble shooting and balancing and correction efforts including analysis, verification and validation of issues and fixes.
Assist in systems and business process support across multiple campuses, departments and engagements.
Provide analytical support for critical college-wide initiatives including business function support for system migrations and consolidations, significant business area process improvement projects and complex product installations.
Liaise with clients, technology, and support teams.
Participate in functional testing and support user acceptance testing.
Conduct user training in Colleague and data reporting tools to include creation and maintenance of effective training materials.


Education Requirements
A bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Information Systems or Technology, Computer Science or an equivalent combination of education and experience to demonstrate core competencies.


Experience
Competent to work at the highest technical level of most phases of systems analysis.
3 to 5 years of experience in a business analytics role including: process definition, management and monitoring, release management, web experience, database, SAP Business Objects.
Experienced in creating Business Requirement Documents, User Requirement Specification, and Functional Requirement Specifications. Experienced in creating Data Flow Diagrams, Use Cases, State Diagrams, Sequence Diagrams, Component Diagrams, Use Case Diagrams & Activity diagrams.
Experience in higher education using Ellucian Colleague or other relevant Student Information Systems.
Experience with Data Governance, Data Standards, or other data management business processes
Designing and delivering reporting capabilities to end-users.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Teamwork focused/collaborative work style.
Ability to work under tight deadlines and handle multiple tasks simultaneously.


Competencies and Skills Required
Great people skills and a passion for contributing to a team, with the ability to step up as a leader when needed.
Experience in writing proposals, project charters and using use-case analysis.
The ability to present ideas to both technical and functional staff.
The ability to quickly learn new software applications.
Experience in using Ellucian Colleague or other Student Information Systems.
Experience in using SAP Business Objects or other Business Intelligence tools.
Experience in managing large and complex projects.

Company description

Ferrero is a family-owned company with a truly progressive and global outlook and iconic brands such as Nutella®, Tic Tac®, Ferrero Rocher®, Raffaello®, Kinder Bueno® and Kinder Surprise®. As the love for our brands continues to grow, so too does our global reach. Represented in more than 50 countries, with products sold in more than 170, the Ferrero Group is loved by generations around the world. The secret to our global success? 38,767 dedicated employees who celebrate care and quality to craft a business, careers and brands we are proud of. Join us, and you could be one of them.

About the Role:

Come and be a part of the fastest growing confectionary company in the world!

As the Sales Strategy Analyst, you'll be responsible for supporting the development of the Ferrero US Sales Strategy in terms of the long-term growth plan. The Sales Strategy Analyst will also influence the communication process with our central Sales Development team in Luxembourg for managing key priorities and ensuring delivery of our financial objectives. This role is inclusive of analytical accountability and presentation development supporting the Director of Sales Strategy and Integration as it relates to monthly reviews with the US Sales VP of Strategy & Operations, as well as, the CCO. The Sales Strategy Analyst will report into the Director of Sales Strategy & Integration.

This role is hybrid and based in our US headquarters in Parsippany, NJ.



Main Responsibilities:
Support the development of our overall Sales Strategy including creation of three year midterm Strategic Plan enablers, evolution of the Channel strategies, Sales Organizational design/structure, and Broker RTM Operating model
Maintain accountability for enabling our Sales communication with Central Sales Business Development Group (SBD) for strategic initiatives, Global customer planning, and Commercial Policy activities
Collaborate with Director of Sales Strategy on all Channel strategic plans to align with overarching Sales three year Strategy and US Sales growth plan
Facilitate the implementation of our Broker Strategy for RTM Operating and activity-based performance model
Coordinate the Sales Communication strategy with all internal cross functional departments to ensure consistent flow of information, including managing organization master calendar
Operate as Analytics lead for Sales priority projects including Broker RFP / MyPS / Dedicated Retail Performance model
Enable the development of the Monthly North America business reviews for the Chief Customer Officer to support presentations with Sales Business Development, the North America Area CBO, and Group CEO
Support the annual sales planning process between trade marketing and customer teams, including template building, distribution, and final rollup of numbers including analysis on forward looking trends
Provide guidance to Channel VPs for ensuring Key Performance Indicator (KPI) execution

Who we are looking for:
Bachelor’s Degree required; 2+ years of CPG Experience preferred
Possess critical thinking skills, quantitative and analytical/problem solving skills with ability to interpret data
Multi-channel CPG experience (C-store, Mass, Grocery, Dollar, e-Comm, Foodservice & Value)
Strategic and pro-active with interpersonal skills and an ability to influence cross functional teams
Excellent oral and written communication skills with the ability to build consensus and foster positive relationships.
Strong project management skills

How to be successful in the role and at Ferrero:

Consumers, quality and care are at the heart of everything we do. So, to be successful at Ferrero, you’ll need to be just as consumer and product centric as we are - dedicated to crafting brilliant results for consumers around the world.

Diversity Statement

Ferrero is committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture in which all employees feel welcomed and appreciated and have the same opportunities. We believe all of our people are equally talented in their own way. In nurturing the curiosity and natural abilities of our employees, we provide them, generation after generation, the means to succeed personally and professionally, enabling them to craft their journey at Ferrero. The diversity of our talents is what makes our work environment multicultural, innovative and highly rewarding.

Ferrero N.A. provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics.

POSITION SUMMARY

The Senior Business Analyst will support a sub-office within the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey.

This full-time position is contingent upon client approval. This position is located in New Jersey.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

A. SENIOR BUSINESS ANALYST

The Senior Business Analyst shall, at a minimum, perform the following tasks:

1) Certify eligible firms for participation in various Port Authority and federal business diversity programs. These programs include the Port Authority’s Minority Owned Business (MBE), Women-owned Business Enterprise (WBE), Small Business Enterprise (SBE) programs which includes the Service-Disabled Veteran Owned Business (SDVOB) firms as well as the Disadvantaged Business Enterprise (“DBE”) and Airport Concessions Disadvantaged Business Enterprise (“ACDBE”) Federal

programs.

2) Analyze business documents, contact business owners for additional information, perform on-site visits, provide written determination on application status to applicants and update several databases.

3) Interact with interdepartmental staff such as the Law Department, Inspector General’s Office, Procurement, Engineering, Aviation, and the Secretary’s Office.

4) Ensure the confidentiality of applicant information by maintaining a secure records management system that adheres to Port Authority procedures as well as applicable federal criteria.

5) Review applications and provide written determinations and recommendations to the Certification Manager in a timely manner.

6) Be prepared to learn and utilize the certification provisions in 49 CFR Parts 23 and 26.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

Bachelor’s degree
Minimum 3 years of business or financial management experience
Knowledge and experience with Microsoft Office, specifically Excel, and related project/program management software
Ability to learn and apply regulatory standards as published in 49 CFR Parts 23 and 26 in determining applicants’ certification eligibility.
Demonstrate ability to research financial information using financial statements, tax returns, and other business documents; and ability to aggregate, present and document relevant findings as it relates to meeting the regulatory standards for small disadvantage business certification.
Ability to work effectively with other Port Authority offices as well as other agencies
Good customer relation skills and the ability to work independently
Excellent writing and verbal communication skills

DESIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES

Experience with DBE/SBE/MBE/SVDOB certification process
Experience with B2G database syste
3-5+ years of related experience
This work is anticipated to be mostly done on site.

Job Title: Senior Analyst, Investor Relations Operations, Carlyle Private Wealth
Job Description:
Basic information
Job Name:
Senior Analyst, Investor Relations Operations, Carlyle Private Wealth
Location:
New York/OVA
Line of Business:
Investor Relations
Job Function:
Investor Relations
Date:
Monday, November 13, 2023
Position Summary

Position Summary

Provides sales support to assist with marketing and investor servicing efforts for the Carlyle Private Wealth ("CPW") business. This will include creation of marketing collateral, fulfilling client due diligence requests, creating customized investor presentations and tracking CPW sales reports. The candidate should be able to effectively communicate Carlyle's product differentiators, help IR professionals raise additional capital and service Carlyle's existing investors.

This position will work cross-functionally with members from Carlyle's broader IR team, including Product Specialists, Client Relationship Managers and various Fund Management operations teams who service Carlyle funds.

Lastly, this position will include additional responsibilities for supporting various fundraising processes, such as helping to manage investor pipelines, running sales reports, preparing internal fundraising/budgeting reports and helping with ongoing projects.

Responsibilities

Primary Responsibilities

Project Management Assistance

Assist in the on-going management of fundraising efforts and investor relations responsibilities for various Carlyle funds offered through CPW.
Support CPW Sales by completing ad hoc projects and investor requests and
assisting with coordination of roadshow meetings (or virtual roadshows) and materials.
Draft marketing collateral, including flipbooks, RFPs, standard DDQ responses and other required marketing materials, working closely with CPW Client Relationship Managers, Internal Sales Desk, the broader Investor Relations team, and Fund Management throughout the process.
Guide investors and IR professionals through fund due diligence processes, including completing diligence requests (i.e. DDQs, RFPs, RFIs), handling relevant follow-up, coordinating investment and operational due diligence meetings and liaising with various teams within the organization (i.e. Fund Management, Compliance, etc.) to produce relevant materials.
Support existing investor relations and servicing efforts through the coordination of regular update calls, facilitating of reporting and presentation materials and handling regular and ad-hoc investor requests.
Collaborate with other Project Managers / Product Specialists throughout the firm with regards to a fundraising process to ensure full coordination and implement best practices and lessons learned from prior fundraising initiatives.
Update broader CPW and Investor Relations teams on key developments with respect to fundraise process, portfolio updates and other relevant business- specific facets.
Work on cross platform projects (both for internal and external use), which may include strategic partnership proposals, internal management presentations, senior management talking points, etc.

Global Fundraising Support

Work with other Project Managers / Product Specialists and Product Development team to identify ways in which Carlyle can enhance its fundraising process through the introduction of new tools, strategies and information.
Attend internal and external fundraising meetings, as appropriate, and help in the preparation of materials including prospect generation, preparing presentations and tracking lists.
Work with Investor Relations team regarding the development of budgets, fundraising projections, commitment reviews, post-close analyses, and other projects.




Qualifications

Requirements

Education & Certificates

Bachelor's degree required
Series 7/82 and 63 preferred

Professional Experience

2+ years of experience in a financial/wealth management/business role or similar industry.
Experience within a private banking platform, working with retail investors and 40-Act funds, a plus.
Experience with all areas of the fundraising and client cultivation process including implementing process improvements and creating process documentation.
Knowledge of alternative products a plus.
Customer/Investor/Client Relations experience a plus.

Competencies & Attributes

Work well in a deadline driven environment.
Mastery of Microsoft Office tools.
High level of attention to detail needed for preparing and distributing investor-facing materials.
Strong interpersonal skills a must.
Excellent communication skills - both written and oral.
Demonstrated ability to work effectively as part of a team.
Ability to manage a wide variety of projects occurring simultaneously.






Benefits/Compensation

The compensation range for this role is specific to New York City and takes into account a wide range of factors including but not limited to the skill sets required/preferred; prior experience and training; licenses and/or certifications.

The anticipated base salary range for this role is $125,000.

In addition to the base salary, the hired professional will enjoy a comprehensive benefits package spanning retirement benefits, health insurance, life insurance and disability, paid time off, paid holidays, family planning benefits and various wellness programs. Additionally, the hired professional may also be eligible to participate in an annual discretionary incentive program, the award of which will be dependent on various factors, including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance.


Due to the high volume of candidates, please be advised that only candidates selected to interview will be contacted by The Carlyle Group.




Company Information
The Carlyle Group (NASDAQ: CG) is a global investment firm with $385 billion of assets under management and more than half of the AUM managed by women, across 562 investment vehicles as of June 30, 2023. Founded in 1987 in Washington, DC, Carlyle has grown into one of the world's largest and most successful investment firms, with more than 2,200 professionals operating in 29 offices in North America, South America, Europe, the Middle East, Asia and Australia. Carlyle places an emphasis on development, retention and inclusion as supported by our internal processes and seven Employee Resource Groups (ERGs). Carlyle's purpose is to invest wisely and create value on behalf of its investors, which range from public and private pension funds to wealthy individuals and families to sovereign wealth funds, unions and corporations. Carlyle invests across three segments - Global Private Equity, Global Credit and Investment Solutions - and has expertise in various industries, including: aerospace, defense & government services, consumer & retail, energy, financial services, healthcare, industrial, real estate, technology & business services, telecommunications & media and transportation.

At Carlyle, we know that diverse teams perform better, so we seek to create a community where we continually exchange insights, embrace different perspectives and leverage diversity as a competitive advantage. That is why we are committed to growing and cultivating teams that include people with a variety of perspectives, people who provide unique lenses through which to view potential deals, support and run our business.

Prioritise remote vendor workload and manage complex relationships.

Required:

Education: Bachelor’s degree and 5+ years’ experience of Commercial/Sales/logistics modules and processes in SAP.

SAP Configuration and support experience

Preferred experience – Logistics Execution (LE), Material Management (MM), S&OP processes


Proficient in SAP SD Order to Cash and Intercompany Sales
Proficient in Output Determination, Billing, LSMW


Experience with SAP for a Global pharma business

Develop best practices, operational procedures and design documentation as an SAP Commercial SME.
In depth knowledge of core Pharma Commercial processes & practices within a regulated business
Effective Pharma Commercial knowledge transfer to a Global business to facilitate optimization initiatives
Ability to articulate and influence the strategy and optimization opportunities to all levels
Strong skills in the areas of communication, delivery on results, self-development, adaptability, flexibility, and global perspective.
Strong time management and organizational skills. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, and Problem-solving mindset.

Self-starter and able to communicate effectively; willingness to learn new module and get involved in areas outside primary role

Job Title: Data Compliance and Access Operations Analyst
Job Description:
Responsibilities
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.
Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.
To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.
At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.
Join us.

The Global Security Organization provides industry-leading cyber-security and business protection services to TikTok globally. Our organization employs four principles that guide our strategic and tactical operations. Firstly, we Champion Transparency & Trust by leading the charge in organizational transparency, prioritizing customer trust, and placing user needs first. Secondly, we aim to maintain Best in Class Global Security by proactively identifying and reducing risks while enabling innovative product development. We constantly work towards a sustainable world-class security capability. Thirdly, we strive to be a Business Catalyst & Enabler by embodying the DNA of technical innovation and ensuring our Global Security operations are fast and agile. Finally, we Drive Empowered & Risk-Informed Decision Making by providing our leaders with the necessary information to make agile decisions based on risk. In order to enhance collaboration and cross-functional partnerships, our organization follows a hybrid work schedule that requires employees to work in the office for 2 to 3 days a week, as directed by their manager. We regularly review our hybrid work model, and the specific requirements may change at any time.

TikTok is seeking an Analyst for Access Approval Operations to be part of the Data Protection team and will be responsible for reviewing data access and data transfer requests to ensure they are in compliance with relevant company policy, geographical regulation, contractual commitments, and confidentiality requirements. This role reports to the Access Assurance Compliance Lead within the Global Security Organization.

Responsibilities

Understand the access management policies and procedures and the implications on TikTok's business model
Evaluate access request business justifications to align with the principle of least privilege and defined policies for access approvals
Understand defined data categories and data transfer rules, and the implications on TikTok's regional regulatory obligations
Evaluate business requests for data transfer based on interoperable needs, to align with regional legal and regulatory requirement
Serve as access assurance liaison and interact with cross-business line applicants to communicate access standards and/or gather required information
Implement new review procedures and continually update internal documentation involving new regulatory, company, and reporting requirements
Establish, track and report operational metrics to senior leadership
Serve in a rotating on-call process for emergency access related matters
Qualifications

Bachelors’ Degree or industry equivalent work experience
0-2 years experience working in cybersecurity or information security
Understanding of:
Data classification and concepts of data minimisation
Access management concepts, processes, and procedures
User access administration, role and policy-based access controls, including identity management, provisioning and de-provisioning access
Identity and Access Management (IAM) tools
Metrics and reporting, including dashboarding, Microsoft Excel and SQL
SLA management
Familiarity with regulatory privacy landscape (e.g., GDPR, CCPA)
Ability to adapt to changing requirements or non-standard situations
Ability to serve in on-call rotations to ensure timely incident response
Ability to communicate and work closely with colleagues in different time zones
TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations in our recruitment processes for candidates with disabilities, pregnancy, sincerely held religious beliefs or other reasons protected by applicable laws. If you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation, please reach out to us at gprd.accommodations@tiktok.com

Overview:
The Associate Merchandise Planner is responsible for the strategic direction of inventory based on analysis of departmental financials, historical data, and current market trends. They will manage inventory through the use of various merchandise reporting tools, ensuring top sales are being met.
Responsibilities:
Execute and communicate strategic merchandise financial plans and strategies that support the merchandising and financial objectives of the Company.
With guidance, create pre-season sales, margin and inventory plans by department, class, and/or SKU to support product and financial strategies. Review with manager.
Analyze historical data and current trends to recap business. Work to identify risks and opportunities by department and by class. In partnership with manager, create strategies to align inventory with Merchant partners.
Aware of chase/commit calendar. Partner with merchandising & manager to provide sales trend direction & inventory projections for call dates.
Develop item-level promotional and markdown strategies on a weekly basis. Partner with Merchandising & Merch Control to accuracy of system entry.
Present forecasts and action plans in open-to-buy meetings. In partnership with manager, create action plan based on forecast and lead discussions to management & cross functional teams.
Hindsight in-season & post-season performance by category. Share findings with cross functional teams.
Run & publish various weekly & ad hoc Merchandise Planning reports.
Work with all levels of Planning & Merchandising from Assistants to President-CMO.
Qualifications:
Minimum of 2-4 years of Merchandise Planning or related financial/analytical experience.
Global business analysis and strategic/innovative thinking skills.
Ability to present data & influence discussion with executives, peers and members of cross-functional team.
Understanding of retail financial measurements.
Excellent attention to detail.
Flexible and adaptive to changing priorities.
Strong listening, written and oral communication skills.
Able to organize and prioritize workload to meet deadlines.
High proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Microstrategy & planning tools/systems.

The Role:
BI Manager in the OpEx & Analytics group is an important role in ensuring the continued success of the GBS division with the broader Wolters Kluwer company. Being a senior member of the team, you will play a leadership role in shaping our team’s strategy as well as leading cross-functional teams to deliver results and insights. You will use large datasets to find opportunities for tracking quantitative and qualitative details and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. You will report to the Director of Business Intelligence.
The OpEx & Analytics Group provides thought leadership to identify, assess, implement and manage different aspects of a rich pipeline of operational improvements across Wolters Kluwer. The Analytics Team within BizOps & Strategy engages and supports aspects of these initiatives: from opportunity identification, to quantitative analyses, insight generation and monitoring. OpEx & Analytics also tracks and reports on Operational Excellence initiatives across the BizOps & Strategy, Strategic Sourcing, Technology, and Finance functions within GBS.
This is a hybrid position, 3 days a week in the NYC office. #LI-Hybrid

The BI Manager has work across the following areas:
Operations: work with analysts to develop models for forecasting, regression analysis, monitor key metrics, root cause analysis for changes in metrics, building and analyzing dashboards and reports

Infrastructure – work in SQL/Oracle for automating analyses and author pipelines via SQL and Python based ETL framework

Education:
BA or BS degree required (focus in Engineering, Statistics, Math, Economics preferred)
MS degree preferred (focus in Data Science preferred)
Experience:
5 + years of relevant work experience solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches
Ability to translate data into visually appealing and executive ready reports and/or dashboards
Ability to lead complex and strategic programs
Experience in SQL or other programming language
Development experience in Python is highly preferred
Knowledge of statistics – hypothesis testing, regressions etc.
Ability to query data databases, understanding of ETL process and familiarity with additional analytical tools preferred

Global Macro Hedge Fund based in New York, NY and Stamford, CT seeks a resourceful problem-solver to manage day-to-day responsibilities within our business team. The position will help to develop and oversee a strong internal control environment to manage operations, risk management, fund accounting reporting. Partnering with the team, identifying risks and proposing solutions is key to the success of this role. Preferably looking for someone who has experience in the futures/options/FX/OTC cleared/equity space.





Responsibilities: (specific responsibilities will include but not be limited to)

Help develop a control framework across all the business functions : finance, operations, investor relations
Perform daily trading operations, including dealing with end to end processes from trade execution to settlement (T+0 monitoring and processing of trading activity, T+1 reconciliations with clearing brokers and administrators)
Assist in fund accounting and reporting
Take part in the treasury/cash/risk management function

Requirements

Bachelor / Master degree in finance / accounting / CS / engineering
2-7 years of relevant experience related to hedge fund or capital markets operations / accounting / business / risk development
Experience working with equities, FX, fixed income and commodities products

Strong work ethic and ability to work under pressure
High attention to detail and strong organizational skills
Must be a team player with very good communication skills (internal and external)

Benefits

Compensation may vary based on skills, experience and location
