About WFS

Join our Worldwide Flight Services family and contribute to the timely delivery of cargo shipment, luggage, business to customer delivery, and on-time flights while operating safely and securely. We perform at the highest level for our customers every day, and strive to be an exceptional leader in our industry with our teams of cargo, passenger, ramp handling, and technical service experts in 164 airport locations, 18 countries, and on 5 continents. Are you ready to take off on your next career with us?

Job Summary

The Cargo Sales Analyst will manage contracts and execution of Customer Rate Increases as well as provide overall support of regional Sales VPs on contracts expiring and contract renewal. This individual will be responsible for analyzing cargo sales data, identifying trends, and making recommendation to improve cargo sales performance. This position will work closely with the sales team and finance to provide insights and develop strategies that increases sales and revenue.

Responsibilities
Manage the CPI and Living Wage Ordinance (LWO) increase process which includes initial
Customer communication, follow up management, financial analysis as required
Create the potential financial impact of CPI and LWO increases
Create worksheet on current and new rates and distribute via email
Customer communication is part of the role
Follow up acknowledgements with customers
Update and report out recent rate increases obtained
Analyze cargo sales data and report out identified trends, patterns, and insights to the sales
teams
Collaborate with the sales and finance teams to develop and implement sales plans to drive
revenue growth
Provide informed recommendations on how pricing should be handled according to industry
trends.
Monitor and report on the effectiveness of sales strategies and initiatives
Ad hoc projects and reports as needed
Assist with the creation of a Cargo Pricing Strategy and roadmap for the year
Must be able to interact and collaborate across multiple departments,
Report progress to SMEs and Senior Leadership team
Determine target rates and recommend strategies to achieve targets
Responsible for observing and identifying deviations from process and course correction as needed
Minimum Requirements
Bachelor’s degree with a focus on Finance or Statistics
2+ years of experience in Supply Chain Operations or Sales Analysis
Excellent analytical skills with experience using Excel and other data analysis tools
Ability to self-manage with little oversight
Preferred Skills
Excellent oral, written and communication skills
Excellent analytical and communication skills
Continuous Improvement skills
Ability to communicate efficiently and effectively
Ability to work in the field – cooperate & collaborate through influence.
Personable and professional demeanor
Physical Requirements/Working Conditions
Ability to multi-task and work independently as well as in different (local) teams
Must be able to work under high demand and pressure with tight deadlines

5+ years of account management, project or program management or buying experience
Bachelor's degree
Experience driving internal cross-team collaboration
Experience using data to influence business decisions
Experience with business analysis and P&L management
The US Consumables Vendor Management team manages the relationships with top vendors in the Beauty, Grocery, Health and Personal Care, Pets, and Baby space for the US. We work with our external and internal stakeholders to add value to our customers and grow a sustainable business in our respective industries. Consumables continues to be the growth engine for Amazon Retail. Join a team where collaboration and customer obsession are highly valued.
This role requires an effective leader and communicator, with strong business acumen, acute analytical skills, and the demonstrated ability to use creative thinking and innovation to solve complex problems. We are looking for an individual that enjoys fast-paced, data-driven environments and will be a passionate customer and category advocate within Amazon. The successful candidate is a self-starter with a passion for retail and has superb business judgment with a track record of successful negotiations.

Key job responsibilities

Defines the vision and business strategy for the category including North Star metric(s) and KPIs for measuring results
Manages category P&L and develops plans that drive revenue and margin improvements for the business
Develops vendor relationships inclusive of terms negotiations and growth focused initiatives
Drives broad adoption and provide an unparalleled customer experience
Devise clear frameworks for making day-to-day decisions
Lead execution of projects including building project plans
Drive commitments from internal teams including Marketing, Engineering, and Category Management
Dives deep into inputs and understands the downstream impact of changes to pricing, selection, and convenience for subcategories.
A day in the life
As a Senior Vendor Manager, you will have accountability for the business results for your product subcategories. During a typical day you would find yourself negotiating contracts and working on a Joint Business Plan with a vendor, working with another vendor and stakeholder teams on expanding product selection and finalizing promotional plans for an upcoming event, diving deep into metrics for your category to prepare for weekly business reviews, working with cross functional teams on developing and implementing a new product feature. Among many other initiatives you would be developing and growing vendor relationships, driving sales and margin improvements, and creating best-in-class customer experiences.

About the team
Amazon Consumables is Amazon’s business group dedicated to creating shopping experiences that are helping change the way customers think about the things they purchase most frequently, including groceries, health and beauty, and products for both pets and babies. We drive business growth and innovation related to the online sale of everything from dog food to diapers to razors to raisins. Our teams ensure vast product selection and create trusted, convenient shopping experiences.

We take our inspiration from the early days of Amazon. Back in 1995, Amazon recognized the opportunity to change the retail book industry. Today, we seek to have a similarly profound impact on consumables. From designing our own line of delicious snacks to opening up supply-chain insights with the transparency of Amazon Elements to making it easy for customers to find the products they need, we are developing products and customer experiences that have the potential to significantly change how people shop.

Our business and technical teams are made up of smart, entrepreneurial builders who get excited about delivering work that has a direct and measurable impact on customers shopping on Amazon.com. We are consistently challenged by the scale and pace of Amazon, as well as the opportunity to learn from each other as we drive our business forward – building programs and technologies that enhance the lives of our customers.

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Arlington, VA, USA | Austin, TX, USA | Charlotte, TX, USA | New York, NY, USA | Santa Monica, CA, USA | Seattle, WA, USA


Experience negotiating with internal and external stakeholders
MBA
Experience presenting to senior leadership
Experience in a related industry (e.g. beauty, fashion, entertainment, media, or games)

Job Title: Data Analytics & Business Intelligence Insurance Lead
Job Description:
Company Description


We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable.



Job Description


The Analytical Data Operations (ADO) division is Verisk/ISO's data refinery, ensuring that ISO's analytical engines are properly fueled. As a member of ADO you will be part of a team of data analysts, BI developers, data engineers, data architects, and actuarial/analytical-engineers that are dedicated to improve our data analytics platform to support a host of products the US P&C industry relies on.

Your purpose is to serve as subject matter expert for all data and related information for the line of business experience. You will collaborate with other team leads and stakeholders to understand and explain industry trends and develop industry expertise across our product portfolio. Additionally, you will work with our international data operations team to develop new tools to expand and enhance your team’s ability to develop industry insights at scale and to drive real change in the US P&C insurance market.

You will operate within a Shared Services model, where you will be expected to manage stakeholder expectations and organize deliverables across junior staff. You will be expected to develop expertise in multiple lines of business, AGILE project management, and advanced analytics using SQL on our cloud data warehouse, being at the forefront of data analytics for the P&C industry. Your responsibilities include:

Work directly with line of business stakeholders to understand business needs, gather, manipulate, and analyze data to deliver digestible insights that drive business decisions

Analyze industry data for personal lines property coverages to identify trends, anomalies, and data quality issues, ensuring product teams are aware of impacts to our analytics driven by industry experience

Develop data reports and visualizations using business intelligence and analytics software

Lead quarterly presentations with LOB stakeholders to discuss data analysis results, summarizing and synthesizing analysis from junior team members, and documenting key take aways from discussions

Mange our data steward relationship with the insurance carriers, providing prompt and meaningful analysis of their data to ensure their compliance with regulatory requirements and the applicability of our industry benchmark analytics to their business

Drive organizational change in how we deliver results both internally and externally



Qualifications


Required Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in a STEM major or with STEM coursework learned in associated majors (Actuarial Science, Computer Science, Data Engineering, Data Science, Mathematics, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, Economics)

A minimum of three years P&C insurance data analysis experience with a focus on Commercial Property Lines or Casualty coverages such as General Liability, Medical Professional Liability, and Personal Liability would be beneficial

Excellent communication skills (both oral and written) are required, with a desire to improve presentation and persuasion skills

A passion for using data and technology to understand the real world and drive change with a focus on the importance of data quality

Experience supervising junior team members and a strong record of building great stakeholder relationships

Excellent SQL, Excel/BI skills with a focus on data analysis

A self-starter with a commitment to innovation and pro-active problem solving

Preferred Qualifications

Experience in Python, VBA, SAS, and R is preferred.

Commitment to attainment of an insurance professional designation (ACAS, CPCU, AIDM)

Commitment to attainment of a technology or project management designations

You will be part of a culture that celebrates success, recognizes and rewards achievements and excellence, and provides personal and professional enrichment opportunities.

#LI-MC1


Additional Information


In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list.

For over fifty years and through innovation, interpretation, and professional insight, Verisk has replaced uncertainty with precision to unlock opportunities that deliver significant and demonstrable impact. From our historic roots in risk assessment, we’ve grown to provide analytic insights that help transform industries focused on some of the world’s most critical areas. Today, the insurance industry relies on Verisk to be, and to make the world, more productive, resilient, and sustainable.

Verisk works in collaboration with our customers and at the intersection of people, data, and advanced technologies. Through proprietary platformed analytics, advanced modeling, and interpretation, we deliver immediate and sustained value to our customers and through them, to the individuals and societies they serve, with greater speed, precision, and scale.

We’re 9,000 people strong, committed to translating big data into big ideas. We help others see new possibilities and empower certainty into big decisions that impact individuals and societies. And we relentlessly and ethically pursue innovation to help move our customers, and the world, toward better tomorrows.

Everyone at Verisk—from our chief executive officer to our newest employee—is guided by The Verisk Way, to Be Remarkable, Add Value, and Innovate.

Be Remarkable by doing something better each day in service to our customers and each other
Add Value by delivering immediate and sustained results that drive positive outcomes
Innovate by redefining what’s possible, embracing challenges, and pushing boundaries

Verisk Businesses

Underwriting Solutions — provides underwriting and rating solutions for auto and property, general liability, and excess and surplus to assess and price risk with speed and precision

Claims Solutions — supports end-to-end claims handling with analytic and automation tools that streamline workflow, improve claims management, and support better customer experiences

Property Estimating Solutions — offers property estimation software and tools for professionals in estimating all phases of building and repair to make day-to-day workflows the most efficient

Extreme Event Solutions — provides risk modeling solutions to help individuals, businesses, and society become more resilient to extreme events.

Specialty Business Solutions — provides an integrated suite of software for full end-to-end management of insurance and reinsurance business, helping companies manage their businesses through efficiency, flexibility, and data governance

Marketing Solutions — delivers data and insights to improve the reach, timing, relevance, and compliance of every consumer engagement

Life Insurance Solutions – offers end-to-end, data insight-driven core capabilities for carriers, distribution, and direct customers across the entire policy lifecycle of life and annuities for both individual and group.

Verisk Maplecroft — provides intelligence on sustainability, resilience, and ESG, helping people, business, and societies become stronger

At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the 7th consecutive year. We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Verisk’s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work.

Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer.

All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability.

http://www.verisk.com/careers.html

Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.

Overview:

At New York Blood Center Enterprises (NYBCe), one of the most comprehensive blood centers in the world, our focus is on cultivating excellence by merging cutting-edge innovation with diligent customer service, groundbreaking research, and comprehensive program and service development. Join us as we work towards meeting and exceeding the growing needs of our diverse communities, further our lifesaving strategic goals in a rapidly changing environment, and expand our impact on the local, national, and global communities we serve.




Responsibilities:
New York Blood Center Enterprises is seeking an experienced Business Analyst to join our Enterprise Optimization and Integration team. As a Business Analyst with a focus on standardization, optimization, and efficiency of blood operations and distribution, you will play a critical role in driving strategic initiatives to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of our blood operations and distribution processes. By leveraging your analytical skills and business acumen, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify solutions that improve blood product quality, streamline workflows, and optimize the distribution channels.

Candidates must reside within commuting distance to one of the following NYBCe locations :New York City, NY, Kansas City, Missouri, St. Paul Minnesota, Providence , RI and Newark, DE.

Responsibilities:

Engage with key stakeholders, including blood and laboratory operations teams, hospital services, to elicit, analyze, and document business requirements related to blood operations and distribution.

Conduct in-depth analyses of existing blood operations and distribution processes. Identify areas for standardization and optimization, to increase productivity, reduce costs, and enhance overall operational efficiency.

Utilize advanced data analysis techniques to extract insights from complex data sets related to blood operations.

Partner with Enterprise Analytics and Data Science (EADS) team to develop meaningful reports and dashboards to track KPIs and facilitate data-driven decision-making. Execute, collaborate, support and lead business imperatives to support all Enterprise Initiatives.

Evaluate the performance of existing programs and services against business objectives especially growth and profitability. Further, provides support for finding and implementing solutions.

Partner with the executive leadership teams throughout the enterprise to develop productivity, planning and costing models and tools that can be used in the budgeting, production planning and other areas.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to conceptualize and design process improvements. Develop detailed functional specifications for the successful implementation of initiatives.

Participate and provides input into blood operations projects (i.e. expenses budgets time-lines, milestones).

Proactively identify opportunities for continuous improvement in blood operations and distribution. Recommend and implement process refinements to enhance operational effectiveness.


Qualifications:
Education:
Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Health-care Management, or a related field.

Experience:
4 years of professional experience in health-care, pharmaceutical, biotechnology or a closely related industry in progressively responsible operational roles conducting process analysis, process improvement, and workflow optimization.

Preference:
5 years’ experience as mentioned above highly desirable.

Knowledge:
Knowledge of project management methodologies and tools.
Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, SQL, Tableau) to analyze complex datasets and draw actionable insights.

Travel:
Up to 10%

Skills & Abilities:
Works across organizational and functional boundaries to achieve company goals. Builds and maintains strong relationships with team members, other functions, and customers. Works cooperatively with others to meet group and organizational goals.

Exhibit strong analytic skills to resolve complex issues, drive through obstacles, develop optimal growth opportunities, and deliver effective business solutions that meet the goals.

Working understanding of business and financial practices, compensation, operational planning activities and the ability to effectively communicate, interact and work with all levels of staff.

Strong analytical and financial management skills, including on-going profitability monitoring, with the proven ability to achieve sustainable and significant cost efficiencies on an organizational wide basis.

An ability to energize, mobilize, influence, and build accountability through effective communication of vision, and fostering of productive and supportive working relationships with internal and external constituencies.

Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

Passion for the mission of the New York Blood Center and a commitment to making a positive impact on patient care and public health.

For applicants who will perform this position in New York City or Westchester County, the proposed annual salary is $66,000.00/year to $93,750.00/year. For applicants who will perform this position outside of New York City or Westchester County, salary will reflect local market rates and be commensurate with the applicant’s skills, job-related knowledge, and experience.

Location: Cedar Knolls, New Jersey

Consultant will provide analytical and project management leadership with ability to understand and perform analysis of the challenges, support strategy development and execution, manage client relationships and stakeholder communications. Particularly:

Understand client needs and develop/align strategic plans to support their implementation
Provide research, analysis, including benchmark, marketing and cost-benefit analysis in support of the recommended strategy
Develop and communicate project deliverables and progress to C-suite stakeholders and brand managers
Provide project management expertise including forecasting of key activities, budgeting and reporting

Support Nuvera’s business development and other internal initiatives such as recruiting, marketing, knowledge management and best practice improvement

Must be authorized to work legally in the United States
Bachelor’s Degree is a must, Masters in Science/Public Health/Business Administration desirable
1.5+ years of management consulting experience
Some experience within the life science industry, knowledge and understanding of health care providers and group practice dynamics
Creativity and problem solving skills
Attention to detail and quality focused
Ability to enter client environment and provide business solutions after a detailed assessment of the requirements and the current state
Ability to grasp business requirements, business process, current systems functionality, and propose new requirements or process changes
Ability to perform detailed business analysis functions including development of business process models & functional documentation
Experience working with business stakeholders and users, running client meetings and proactively developing recommendations
Presentation and presentation development skills

About Salesforce

We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.

Also known as a " Pre-Sales Engineer" or "Solutions Consultant," the Solution Engineer is responsible for presenting a broad range of Salesforce solutions to prospects and customers while handling all technical objections in the sales cycle. To accomplish this, the Solution Engineer must have a strong desire to leverage their technical and/or sales skills, including the ability to solicit business requirements, develop a technical sales strategy, configure and effectively demonstrate the solutions that address these requirements and provide business value. Through carefully planned discovery with a range of stakeholders you will uncover the specific business requirements and value drivers that make this a compelling and transformative project. Working with the extended sales team you will help to develop a differentiated solution, demonstrate this to the customer, and address any questions and concerns they may have. During this process you will create impactful relationships with your customers and strive to become their trusted advisor.

Work with small to medium size organizations across a range of industries to understand their challenges and goals through focused discovery sessions and workshops

Manage multiple customer engagements concurrently in a fast paced environment
Present at marketing events
Training and enablement of the sales team
Be self motivated, flexible, and proactive
Willingness and flexibility to travel as needed

Excellent verbal and written communications skills with a focus on capturing requirements and use cases, developing a solution and articulating business value

Ability to work as part of a team to solve business and technical problems

Experience in multi product solution selling

Detailed knowledge of Salesforce platform.

Job Summary:
As a member of the Clear Channel Outdoor Business Operations team, the Program Manager plays a key role in program management, leading projects in support of strategic initiatives that drive increased revenue and efficiency company-wide. More specifically, this role ensures successful execution by gathering and defining requirements, collaborating with technology and process owners to design new systems and processes, as well as partnering with the learning and development team and leadership to design and implement effective roll-outs of change.

Job Responsibilities:
Drive the development and implementation of diverse company strategic initiatives, link and align the efforts of diverse groups across the organization.
Act as a key change agent for the company on strategic and operational improvement projects, driving impact from the initiatives, and ensuring execution is seamless.
Ensure successful definition, set-up, and implementation of change programs across all aspects of the business in conjunction with line management and technology teams.
Conceptualize and communicate strategic solutions to gain buy-in and create measurable impact.
Effectively communicate project status through the creation and maintenance of comprehensive project plans and the distribution of regular updates with regards to schedules, progress, risks, change impacts, results, etc.
Maximize synergy and collaboration between various teams and business owners.
Drive analytics and business intelligence to understand industry and competitive dynamics, evaluate the overall performance or the impact of specific initiatives, and drive executive decisions.
Provide administrative, analytical, conceptual, and other support in support of leadership and team members, as assigned.
Job Qualifications:
Education and Certifications
Bachelor’s Degree preferred, or equivalent combination of education, training, experience, or military experience
Work Experience
Minimum of 5 years’ experience in project management, process improvement, business analysis, or application development
Experience in Media sales or B2B sales process preferred
Skills
Fluency in one or more project management or process improvement methodologies
Six Sigma, LEAN, or PMP training preferred
Proficiency with Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Visio
Competencies
Planning: Accurately scopes out length and difficulty of tasks and projects; sets objectives and goals; breaks down work into the process steps.
Problem Solving: Identifies complex problems based on a broad range of factors, many of which are ambiguous or difficult to define.
Results Focus: Taking a dynamic approach to work characterized by initiating decisions and actions. Concentrating on achieving the outcomes of a process or project while adhering to the overall strategy of the organization.
Client Focus: Responds to client needs in a timely, professional, helpful, and courteous manner, regardless of client attitude.
Fostering Communication: Presents information and facts in a logical manner, using appropriate phrasing and vocabulary.
Agility: Remains calm when encountering uncertain circumstances. Reflects on successes and failures, to identify lessons learned on a continuing basis.
Physical Demands
The demands described below are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job:
Employee must have the ability to sit and/or stand at a desk for a minimum of 8 hours a day and complete tasks requiring repetitive use of hands
The employee must have the ability to lift and move items up to 20 pounds
Employee must have the ability to see written documents, computer screens and to adjust focus
This job is performed in a temperature-controlled office environment
Other Requirements
Position is based at the Clear Channel Outdoor corporate office in New York, NY.
Travel up to 25%.

New York City Salary Range: $85,000 to $129,000
Bonus Eligible
Comprehensive Benefits package offerings, which includes:
Multiple Medical, Dental, and Vision Plans to choose from
Health Care Spending Accounts (HSA and FSA Options)
Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account
Optional Short Term and Long Term Disability Plans
Company Paid Employee Life and AD&D Insurance
Supplemental Life and AD&D Insurance (Employee/Spouse/Child)
Voluntary Benefits: Critical Illness, Accident, Identity Theft Protection, Legal Assistance, and Pet Insurance
Pre-Tax Commuter Spending Account
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
401(k) Savings Plan with company match
Paid Time Off (Accrued Vacation and Sick Plans)
Discounted Gym Memberships
Professional Development Opportunities
Employee Resource Groups

Job Title: Central Operations Program Analyst (Coordinating Mgr), Correctional Health Services, (8a-4p), Trailer 2
Job Description:
About NYC Health + Hospitals



NYC Health + Hospitals is the largest public health care system in the nation. We are a network of 11 hospitals, trauma centers, neighborhood health centers, nursing homes, post-acute care centers, and correctional health services. We are a home care agency and a health plan, MetroPlus. Our health system provides essential services to 1.4 million New Yorkers every year in more than 70 locations across the city's five boroughs. Our diverse workforce of more than 42,000 employees are uniquely focused on empowering New Yorkers, without exception, to live the healthiest life possible. Visit us at nychhc.org and stay connected on facebook.com/nycHHC or Twitter@hhcnyc.


NYC Health + Hospitals/Correctional Health Services is one of the nation’s leading correctional health care systems in quality of and innovations to care, and access from pre-arraignment through compassionate release. In-jail services include medical, nursing, mental health, substance use treatment, social work, dental and vision care, discharge planning, and reentry support. In addition to providing direct patient care in the jails, CHS leverages the resources of the nation’s largest municipal health care system to help discharged patients successfully return to their communities. CHS is also a pivotal partner in New York City’s criminal justice reform efforts.

Job Description
Act as a project manager for team process improvement projects, coordinating stakeholders within and outside the department to assure that appropriate feedback is obtained and to monitor timely project progress.
Act as process knowledge base for department by creating and maintaining written operational guides and by developing deep understanding of the Central Operations subunit. This requires directly contributing to its support on a scheduled and as-needed basis and exposure to workflows on all tours. This requires a willingness and ability to respond to a high-volume of inbound phone and email communication promptly and professionally with attention to detail.
Identify and perform data analyses that support understanding of team work products and independently review and summarize the completion of routine tasks by the department. Participate in team process improvement initiatives.
Oversee planning, development and may conduct training programs to maintain proficiency of personnel and for use of new equipment and implementation of methods and procedures.
Review official directives and correspondence to ascertain such data as changes prescribed in Corporate, facility or department programs, policies, procedures and new assignments or responsibilities delegated to office
Review, prepare and rewrite operational manuals and procedures.

Preferred Skills:

A Master’s degree in Arts or Science with a specialization in hospital administration, health care administration, administrative medicine or in public health when conferred for a program in hospital administration, from an approved college or university; or a Baccalaureate degree; and
Four (4) years of administrative experience and background; or,
An equivalent combination of training, education and experience in related fields and educational disciplines; and,
General knowledge of policies and programs utilized in the operation of a health care facility, ability to assimilate and analyze data, to recommend action based on analytical findings, and to assist in the solution of complex problems in health care administration and management.
Comfort completing data analysis, preparing reports and creating presentations without additional Excel or PowerPoint training required.
Is able to organize, sort and manage a high volume of electronic resources with minimal supervision.
Position may require participation in team observation, process documentation, or project rollout activities outside of standard business hours for up to 2 shifts per week as needed by supervisor.
Minimum Qualifications



1. A Baccalaureate Degree from an accredited college or university in Public Health, Public Administration, Business Administration, Social Work, Psychology or Rehabilitation Counseling, and three (3) years of full-time experience in medically-oriented health care and medical support systems environment, two (2) years of which included experience in an administrative or supervisory capacity in such occupations as physical, occupational, inhalation, speech and audiology therapy or as Medical/Laboratory Technologist, Microbiologist (various specialties), Chemist (biochemist), Radiation and X-Ray Technician or three (3) years of responsible level experience in business management systems or general administration including two (2) years in a supervisory or administrative capacity.

2. A Masters Degree from an accredited college or university in the disciplines listed in (1), and two (2) years of full-time experience as listed in (1), plus one (1) year experience in an administrative or supervisory capacity in occupations as listed in (1); or,

3. A satisfactory equivalent combination of training, education and experience.

Note: Certification or licensure may be required.

How To Apply



If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button or mail your resume, noting the above Job ID #, to:

NYC Health + Hospitals / Correctional Health Services

Talent Acquisition
Human Resources Department
55 Water Street, 18th Floor
New York, NY 10041
Attn: Talent Acquisition

If applying online, please include your cover letter in the same file attachment with your uploaded resume.

Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities

Calling all innovators – find your future at Fiserv.

We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments, and we move money and information in a way that moves the world. We connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants, and consumers to one another millions of times a day – quickly, reliably, and securely. Any time you swipe your credit card, pay through a mobile app, or withdraw money from the bank, we’re involved. If you want to make an impact on a global scale, come make a difference at Fiserv.

Job Title

Technical Business Analyst

What does a Business Analyst Do?

The Business Analyst operates as part of a Fiserv software engineering team to manage and support team inputs and outputs regarding design, development, testing, delivery, and support of software and technology products. The Analyst will manage and support internal team projects from start to finish. They will support all aspects of the development process from design to product delivery.

As a Business Analyst, you can look forward to:

Manage Team Inputs and Outputs Ticket Creation & Management:

Receive ticket hand-off from external stakeholders and Product Managers.

Gather & review technical requirements for new or enhanced features and products based on business requirements.

Define and refine requirements for quality ticket creation.Ensure ticket meets quality standards on all points.

Manage tickets from Stakeholder boards to the team board.

Drive efficient and well-organized stakeholder/engineering feedback loops.

Diligently track the assignment, and development of prioritized feature and product requests.

Participate in support escalations; identify the issue and ensure its effectively communicated to the team leads.

Assist with attempts to identify and reproduce potential defects.

Assist with review and shepherding team output.

Assist in hand off to Product Manager for to-market initiatives.

Provide Team Support:

Organize and engage discussion around feasibility, estimation and the adaptation of our scaling methodology.

Support the team's SDLC evolution.

Effectively communicate and document Status, issues, dependencies, or blockers of important road-map items.

Provide timing/estimations throughout the development lifecycle.

Create content that supports product & features prior to, or around release, aligning with external/internal publishing.

Document key meeting notes as needed.

Group and identify project considerations/resources.

Make and maintain project tracking pages.

Work with team to ensure successful outcomes.

Required Skills & Proficiencies:

Experience in Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)

Writing and managing of business and technical requirements

Client Relationship Management

Project Management experience

Strong communication skills

A high level of organization is required

Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, JIRA, & Confluence

BS at accredited university

3 years of related work experience

Experience with Java, SQL, and Linux is a plus

Job Title

Senior Client Service Associate

This team is developing innovative financing solutions designed for our growing base of 1.5M merchants. Become a subject matter expert on small business lending and Clover financing tools

Work with our merchants & partners to help understand, identify, and resolve merchant questions on their financing options

Collaborate with product, operations, collections, credit risk and other internal teams to resolve issues

Assist in tracking and reporting product performance

Assist with analysis that drives product pricing and features. Drive product roadmap by identifying product/process gaps and issues

Minimum 3 years of experience in product and/or relationship management

Experience in Payments or Merchant Lending

High school graduate/GED

Bachelor's Degree or Masters Degree

Willingness to learn and grow in their career

Project Coordination, Business Analysis or Sales experience is a plus

Job Title: Business Analyst

Contract period: 12 Months

Work Location: Ridgefield Park, NJ

Summary:

Lead process innovation through project management and execution to achieve strategic goals and operational excellence. Collaborate with partner teams, identify root causes to problems and use data driven approaches to develop and implement new business processes and solutions. The role encompasses all projects from top management based on the company needs and should go above and beyond assigned responsibility to achieve success.

Requirements & Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree (BA or BS) in Business, Finance, Information Systems, Engineering or related field
At least 3-4 years of experience working as a data/business analyst, project manager, or in a process improvement role
Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, navigating ambiguity, and managing competing priorities
Have project and program management skills with several years of experience initiating activities, setting priorities, managing multiple priorities and delivering on-time results
Enjoy learning new business processes quickly and efficiently as well as championing project requirements on behalf of business owners
A strategic thinker and problem solver with the ability to transform goals into actionable plans that you will drive end-to-end
Work independently as well as in a team environment to achieve team goals and complete assignments within established deadlines
Ability to quickly learn and understand new topics, businesses, and processes through research and interviews with subject matter experts
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, especially pertaining to sales, operations, logistics, system, and financial functions
Willing to work in the office per company guideline and travel up to 10%
Have experience using data visualization, automation and analytics tools preferred (not required)

Responsibilities:

Support company-wide system implementation and business process improvement projects through evaluation of current work processes and execution of improvement strategies
Analyze, visualize and automate data processes working independently or with cross functional teams
Evaluate business needs and initiate quantitative and qualitative analysis to support project proposal or evaluation results
Lead business requirement gathering and manage comprehensive project documentation
Develop processes to efficiently manage, monitor, and track project deliverables
Manage relationships and expectations of both internal and external stakeholders
Lead project team meetings to communicate project status
Prepare materials in MS Office applications such as Word, Excel, and Power Point to be presented within and outside of the team

Job Type: Contract

Salary: $7,000.00 - $7,200.00 per month

Schedule:

8 hour shift
Day shift
Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:

Ridgefield Park, NJ 07660: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Experience:

SQL: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

Planned Parenthood is the nation’s leading provider and advocate of high-quality, affordable sexual and reproductive health care for all people, as well as the nation’s largest provider of sex education. With more than 600 health centers across the country, Planned Parenthood organizations serve all patients with care and compassion, with respect, and without judgment, striving to create equitable access to health care. Through health centers, programs in schools and communities, and online resources, Planned Parenthood is a trusted source of reliable education and information that allows people to make informed health decisions. We do all this because we care passionately about helping people lead healthier lives.



Planned Parenthood Federation of America (PPFA) is a 501(c)(3) charitable organization that supports the independently incorporated Planned Parenthood affiliates operating health centers across the U.S. Planned Parenthood Action Fund is an independent, nonpartisan, not-for-profit membership organization formed as the advocacy and political arm of Planned Parenthood Federation of America. The Action Fund engages in educational, advocacy, and electoral activity, including grassroots organizing, legislative advocacy, and voter education.

Planned Parenthood Federation of America (PPFA) and Planned Parenthood Action Fund (PPAF) seek an experienced Information Technology Associate Director, Business Relationship Manager. This job reports to the Senior Director, Business Relationship Management in the Tech Governance domain in the Information Technology (IT) Department of PPFA. The IT department provides technology strategy, operational support and tech delivery /implementation of the information technology products and services while the Information Security program safeguards the data entrusted to Planned Parenthood by its patients, supporters, donors and staff.

Purpose:

The Associate Director, Business Relationship Management's primary responsibility is serving as a trusted liaison between PPFA business partners and our Information Technology & Information Security Teams. The Associate Director, Business Relationship Management Partners with business stakeholders and is the orchestrator and navigator between the business and technology / InfoSec teams. Additionally, this role will focus on championing technology and InfoSec best practices across the business to further strengthen the overall security and privacy of PPFA by minimizing technology, brand, and reputational risk. This includes developing a robust understanding of business needs digital strategy, and having a comprehensive awareness of cross-functional technology initiatives.
Creates value by analyzing technology requests to achieve solid business outcomes.
Innovate organizational change through the organization's continual quest to evolve
Proactively serve as a “trusted advisor,”
Function as a key point of contact for IT and be an advocate on behalf of business to ensure IT services meet business priorities and needs.
Ensures Information Security requirements are addressed across the enterprise through the Business Relationship Management function that is inclusive of Business Information Security needs.
This role is all about building, nurturing and managing relationships across all levels within the business, especially at senior levels.
Has a passion for new technology with a key focus on maximizing the value from our technology solutions.
Provides strategic technological insights to ultimately solve business problems.
Helps define, support and continually improve the tech governance process across PPFA.

Delivery:

Foster trusted partnerships and relationships with all PPFA business partners (i.e., Information Technology, People, Culture & Equity, Finance, Data Analytics, etc. and all other PPFA teams)
Engaging with business partners to develop a robust understanding of key business processes, priorities, and portfolios while bringing a security lens to the table
Developing and tracking action plans to manage mitigations where necessary by collaborating with InfoSec and IT teams to raise and address risks in the environment appropriately
Supporting ongoing maintenance of Tech Governance Metrics and BRM dashboard with key project updates and tracking of risks/mitigations
Optimize approaches and build consistency for the business relationship management function, ensuring a high degree of business partner satisfaction while delivering value to the enterprise.
Devise business technology roadmaps and prioritization of demand for tech products and services to address emerging needs.
Gather and understand business requirements and ideas; consistently translate ideas and requirements into clearly articulated definitions for projects. Concisely documenting business requirements and critically analyzing business processes.
Help scope and support approved projects. Ensuring they remain on track to meet our requirements, align with strategy and realize the expected value.
High-level Business analysis – compiling and maintaining project documentation such as business specifications (BRD) and Project Charters.Reviewing Business Requirements Documents for new initiatives and making security/privacy recommendations as needed
Designing and recommending enterprise technology and information security best practices that are scalable and easy to adapt to changing business requirements
Ensure that effective communication occurs related to service delivery and project delivery (e.g. planned downtime, changes, open tickets)
Work with clients to plan and make sure they understand the relevance and impact of IT changes to their operations
Help scope and support approved projects. Ensuring they remain on track to meet our requirements, align with strategy and realize the expected value.
Define, agree to, and report on key service metrics. Supporting ongoing maintenance of Tech Governance Metrics and BRM dashboard with key project updates and tracking of risks/mitigations

Engagement:

Balancing diverse stakeholder expectations with strong meeting management, relationship-building, and negotiating skills.
Translating technical information into easily understandable information for non-technical audiences and facilitating risk-based discussions.
Being comfortable working independently while contributing successfully to cross-functional teams.
Providing clear, concise, and well-organized feedback/updates to leaders and key stakeholders, ensuring they see the value of technology initiatives, understand security risks, and know the status of ongoing tech projects and tasks.
Fostering trusted relationships to represent Information Technology and InfoSec teams across the organization
Manage expectations of multiple business stakeholders. Engage stakeholders across all levels of the PPFA National Office on identifying deliverables, timeframes, and expectations regarding IT application planning, support and service delivery.
Act as a bridge between IT and the business
Knowledge of the Business - Understands the main business activities for each department and which tech services are required to complete each business activity
Understands business processes and associated business activities for each user group within a department.
Advocates for PPFA Business Partners - BRMs are invested in client success
Understands the strategies and plans of the business partners and helps develop an IT strategic plan/roadmap that maps to business strategies
Advises the business partners on understanding tech governance processes
Helps business partners to develop proposals and advance them through the project intake and assessment process

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (KSAs):
5+ years in a role at the Management Level in IT, program management, or business domain to be served by BRM position
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant business or technology discipline
A leader who has worked in a business-facing IT organization with demonstrated experience in partnering with business stakeholders
Experience with information security and privacy processes, strategies, and standards
Experience with information security frameworks such as HIPAA, PCI DSS, NIST CSF, ISO 27001, HITRUST CSF
Proven skills and experience balancing security needs with business requirements
High level of interpersonal skills to interact with leaders at multiple levels and facilitate collaborative interactions to achieve desired outcomes
Project Management Professional Certification (PMP) desired, but not required, with relevant security or technology work experience. Working knowledge of Agile methodologies and proven ability to foster an agile culture.
Experience collaborating with Senior level Management
BRM and/or ITSM certification preferred
Extremely organized, process-oriented, and a self-starter who works well in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to proactively develop solutions to problems and challenges in your project management and know when to ask for help and support.
Strong oral and written communicator with excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to build strong, effective partnerships with both internal and external stakeholders to work effectively across difference, soliciting feedback and input from significant stakeholder groups.
High proficiency in Google products
Flexibility and ability to adapt to quickly changing priorities and ambiguous situations
Commitment to PPFA’s mission and diversity, equity, and inclusion, particularly surrounding race equity
A deep commitment to Planned Parenthood’s mission of promoting Sexual and Reproductive Health
Skills
Able to work with senior stakeholders to influence the status quo
Offers constructive suggestions and acts as a trusted advisor to the business
Strong customer service orientation
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
Empathetic and with strong interpersonal skills; able to influence, negotiate and resolve conflict
Proven ability to communicate and explain complex issues in clear, concise, persuasive language both verbally and in writing
Highly adaptable and flexible; able to adjust quickly to new situations and changing priorities
Able to offer creative, innovative, and strategic solutions to business challenges
Facilitate and influence end-to-end engagement to achieve desired business outcomes

Knowledge & Experience:

Experience working in a complex and customer-focused service delivery environment in support of business strategy
Excellent understanding of one or more business areas and a comprehensive understanding of the IT organization
Experience facilitating change management involving business processes and organizational change
Demonstrated knowledge of core business processes and operations
Demonstrated knowledge of strategic use of technology to optimize business objectives
Understand and able to communicate core concepts and lifecycle of IT lines of service (e.g. hardware, software, security, project management)
Understand and able to communicate complex business requirements to the technology teams
Understand and able to communicate technology fundamentals to business teams
Proven experience conducting business analysis and soliciting, understanding, and verifying business requirements
Able to communicate up and down the management chain, providing the appropriate message to the audience

Travel: 0-10%, as needed


$115,000 - $123,000 a year
Total offer package to include generous vacation + sick leave + paid holidays, individual/family provided medical, dental and vision benefits effective day 1, life insurance, short/long term disability, paid family leave and 401k. We also offer voluntary opt-in for Flexible Spending Account (FSA) and Transportation/Commuter accounts.

Job Title: Tableau Experienced Business Analyst / Data Analyst
Job Description:
The New Jersey Turnpike Authority is need of a Tableau experienced data or business analyst. The ideal candidate should have at least 5 years recent working experience with Tableau.

Under the general direction of the Assistant Director of Data and Performance Services, the Business Intelligence & Business Analytics Administrator develops, maintains, manages, administers, and supports the Authority’s data warehouse. The position focuses on identifying opportunities to create data marts and data warehouses, which will provide upper management with reliable information in order to make informed decisions on day-to-day business objectives, as well as, long term projects. This position also includes a wide range of responsibilities and duties regarding business intelligence and business analytics tools, and platforms, which are in accordance with the Authority’s goals and requirements.

1. Work with other departments to prioritize business and information needs, as well as, identify opportunities for improvement.

2. Collaborate with team members to collect, standardize, and analyze data.

3. Acquire data from various data sources; primary, secondary, or tertiary, and maintain databases and data systems.

4. Structure large data sets to find usable information.

5. Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies which optimize statistical efficiency and quality.

6. Filter, “clean,” and troubleshoot data to correct problems.

Overview

Kanter Auto is seeking an entrepreneurial and data-driven Operations Analyst to join our team. We are recently under new ownership, and our new CEO is focused on modernizing and optimizing our operations to support significant growth. You'll work closely with him to implement new systems, simplify processes, eliminate waste, and build a strong foundation of operational data. You will be given the opportunity to identify and launch projects independently and will have a major impact on our company's performance.

If you want to learn about all the operational aspects of running and growing a high-performance eCommerce business, this is the opportunity for you.

About Kanter Auto

Welcome to our company – an iconic name in the vintage automotive parts and accessories industry for the past sixty years. As of June 2023, we are proud to announce that we are under new ownership, embarking on an exciting new chapter of growth and innovation.

Our legacy as a retailer has been built on providing high-quality parts and unmatched expertise in the classic car market. If you are passionate about operational excellence and want to be part of a company that is dedicated to serving the vintage parts market with renewed energy and vision, come join us on this exciting journey of transformation and advancement. Together, we can shape the future of the aftermarket parts industry.

Who we're looking for:

To be a great fit for this job, you must have:

Previous experience establishing new processes and systems. Previous consulting experience strongly preferred, but not required. (Our new CEO is a previous Accenture consultant and the owner of another successful ecommerce company.)
A data-driven mindset and very strong familiarity with Excel (VLOOKUP, INDEX, MATCH). You know how to structure datasets in order to derive insights and solve business problems.
The ability to dive in, analyze the current process, and quickly develop an understanding of how to improve things. You are a very fast learner.
Very strong general familiarity with technology. You do not need to be an expert in warehouse and operational systems, but you need to be very comfortable with learning new systems and doing some configuration yourself. You know what an API is. Netsuite or other ERP knowledge is a plus.
Excellent analytical and process skills. For example, you can set up a lightweight, efficient system to capture weights and dimensions, barcode, and take eCommerce photos for thousands of products that will run well without your constant involvement.

Had you been with us last month, you would have…

Built an Excel model for forecasting inventory purchasing based on data from an old ERP that requires significant analysis to correct the data.
Reviewed our vendors by category and identified critical sourcing projects that must be started.
Assessed our site technology needs (workstations, networking, security) and managed the project from quote through implementation.
Assisted with our Netsuite ERP implementation by gathering data, analyzing current processes to determine requirements, and learning the system.
Received the instruction “we need to barcode our products” and figured out a plan how to make that happen, from beginning to end, for tens of thousands of items.

If you work with us, within the next two years it's likely that you'll:

Lead an assessment project to plan a move to a more modern warehouse facility.
Develop a process to systematically review and process more than 100,000 square feet of vintage auto parts, working with partners in eCommerce and wholesale sales to make them available for sale.
Implement strict inventory control procedures by improving receiving, shipping, and implementing periodic inventory counts.
Set up a large-scale process for capturing product weights, dimensions, and product photography for tens of thousands of products.
Visit other companies to learn about best practices that can be implemented in our facility

Qualities that will make you a good fit for Kanter Auto:

Technology Fluency. You can learn a new application faster than almost anyone around you.
Independence and Efficiency. You get things done faster than your peers and are always improving your execution. You have the right information at your fingertips because you planned in advance. You can independently manage a huge backlog by identifying actions from high-level objectives and prioritizing intelligently. You follow through on all your commitments, on time.
Humility. If it's part of running and building the business, nothing is outside your job description. And that's something you value and appreciate.
Respect. We treat customers, vendors, and each other with tremendous respect and sincere appreciation. They are people first, and business partners second.
Balanced Intensity. You approach your work with intensity, but you're an easy person to be around.
Clear Communication. Clear, concise, and professional written and verbal communication skills. You get your point across effectively and know how to focus on the right things.

Benefits:

Flexible Schedule
Paid Holidays
Vacation, Sick and Personal time.
Health, Dental and Vision benefits.
401(k)

Background & Purpose of the Job

Customer Business Development (CBD) is what we call our Sales organization at Unilever. CBD works closely with customers to pioneer new products, build categories, and deploy best-in-class retail and shopper capabilities.

As the Sales Analyst - Drug Channel , you will play a key role in providing analytical support, proactively analyzing, and reviewing information to identify opportunities or potential challenges across Unilever’s businesses. The focus of the position is to serve as key support to the Customer Business Manager and Business Development Manager for Health & Beauty Division across all categories/brands and key stakeholders within Unilever.

You will report directly to the Customer Business Manager and also work closely with Division Director, BDM, Team Leads and category CBM’s to achieve our goals. This role is vital to the success of the Health & Beauty business and will help ensure our strategic/financial health in the Sector. It will require someone who is self-motivated with excellent influencing skills, has an ability to work independently and is team oriented.

Who You Are & What You’ll Do

You are a born leader: You seek fresh opportunities, insisting on innovation and never settling for “good enough.” You take pride in delivering work to the highest standards.

You are a strategy guru: You love to think outside the box and imagine new possibilities for the business. You are a visionary, creating strategies to drive business growth and inspiring others along the way.

You love to win and have fun doing it: You believe in taking the lead in the marketplace versus following. You have a positive attitude about the company's future and a passion for winning.

Metaprise is a payment network company that operates across borders. Our headquarters is located in New York, USA, and we also have offices in London and Shenzhen. We provide reliable merchant processing services, cross-border payment banking services, and Pay by Metaprise wallet services to global financial institutions and banks. Our main product lines are Payin, Payout, and Wallets.

To date, we have facilitated several billion US dollars in transactions annually, with most of them originating from the United States, United Kingdom and the European Union region. At Metaprise, we aim to revamp the global Cross-border Clearing Payment System to make it more widely used and efficient. We launched our multi-currency account in 2021, and it has already helped tens of thousands of businesses manage their money across the world.

Metaprise is seeking a talented and motivated Payments Solution Manager to join our dynamic team. The successful candidate will collaborate with product managers, marketing specialists, and other stakeholders to understand and shape the future of our payments solution platform. You will play a pivotal role in eliciting, documenting, and analyzing business requirements, translating them into actionable specifications, and ensuring the seamless development and implementation of payment-related features. If you are passionate about innovation, user experience, and operational excellence, we invite you to apply.
Responsibilities:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product managers, marketing specialists, and other stakeholders, to deeply understand business needs and objectives related to the payments solution platform.
Elicit, document, and analyze detailed business requirements, ensuring a clear and comprehensive understanding of stakeholders' expectations and goals.
Translate business requirements into comprehensive solution specifications and use cases, providing a clear roadmap for the development and implementation of the payments platform.
Create detailed functional and technical documentation that serves as a reference for development, quality assurance, and other relevant teams.
Work closely with development teams to effectively communicate requirements, address questions, and ensure accurate implementation of payment-related features and functionalities.
Collaborate with marketing teams to align solution capabilities with current market trends, customer needs, and competitive positioning.
Identify opportunities to enhance user experience, streamline processes, and increase operational efficiency within the payments solution context.
Provide recommendations for improvements to the payments platform based on industry best practices and customer feedback.
Work with quality assurance teams to define comprehensive test scenarios, ensuring that implemented payment solutions meet specified requirements and deliver intended outcomes.
Assist in the creation of training materials and provide support to internal teams, ensuring their proficiency in using and communicating the benefits of the payments platform
Minimum Qualification and Prerequisite:
Bachelor's degree in Business, Information Technology, or a related field. Master's degree is a plus.
Proven experience of +3 years as a Business Analyst, Solution Analyst, or similar role in the payments or financial technology industry.
Strong understanding of payments industry trends, technologies, and best practices.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities, with meticulous attention to detail.
Proficiency in creating clear and concise documentation, including solution specifications, use cases, and functional requirements.
Experience working in an Agile development environment is preferred.
Ability to collaborate effectively in cross-functional teams and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build productive relationships with colleagues and stakeholders.
What you’ll get:
Shape the payments platform by translating business needs into technical specifications.
Enhance user experience and streamline processes in collaboration with cross-functional teams.
Drive innovation and market alignment in the payments technology landscape.
We understand that in reality, exceptional individuals may not always perfectly match every requirement. This is why we value potential as much as experience in our hiring process. Even if you don't check every box in the job description, if you believe this role and our company align well with you, we encourage you to apply. Join a team dedicated to safeguarding, healing, and nurturing for a cleaner and healthier world.

At Metaprise, all qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, disability, or medical condition; ethnicity, race, citizenship, and national origin; religion or faith; family status, pregnancy, and caring responsibilities; sexual orientation; gender identity, gender expression, and transgender identity; protected veteran status; size or any other protected basis under appropriate law.

Do you want to be part of a high performing sales team?
Do you have a passion for building strong and lasting relationships with customers? Are you a team player who is adept at collaborating across internal and external teams? If so, Guardian is seeking a Sales Analyst, Core Market to join its Core Market Group Benefits Sales team.
The Sales Analyst’s primary accountability is to act as the designated Field resource to support Sales Executives and Client Management team in the 25-999 market. They are accountable for following all (SOPs) Standard Operating Procedures for the RFP and New Business/Add Issue submission processes. A successful Sales Analyst must demonstrate strong product / business knowledge, collaboration / communication skills, project management and the ability to perform tasks using technology and systems utilized within Guardian (Outlook, Salesforce, CPS, Excel, Adobe, SharePoint, Access, etc.). The position must balance the needs of the clients with those of the business and respond to customer inquiries with the objective of selling new business, ensuring that client satisfaction, accuracy, competitiveness, and profitability are achieved. Additional major responsibilities include negotiations with Underwriters, effective collaboration with Sales Executives and other team members, and managing the requoting of proposals as needed to help generate sales.
You Will:
Perform duties associated with Inventory Management, RFP processing, and new business/add issue submissions. Position works closely with Sales Executives, Client Management, Rating, Underwriting, Onboarding, and Producers /Assistants to ensure that information required for releasing a competitive quote and submitting new business is received and processed accurately and in a timely manner.
Manage RFP Inventory and Quote Process including:
reviewing RFP data, discerning what has been received and identifying what is needed to underwrite and release a quote,
Partnering with Rating and Quoting to ensure proposals are on track to meet due dates
Meeting with team to review inventory status
Make recommendations regarding benefit / rate options based on analysis of RFP and assessment of customer’s buying triggers through consultative interactions with Sales Executives and customers.
Engage key internal stakeholders needed to put together a comprehensive proposal strategy (i.e. dental recruitment, BenTech, Worksite, Enrollment)
Independently, or in collaboration with Sales Executives:
Meet with Underwriting to negotiate rates, exceptions, and approvals;
Discuss RFP, plan design options, and multi-line options with Producers and their assistants,
Build strong relationships with underwriting, brokers, and their staff to ensure that customer needs are met while maintaining profitability and acceptable risk.
Proactively contact Producers / Assistants to follow up on quotes to gauge competitiveness and/or gather post-mortem data.
If Guardian is awarded the business, work closely with Sales Executive/Underwriter to finalize sold quote and initiate Onboarding process following SOP.
Handoff and transition case from sales to Onboarding.
Provide backup support to colleagues as needed.
Serve as Subject Matter Expert on various Guardian systems and procedures.

1-3 years of group insurance experience processing RFP preferred
Knowledge of group insurance, products, and services
Knowledge of underwriting principles and practices
Demonstrated success in servicing customers (Producers / Assistants / Planholders)

Excellent organizational and time management skills

The role encompasses all projects from top management based on the company needs and should go above and beyond assigned responsibility to achieve success.

Responsibilities


Support company-wide system implementation and business process improvement projects through evaluation of current work processes and execution of improvement strategies
Analyze, visualize and automate data processes working independently or with cross functional teams
Evaluate business needs and initiate quantitative and qualitative analysis to support project proposal or evaluation results
Lead business requirement gathering and manage comprehensive project documentation
Develop processes to efficiently manage, monitor, and track project deliverables
Manage relationships and expectations of both internal and external stakeholders
Lead project team meetings to communicate project status
Prepare materials in MS Office applications such as Word, Excel, and Power Point to be presented within and outside of the team



Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree (BA or BS) in Business, Finance, Information Systems, Engineering or related field
At least 3-4 years of experience working as a data/business analyst, project manager, or in a process improvement role
Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, navigating ambiguity, and managing competing priorities
Have project and program management skills with several years of experience initiating activities, setting priorities, managing multiple priorities and delivering on-time results
Enjoy learning new business processes quickly and efficiently as well as championing project requirements on behalf of business owners
A strategic thinker and problem solver with the ability to transform goals into actionable plans that you will drive end-to-end

Excellent written and verbal communication skills, especially pertaining to sales, operations, logistics, system, and financial functions

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

** NO C2C **

Who We Are


Cint is a pioneer in research technology (ResTech). Our customers use the Cint platform to post questions and get answers from real people to build business strategies, confidently publish research, accurately measure the impact of digital advertising, and more. The Cint platform is built on a programmatic marketplace, which is the world’s largest, with nearly 300 million respondents in over 150 countries who consent to sharing their opinions, motivations, and behaviours.

We are feeding the world’s curiosity!


The Opportunity

The Measurement Team at Cint specializes in digital media measurement and advertising effectiveness. Media Measurement enables advertisers to achieve real-time results for their media campaigns based on the proprietary Impact Measurement by Cint software solution.

Members of the Measurement Operations Team are responsible for managing and executing digital advertising effectiveness research projects, while serving as a consultative resource for customers to enhance their overall experience. The position plays a critical role for the organization and is accountable for successful project execution and deliverables.





What You Will Do

Support clients with strong, simple, and direct communication around brand lift methodology, product features, roadmap, limitations and best practices for Cint’s suite of Measurement products
Develop and maintain an up-to-date understanding of product changes and methodology improvements
Train and engage customers in the advertising and media industries on Cint’s proprietary cross-platform campaign measurement software
Independently execute tasks across a multitude of projects concurrently while ensuring a high level of quality and internal communication with little supervision from management
Compile and extract data from Cint proprietary software, Excel, PowerBI, Salesforce, Qualtrics etc. to present insights to internal stakeholders
Mange tasks within the lifecycle of media measurement research projects including pixel generation, project setup, and reporting while following standard operating procedures and best practices
Work collaboratively with Sales, Product and Support teams to flag key customer challenges and drive forward product improvements as a voice of the customer internally
Achieve client’s measurement goals by utilizing clear, proactive communication internally and externally to ensure all deliverables are completed accurately in a timely manner
Understand and follow best practices and standard operating procedures to work efficiently as an account team, completing necessary project tasks, identifying project challenges, implementing solutions, and managing expectations
Develop a full understanding of Cint’s measurement products and internal software to expertly execute sampling strategies for concurrent research projects





What We Are Looking For

Previous experience in project management, customer success, account management, client services or other related client-facing positions
Strong communication skills with a proven ability convey complex or technical information in a simple, direct manner
Comfort speaking by phone or teleconferencing with clients (Zoom, Teams, etc)
Proficient in Excel and advanced formulas and features such as Pivot Tables & VLOOKUP
Advanced problem solving and critical thinking
Strong work ethic with self-motivated mindset and drive to achieve goals
Detail oriented, self-starter who is eager to learn new skills and concepts
An innate sense of accountability
Flexibility in the ever-changing market research technology landscape
Positive attitude with team-player mentality

Bonus Points If You Have

Knowledge of the digital media ecosystem and how digital media campaigns are designed and executed
Experience in advertising operations, advertising technology and market research technology industries
Survey design and programming experience in Qualtrics, Survey Monkey, Alchemer, etc.
Microsoft Excel certification
Market Research coursework
Working knowledge of statistical concepts and methodology

This base pay range is specific to California, Colorado, New York City and Washington and may not be applicable to other locations. Founded in 1998 in Stockholm, Sweden, Cint is a global software leader in digital insights and research technology. In January 2022, Cint acquired Lucid, a US- based programmatic research technology platform. Cint Group AB (publ), listed on Nasdaq Stockholm (STO:CINT), has a global workforce of over 1,000. Cint has offices in Stockholm, London, New York, New Orleans, Singapore, Gurgaon, Sydney, and Japan, among other locations (www.cint.com).

Track record of leading cross-functional initiatives, driving high performance, meeting deadlines and executing on deliverables

Sompo's core business encompasses one of the largest property and casualty insurance groups in the Japanese domestic market. As a leading global provider of insurance and reinsurance, we recognize that our success is derived directly from those who matter most: our people.
