Job Title: Senior Financial Analyst – Digital Ad Sales
Job Description:
The Ad Sales Finance team is seeking a Senior Financial Analyst to support ESPN digital ad sales and reporting to the Senior Manager, Finance. The team works closely with Disney Ad Sales Revenue and Yield Management (RYM), Research, Accounting, Strategy, Partnerships teams to deliver strategic, financial, and operational insights and goals of the business.

Job Summary:

The SFA will partner with the RYM, Research, Partnerships, Strategy, Subscription Finance, and Controllership teams to analyze and forecast the performance of the ESPN advertising business. This includes but is not limited to, evaluating overall portfolio health, extracting data insights into inventory and demand trends, preparing reports and presentations for management, and assisting with other strategic projects. The role will also be responsible for providing recurring metric reporting, which includes assisting the Senior Manager, Finance in standing up a new set of metrics and business processes. They will help develop models of the full funnel ad model for ESPN, Rate/Volume analysis, and tightly coordinate business planning across streaming platforms (Disney+, Hulu, ESPN+).He/She will lead analysis and insights into digital OI growth initiatives such as inventory optimization, pricing opportunities, and new product features, by applying data-driven analysis.

The data-driven culture here requires this candidate to have strong analytical and data mining abilities, so experience with database and large data set is strongly preferred. Due to the market-facing nature of our work and our shifting industry landscape, a successful candidate will have the ability to efficiently implement their tasks, develop new ways of analyzing and thinking about existing problems, work cross-functionally to get job done, and contribute to ideas and initiatives generation.

This role relies heavily on a working knowledge of the ad sales business. The ideal candidate will be able to easily navigate and clearly communicate between the ad sales organization and the finance organization. A strong analytical background to drive business insights and recommendations with quantifiable impact is required.

Responsibilities and Duties of the Role:
Work closely with operation teams including Sales, Product, Marketing, and Data teams to forecast revenue (weekly reporting, monthly forecasts, Budget, Long Range Plan). Build and develop data queries to extract insights from existing data base, apply data skills to identify trends in business/metrics, and discover opportunities to improve business health and yield optimization.
Assist with the development, maintenance, and enhancement of reporting tools and financial models.
Participate in ad-hoc analysis to help drive business strategic business decisions including rights acquisitions, fast channels, ESPN Bet, 3rd party partnerships, and new product updates to help drive engagement.
Presentation & Decision Support: assist process of crafting presentations to support executive decision-making. Regularly present analytical insights to drive decisions and identify areas for improvement.
Required Education, Experience/Skills/Training:
2+ years in a corporate finance / business analytics role (ad sales experience is a plus)
Experience with SQL, Tableau, MicroStrategy, database tools preferred
Extensive experience and proficient in Microsoft Excel modeling and quantitative data analysis. Outstanding Excel skills required (nested statements, pivot tables, charting, combining functions like Index Match, Offset and Indirect)
Exceptional analytical abilities, capable of using data tools to drive decision-making and managing large pools of data in Excel.
Experience in SAP, COGNOS, or similar financial reporting tool preferred.
Proactive communication style with the ability to build/foster relationships with business partners internally and externally.
Strong ability to extract key information and share results that are clear and adaptable to the audience.
Acute attention to detail and skills for troubleshooting data discrepancies
Strong intellectual curiosity and ability to think outside-the-box.
Strong work ethic and an ability to prioritize across multiple projects. Goal-oriented and client-facing mentality, entrepreneurial spirit to continue innovating and making valuable contributions.
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting or Economics is a plus.
Benefits:

Disney offers a rewards package to help you live your best life. This includes health and savings benefits, educational opportunities, and special extras that only Disney can provide. Learn more about our benefits and perks at https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits

Shopbop is looking for a Business Intelligence Engineer to help improve and grow Shopbop’s presence in Amazon Marketplace. This role will own development of long-term automation solutions to improve Marketplace workflow, while also creating short-term tools and reporting to support the evolving needs of the business. The ideal candidate is innovative, data-driven and strives to answer fast-changing business/operational questions with thoughtful analysis. They are comfortable in distilling data from multiple sources to create simplified, concise reporting and visualizations to support leadership decision making, and can manage multiple analyses/projects simultaneously. Top characteristics desired are detail-orientated, process-focused, customer-focused, and a team player with a passion for problem-solving and efficiency. This person must be excellent at prioritizing and working cross-functionally to deliver on improvements – as well as documenting and measuring the success of those actions. This individual must be an exceptional communicator who works to understand (in some cases challenge) and meet requirements of multiple teams. The responsibilities and qualifications listed below are further representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

The person in this role will help to manage Shopbop’s business of selling on Amazon Marketplace, including day-to-day business evaluation, creating and simplifying reporting through automation, data visualization, forecasting and building financial plans, identifying and socializing opportunities for growth. This person must proactively create mechanisms and partner with cross-functional teams to identify pain points or opportunities that will improve product availability, conversion and revenue. This person will be a quick learner, detail oriented and collaborative – able to work across teams and possess expertise in both qualitative and quantitative analysis with a passion for delivering actionable insights to key stakeholders. The right candidate will blend advanced reporting with strong critical thinking and project management skills. Your success in the role will have a large impact on improving the customer experience and growing Shopbop’s Marketplace business.

Key job responsibilities

Analyze and solve business problems at their root, stepping back to understand the broader context.
Develop and drive critical metrics to monitor and optimize the business. Generate flexible models for KPI definition and tracking to support Shopbop strategic initiatives
Own Marketplace business reporting, including creation of reports and dashboards, synthesis of take-aways, and action items. Use data mining, model building, and other analytical techniques to develop customer insights and business opportunities.
Enable efficient decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format.
Manage and refine key business processes, making recommendations for automation where needed and working with relevant teams on prioritization.
Develop concise, insightful reporting on the key drivers of our business and facilitate team reviews weekly, monthly, and quarterly.
Build business forecasts and track progress, understand business drivers, and identify levers to improve against trajectory. Contribute to progress updates and performance summaries to company business review documents. Report on business to broader group of stakeholders regularly, engage in related discussions, and own follow-ups.
Assist with major projects through data gathering and manipulation, synthesis and modeling, problem solving, and communication of insights and recommendations.
Partner with internal stakeholders to gain a deep understanding of the business need and existing challenges and act as a primary liaison with Buying and Planning teams to identify opportunities for growth. Support cross-functional teams on day-to-day business management, marketing, promotions and operations and create scalable tools and reporting to facilitate Marketplace specific insights and actions.
Partner with key stakeholders from Product Management and Technology to prioritize roadmap decisions.
Build and maintain appropriate and beneficial relationships with key Amazon teams.
Write high quality SQL codes to retrieve and analyze data
Communicate complex, data-driven subject matter to key stakeholders, both verbally and in writing. Design and implement reporting solutions to enable stakeholders to make effective decisions.
We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

New York, NY, USA


Bachelor’s degree or higher in Engineering, Math, Finance, Statistics, Computer Science, or other technical field from an accredited university
Experience with Amazon Marketplace systems such as Seller Central or Vendor Central
Understanding of how to drive success selling a product on Amazon
Experience in an e-commerce environment

Wyndham Hotels & Resorts is now seeking a Senior Analyst, Data Operations to join our team at the Parsippany - 22 Sylvan Way location in Parsippany, New Jersey.

Why Wyndham?

By joining Wyndham Hotels & Resorts, you will play an integral role in our mission to make hotel travel possible for all. You’ll be part of the largest hotel franchise company in the world, where we strive to deliver the best value to our owners and guests. Most importantly, you’ll be entrusted to live our unique Count on Me culture, set by our core values of integrity, accountability, inclusive, caring and fun. At Wyndham, we provide all team members the opportunity to grow through best-in-class training and career development, leadership training, mentorship opportunities and educational support. Supporting our team members is a top priority, which is why we offer competitive compensation and benefits, vacation, team member appreciation days, workplace flexibility and much more. At Wyndham Hotels & Resorts, we value and embrace a culture of diversity, equity and inclusion that supports team members of all backgrounds and experiences. We can’t wait to welcome you!

The Role

The Senior Analyst, Data Operations will support IT Data Technology and business reporting teams. The primary responsibility will be to structure large data sets, understand and produce analysis that will be used to drive user insights, identification of performance improvement opportunities, ad hoc analysis, and reporting to support key initiatives within the organization.

What you'll do
Collecting project requirements and meeting with project teams regularly to coordinate tasks, resolve conflicts, and identify opportunities for improvement.
Create reports for internal teams and/or external clients.
Collaborate with team members to collect and analyze data.
Establish KPIs to measure the effectiveness of business decisions.
Updating project documentation, determining which tasks to prioritize and ensuring the timely completion of deliverables.
Manage and assist in prioritizing the data and maintenance backlog.
Work with Incident Management and Support teams on all data-related issues.
Communicate effectively with the business on incident and event updates.
Follow the Incident Management process as designed by Wyndham.
Identify and implement process improvement opportunities to support operational efficiencies.
Using sound judgment to escalate issues to the affected parties and other key stakeholders
Planning and estimating the specific requirements involved in a project or strategic initiative.
Developing a communication process to collaborate with customers and update stakeholders on the progress of a project.
Facilitating meetings with organizational leadership and organizing presentations.
Create presentations and reports based on recommendations and findings across the company to model data in a scalable way and present it in an impactful and digestible way that leads to better business decisions.
Updating project documentation, determining which tasks to prioritize and ensuring the timely completion of deliverables.
Manage and assist in prioritizing the data and maintenance backlog.
Application of Data Governance principles and framework across the products.
Escalate risks and issues during all phases of the project.
Establish a perspective on data needs, designs, work breakdowns, and roadmaps that meet shared goals and demonstrate incremental value.
You'll be successful if you have
Experience working in a customer facing role.
Flexible, open to changes and adapts quickly to new environments, tools and processes.
Clear understanding of relational databases, data warehouses and reporting analytics/KPI.
Analytical and problem-solving skills.
Experience with statistical software (e.g., Stata, SPSS).
Knowledge of data gathering, data warehousing, cleaning and transforming techniques.
Reporting and data visualization skills using software like Tableau.
Understanding of data warehousing and ETL techniques.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel.
Ability to set and meet deadlines.
Ability to work in high-pressure situations.
Experience with statistical software.
Technical writing skills.
Excellent attention to detail.
Strong written/verbal communication skills.
Ability to QA and troubleshoot data.
Strong knowledge of data management and query writing on MS SQL.

Process requests timely with minimal supervision required.
Methodical approach. Organized, possessing strong analytical abilities.

Strong work ethic and attention to detail.

Job Description
Established in 1805, the New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene (the NYC Health Department) is the oldest and largest health department in the country. Our mission is to protect and improve the health of all New Yorkers, in service of a vision of a city in which all New Yorkers can realize their full health potential, regardless of who they are, how old they are, where they are from, or where they live.

As a world-renowned public health agency with a history of building transformative public health programming and infrastructure, innovating in science and scholarship to advance public health knowledge, and responding to urgent public health crises from New York City’s yellow fever outbreak in 1822, to the COVID-19 pandemic we are a hub for public health innovation, expertise, and programs, and services. We serve as the population health strategist, and policy, and planning authority for the City of New York, while also having a vast impact on national and international public policy, including programs and services focused on food and nutrition, anti-tobacco support, chronic disease prevention, HIV/AIDS treatment, family and child health, environmental health, mental health, and racial and social justice work, among others.

Our Agency’s five strategic priorities, building off a recently-completed strategic planning process emerging from the COVID-19 emergency, are:
1) To re-envision how the Health Department prepares for and responds to health emergencies, with a focus on building a “response-ready” organization, with faster decision-making, transparent public communications, and stronger surveillance and bridges to healthcare systems 2) Address and prevent chronic and diet-related disease, including addressing rising rates of childhood obesity and the impact of diabetes, and transforming our food systems to improve nutrition and enhance access to healthy foods
3) Address the second pandemic of mental illness including: reducing overdose deaths, strengthening our youth mental health systems, and supporting people with serious mental illness
4) Reduce black maternal mortality and make New York a model city for women’s health
5) Mobilize against and combat the health impacts of climate change

The New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene (DOHMH) is the nation's leading public health agency protecting and promoting health of all New Yorkers. Our 7,000-plus team members bring an extraordinary array of languages, cultures, and experiences to bear on the work of public health. Our diversity fuels creativity because all perspectives are heard and valued. DOHMH aims to improve the health outcomes of all New Yorkers by centering persistent racial inequities and promotion of social justice at the core of its work. The Bureau of Technology Strategy & Project Management is looking for an exemplary, innovative, and reliable technology leader as an Assistant Solutions Director. The individual must have experience in developing optimal technology solutions, skillfully implementing large-scale, complex projects, and motivating and directing a team of project and application support teams. The individual must be a problem solver with strong communication skills; be able to take appropriate initiative; be goal-oriented and drive solutions to completion; and collaborate effectively with all members of the agency. The individual
will be responsible for technology modernization, as well as compliance with NYC Cyber Command security policies.


Lead and mentor a team of project managers and product managers to deliver strategic, secure, high quality IT products and services
Assist with creating and maintaining staffing plans. Ensures the team is properly trained and staffed to handle the projected workload.
Effectively manage a portfolio of projects and oversee all aspects of implementation, including requirements gathering, design, development, solution architecture, roll-out, maintenance, vendor management and project financials
Ensure project management standards are being executed across the IT project portfolio.
Makes recommendations to management regarding long-term contractors and/or additions to staff.
Analyze project proposals to determine time frame, funding limitations and appropriate process for accomplishing projects.
Provide leadership and motivation to project team members throughout the project life cycle, and confer with project staff to outline work plan.
Implement project communications including project steering committee meetings and status reports
Manage project risks and issues and implement mitigation plans.
Ensure that project goals are accomplished and in line with business objectives.
Implement modern and secure technology solutions and platforms
Oversee the RFP, contracting and procurement processes according to City-wide policies

Minimum Qualifications


1. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college in computer science, information systems, engineering, mathematics or related field and six years of satisfactory full-time experience related to enterprise architecture, solutions architecture, network architecture and/or IT infrastructure systems; or

2. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and ten years of satisfactory full-time experience related to enterprise architecture, solutions architecture, network architecture and/or IT infrastructure systems; or

3. Education and/or experience which is equivalent to "1" or "2" above.


Preferred Skills

- Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Business, or related field. - At least ten (10) years’ experience in utilizing the waterfall project management methodology to implement complex enterprise-wide systems - At least 3 (3) years’ experience leading a technical project portfolio and a team of project managers and application support managers - Knowledge of City-wide contracting and procurement processes, as well as DOITT’s systems integration services process - Knowledge of NYC Cyber Command policies - Excellent communication and writing skills - Project Management Professional (PMP) certification - Experience in Business Analysis discipline - Experience with SaaS and CRM tools such as Sales Force, etc.

Company Name: Federal Home Loan Bank of New York
Job Description:
Electronic Payments Operations Analyst I
New York (Hybrid)

The EP Payment Analyst will assist the Senior Manager of Electronic Payments (‘EP’) in the oversight of the daily operation of the EP Department. The Electronic Payment Operations Analyst I is a Senior staff member charged with acting in a managerial capacity for the daily processing of all EP transactions.
Responsible for the review and approval of reserves, overdrafts, daily proofs, OFAC review and online entries as well as a higher level authority for the processing of wires. Proactively notifies management of any disruption of service that may impact the Bank and/or Bank’s customer accounts. Recommends appropriate action to improve department deficiencies as needed. Solves complex and sensitive customer service-related issues.
Responsibilities will include.
Oversee the daily activities of all EP Department functions to ensure timely processing of all transactions.
Process respective incoming and outgoing wires for customers and internal departments
Perform/Review OFAC file load verification.
Review wires that route to OFAC queue on wire system and contact OFAC to receive verbal approval to process wire or seize funds or contact customer to receive additional information.
Advise customers of the outgoing wires that are being held for OFAC issues, lack of funds, invalid PIN and/or test code.
Handle (Release/Cancel) outgoing wires that are being held for OFAC issues, lack of funds, invalid PIN and/or test code.
Verify “High Verify” outgoing wires (non- repetitive wires over $10,000,000.00)
Review/Approve manual billing for customers accordingly.
Handle the preparation or verification of any daily reports; control sheet, overdrafts, management reports, online entries, etc.
Work with customers to assist them with their daily overdraft condition and notify management of resolution
Review/Approve GAF and Internal Wire Authorization Forms. Add, update or delete customer accounts and/or address in the wire and Overnight Investment Account (OIA) systems.
Maintain applicable metrics data on a daily and monthly basis.
Review and analyze various reports, documentation etc. and confers with other staff, Senior Manager/Officer and other internal areas to complete departmental activities.
Interfaces directly with Accounting and/or Cash Analysis and Reconciliation Department to investigate any outstanding items to be reconciled and cleared.
Participates in and assist Senior Manager/Officer with the dissemination of pertinent information, informs staff of any changes in procedures, policies and daily processing requirements based on staffing and/or systems related problems.
Assist customers with utilizing 1Link.
Approve the review and reconcilement of wires and settlement processing. Verifies that the reconcilement agrees to the Federal Reserve Bank or other vendors that the Bank does business with.
Provide quality service to all customers through staff for Wire Transfers initiated via telephone, 1Link (the Bank internet banking application), processing of incoming wires and settlement processing.
Provide BRCP assistance to EP Staff on an as needed basis.
Assist Manager with recommended changes to existing procedures as functional activities and business processes change.
Participates in the annual review of the EP Procedures to ensure they accurately reflect current Bank Policy and departmental processes.
Drafts new procedures as required.
Update/Approve the database files on the wire and/or deposit systems (e.g. add/update/delete/review or approve customer/general ledger accounts, repetitive wires, changes in wire forms, initiation of PINs and test codes, etc.).
Provide guidance for interaction with OFAC and other agencies in the handling of departmental compliance and operational risk related matters.
Help organize and create the annual Fee Analysis presentation which entail the management and collection of data from multiple departments within Bank Operations.
Comply with the Bank’s policies and procedures as they concern customers’ reserve, overdraft positions, settlement services and the processing of wires.
Perform various analyses as assigned related to various data base queries and income/expense.
Assist with the testing of the contingency procedures, in the New York and/or Jersey City Offices.
Seek opportunities when applicable to proactively reach out to members to help educate them on the latest Industry Standards and Practices
Maintain the overall level of operational effectiveness and increasing customer service by acting as a liaison between EP and the member institutions.
Coordinate the required annual contingency testing as requested from the Federal Reserve Bank.
Oversee the annual mailing of the Wire Agreement and Test Codes.
Analyze existing processes and systems to recommend alternatives, where applicable, to improve processing, productivity and function efficiencies. Perform /Assist in UAT testing as required for 1Link, Wire Transfer and Deposit systems as assigned periodically. Provide and or coordinate the ongoing training and development of the Electronic Payments staff on wire or Deposit system changes as they occur.
Perform and assist in the administration process of the 1Link system for internal Bank staff (e.g. adding/updating/deleting user, as well as adding/updating/deleting repetitive templates etc.).
Assist in gathering information for the yearly budget preparation and administration for the EP Department.
Required Skills and Experience
Minimum of five to seven years’ experience within a bank operations environment responsible for processing wire transfers, settlement activity, resolving and handling customer overdrafts.
Knowledge of Fed settlement functions, OFAC processing and other compliance control functions. Knowledge of Money Transfer Systems.
Experience with project work i.e. system testing and analysis. Knowledge of Business Continuity exercises/testing.
Advanced skills in Microsoft Word, Excel, Access and Power Point Applications.
Excellent analytical skills.
Excellent reconcilement skills.
Ability to mentor others.
Detail oriented and ability to multi-task.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills required.
Excellent interpersonal skills required.
Strong organizational skills
Working knowledge of database i.e. data mining, reporting and query skills
Strong understanding of User Acceptance Testing methods and practices
Risk Management knowledge
Education
BA/BS degree preferred in a business related major preferred. Comparable bank operations work experience and or courses in general accounting will be considered.
Salary range - $110,00.00 - $125,000

We are seeking a Sr/Finance Business Analyst to join our Finance Team in the offices. This role is part of the Finance Change Team within the Finance Department. The Sr/Finance Business Analyst is responsible for identifying, assessing, and leading various process and technology improvement initiatives with a focus on continuous improvement. They will be required to work with other Finance resources and a cross functional team from the broader business and IT during the execution of finance transformation projects. The ideal candidate will be a critical thinker who is able to independently translate general business requirements into achievable projects and ensure these changes align to the strategic vision of the Finance function.

Responsibilities include:

Serve as a key member of a project team and working with cross-functional business partners to analyze, design, and implement end to end Finance processes solutions that drive standardization, efficiency, and effectiveness / quality of processes to meet business requirements, compliance with statutory government regulations, and accounting
Leading process walkthroughs for the appropriate functional area to ensure business understanding, and drive adoption of the solution
Driving toward global processes standardization and consistency to leading practices and provide advice when deviations from the standard global process are required
Working with project managers to identify and track risks and to define mitigation and contingency plans
Supporting the development of technical solutions to support and automate processes
Supporting the implementation of the E2E process through, analysis of change impact, building business readiness, tracking readiness though implementation and working with the appropriate delivery organization to ensure implementations are anchored
Providing specific input to the development and review of testing and training materials and delivery
Partnering with change management to ensure process and change messages are consistent and clear.

Desired Skills & Experience

Experienced business analyst with at least 3-7 years’ experience. Knowledge of accounting and finance best practices and experience participating in, or leading, transformation projects to help companies optimize all elements of their accounting and finance organization.
Background in the P&C insurance and or reinsurance industry
Experience with SAP a plus
Assisting project management teams with identification of action items, tasks and activities and tracking progress
Engaging confidently with senior level managers/executives and build strong relationships with key stakeholders
Operating across multiple geographies and cultures
Influencing teams to develop a global standard
Strong communication and facilitation skills with an ability to effectively manage cross-functional team discussions.
Organized, highly motivated and driven self-starter with ability to work independently and collaborate effectively as part of a high performing team
Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office Suite
Strong management skills with an ability to achieve results in a matrix management environment

Salary Range: $60,000 - $110,000 Actual compensation for this role will depend on several factors including the cost of living associated with your work location, your qualifications, skills, competencies, and relevant experience.

Manager, Product Management, Matchbox

Capital One’s Real Time Decisioning As A Service (DaaS) organization is seeking candidates who are hungry to be at the forefront of innovation to help refine how Capital One customizes experiences to serve hundreds of millions of customers.


We are seeking Product Managers to work on MatchBox, a Capital One developed platform that drives consistent branding and servicing experiences across every customer touch-point. With MatchBox, we determine the who, what, when, where, and how for servicing a customer’s account based on business driven decisions, customer driven preferences, and insights from customer behavior. We are seeking candidates who are passionate about working with new and emerging technologies and understand how to scale those platforms for enterprise usage.


In this role, you will work with internal business customers, marketers, designers, architects, engineers, analysts, process, and operations leaders to define the MatchBox product strategy and develop next-gen capabilities such as business self-service UI, advanced insight engine, and a variety of new platform enhancements and features. We are seeking Product Managers who are motivated to apply their skills to develop elegant, modernized solutions that create great experiences for internal users and Capital One customers.

General areas of responsibilities:

Set product vision and lead road mapping, goal setting, prioritizing, capability delivery, and product roll-out strategy.

Continually drive to understand customer needs and ensure they are considered in prioritization and trade-off discussions.

Develop and lead customer research, prototyping, and test and learn agendas with a focus on building MVP experiences to learn about hypotheses.

Partner with world class software engineers to design, deliver, and sustain functionalities and find opportunities to deliver real-time, personalized, and contextual experiences for our customers.

Lead grooming activities within an Agile team, specifically defining and writing user stories, acceptance criteria and customer experience.

Build and maintain strong relationships and feedback loops with leaders and stakeholders who manage the downstream operations and processes that depend on the capabilities and performance of our platforms.

Help with overall thought leadership around platform development at the intersection of data+design+tech for the sake of creating meaningful, measurable business and customer value.


The ideal candidate is someone who friends and colleagues describe as:

Equally comfortable setting future-oriented strategy and vision as they are designing and delivering capabilities today.

On the whole, operates in a rapidly changing environment with a sense of urgency.

A person who leads with humility and invests in the success of peers and managers.

A natural leader who sparks conversations, invites stakeholders into his/her design process, creates advocacy/alignment, and looks for opportunities to achieve win-win outcomes.

One with a high level of intellectual curiosity and comfort with ambiguity.

A fantastic storyteller who is at ease presenting to senior executives.


Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree or military experience

At least 3 years of product management experience or at least 3 years of experience in product design, agile delivery, business analysis, data science, or software engineering

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering

MBA or Master’s degree

2+ years of experience in Agile product management

Gather business requirements and systems, as well as analyze business requirements. Design business systems. Create test cases, and tests for effective integration of new and existing applications. The Product Manager / Business Analyst will lead ideation, research, design, development and launch of user-centric VR/AR solutions. This role will drive the requirements gathering, specification and documentation processes, as well as be the steward of the product roadmap management process. The role will support the work related to writing personas, user stories, storyboards, user requirements, functional requirements and test cases. The role will also help with task analysis, task elicitation, observations, documentation review and use cases documentation.

We are looking for a talented and self-driven individual to add to our team. You will work intimately with an interdisciplinary team of professionals and play a key role in carrying out product development from conception to execution.

Strategy Responsibilities

Contribute to product strategy and vision, roadmaps, prioritization, and drive product development from conceptualization, design, development, to launch.
Think strategically for long-term impact while understanding and taking into account business and technical constraints.
Conduct ongoing competitive analysis of other apps and products to continually identify ways to improve our user experience.
Carry out research to identify needs that new or improved products can fulfill
Works with stakeholders to determine and document user requirements.

Project Management Responsibilities

Develop schedules of the development program and monitor progress against goals.
Set up reviews at each stage to ensure the program is meeting its objectives
Triage questions or issues that are reported by customers or internal team members.
Develop comprehensive end-to-end test cases.
Performs functional reviews and/or acceptance testing.

Communication Responsibilities

Create direct channels of communication to software and application developers that get the job done without managerial involvement.
Ensure that individual members keep the rest of the team informed on progress

Qualifications

We are looking for someone who possess these traits:

A storyteller that can present a compelling narrative.
Can communicate effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Comfort in ambiguity, but you strive to create clarity for others.
Be a people person; adept at reading people and empathizing with our users.
Appetite for working at a startup.
Desire from taking a product from concept to launch.
Be nimble and flexible; happy to work with a range of timelines and pivot when things don’t go as planned.
Superior analytical and quantitative skills; experience using data and metrics to test theories, confirm assumptions, and measure success
Practical experience leading a VR/AR project or product is mandatory

Education and Experience

Bachelor’s or master’s degree in related field.
5+ years of associated work experience.
Practical application ability with Microsoft Office and Visio.
Working knowledge of Unified Modeling Language (UML).
Experience with Agile methodologies.
Strong experience in user testing.
Practical experience with VR or AR is mandatory

US work authorization is required. No sponsorship will be provided.

Job Title: Senior Business Analyst, Salesforce, Chief Operating Officer/Strategic Operations and Performance Management
Job Description:
Senior Business Analyst, Salesforce, Chief Operating Officer/Strategic Operations and Performance Management
Apply
Senior Business Analyst, Salesforce, Chief Operating Officer/Strategic Operations and Performance Management
Agency: DEPT OF HEALTH/MENTAL HYGIENE
Posted on: 09/28/2023
Job type: Full-time

Location

QUEENS

Title Classification: No exam required

Department

COO-PGRM.ANALY.STRAT.DATA.USE

Salary range: $92,301.00 – $106,146.00
Job Description
Established in 1805, the New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene (the NYC Health Department) is the oldest and largest health department in the country. Our mission is to protect and improve the health of all New Yorkers, in service of a vision of a city in which all New Yorkers can realize their full health potential, regardless of who they are, how old they are, where they are from, or where they live.

As a world-renowned public health agency with a history of building transformative public health programming and infrastructure, innovating in science and scholarship to advance public health knowledge, and responding to urgent public health crises from New York City’s yellow fever outbreak in 1822, to the COVID-19 pandemic we are a hub for public health innovation, expertise, and programs, and services. We serve as the population health strategist, and policy, and planning authority for the City of New York, while also having a vast impact on national and international public policy, including programs and services focused on food and nutrition, anti-tobacco support, chronic disease prevention, HIV/AIDS treatment, family and child health, environmental health, mental health, and racial and social justice work, among others.

Our Agency’s five strategic priorities, building off a recently-completed strategic planning process emerging from the COVID-19 emergency, are:
1) To re-envision how the Health Department prepares for and responds to health emergencies, with a focus on building a “response-ready” organization, with faster decision-making, transparent public communications, and stronger surveillance and bridges to healthcare systems 2) Address and prevent chronic and diet-related disease, including addressing rising rates of childhood obesity and the impact of diabetes, and transforming our food systems to improve nutrition and enhance access to healthy foods
3) Address the second pandemic of mental illness including: reducing overdose deaths, strengthening our youth mental health systems, and supporting people with serious mental illness
4) Reduce black maternal mortality and make New York a model city for women’s health
5) Mobilize against and combat the health impacts of climate change

Our 7,000-plus team members bring extraordinary diversity to the work of public health. True to our value of equity as a foundational element of all of our work, and a critical foundation to achieving population health impact in New York City, the NYC Health Department has been a leader in recognizing and dismantling racism’s impacts on the health of New Yorkers and beyond. In 2021, the NYC Board of Health declared racism as a public health crisis. With commitment to advance anti-racist public health practices that dismantle systems that perpetuate inequitable power, opportunity and access, the NYC Health Department continues to work in and with communities and community organizations to increase their access to health services and decrease avoidable health outcomes.

DIVISION/PROGRAM DESCRIPTION:

This position is eligible to for telework for up to 2 days per week.

This position would be within the Office of Strategic Operations and Performance Management (SOPM) in the Office of the Chief Operating Officer (COO). This office supports the overarching strategies of DOHMH, to foster organizational alignment with those strategies, and to supplement divisional capacity as needed. This office also coordinates strategic public health data projects related to agency operations and analyses for priority Agency initiatives. The Strategic Data Initiatives (SDI) Unit made up of 7 staff [1 Senior Director, 1 Director, 2 Data Scientists, 1 Salesforce Developer & 2 Senior Salesforce Business Analysts] is focused on leveraging technology and data products to meet the Agency’s goals more efficiently.

Position Summary: Under direction of the Director of Informatics, the Senior Business Analyst (Salesforce) role will coordinate with agency stakeholders to better understand public health programs and map those processes to the current Salesforce environment. Additionally, this role will serve as liaison between internal programmatic staff to build out new use cases and provide technical assistance as needed. These systems often involved rapid development, deployment, and support for new high priority initiatives. This person will need to collaborate with developers, analysts, and users to maintain the system as well as research potential new uses to inform the creation additional modules as needed. Additionally, this role will assist with the evaluation in the utilization, impact and gaps in the use of the public health initiative – Partners Connect. This will involve collecting data from internal and external stakeholders and develop a plan to improve the Agency’s public health systems. This will be shared both via presentations and in written/published products.

The Senior Business Analyst (Salesforce) will support the COO’s cloud-based software, Salesforce, which is used for over 100 different public health initiatives including several agency priority initiatives. This includes:


Partners Connect: the agency’s partner management system for identifying, managing, and visualizing relationships and partner activity. This system is designed to facilitate bi-directional communication between the Health Department and its external community partners to promote the agency’s public health messaging. As such, the system supports a variety of key Public Health efforts including distributing major public health information announcements (e.g the City Health Information (CHI) bulletin and Health Alert Network (HAN)). Partners Connect also to facilitates condom distribution across the city. It’s instrumental in supporting the agency’s community engagement efforts in programs like, health education and PPE distribution, immunization programs including COVID-19 and Mpox, the enrollment of partners for the distribution of Health Bucks, violence interruption efforts and the collection and management of services information (e.g. vaccinations, naloxone in pharmacies, HIV/STI testing, etc.). This information is showcased on the NYC Health Map and Vaccine Finder for New Yorkers to easily locate where they access much needed services. This is also used to support other Agency and City priorities like HealthNYC and the Incident Command System (ICS).


Initiative Manager & Performance Management Application: systems used to facilitate performance management and measurement providing real-time and ad-hoc reporting for the agency priority initiatives. These tools are essential for the agency’s leadership to have actionable data to enhance decision making.


Specific Duties will include but not limited to:

Work closely and collaborate with other areas across the Agency to help support the implementation of the cloud-based software Salesforce to manage reports and analytics dashboards that capture data on external community outreach engagement and performance management systems in support of the promotion of multifaceted public health initiatives. Creates and maintains effective lines of communication and cooperation and joint efforts with these entities.
Plan and execute activities to develop effective coordination between the research efforts of the agency and other research projects by working with public health experts, documenting workflows and translating those workflows in training materials and/or system documentation.
Conduct a systems analysis for new programs and map the results of those analysis to the existing infrastructure.
Communicate with complex public health workflows and requirements into a project plan.
Communicate complex technical and data information to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Work with program stakeholders to develop specific and measurable programmatic data indicators for their new use-cases.
Conduct research to identify and recommend improvements to streamline processes and enhance system functionality.
Lead project evaluation(s) activities to assess effectiveness and efficiency of processes and systems.
Support the development and publishing of scientific articles and/or presentations.
Provide technical assistance to public health programs using the system including developing reports, dashboards, and appropriately identify requirements for new technology builds.
Quickly learn the current Salesforce environment and work with new public health units to adapt Salesforce usage in their current workflows.
Lead discussions and meetings with stakeholders providing guidance, sharing best practices, and influencing process decision-making when necessary.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate Salesforce with other program processes and/or systems, ensuring seamless data flow and process automation.
Contribute to the processing, cleaning, and preparing of data for analysis and reporting.
Develop data management procedures and protocols (e.g., data dictionaries, business rules) for monitoring data quality, identify issues, and work with program staff to resolve.
As needed, create and present on reports for internal and external audiences.
Configure Salesforce in the sandbox including but not limited to flows, objects, fields, layouts and community sites.
Serve as one of the Salesforce administrators.

Job Title: Sr. Category Program Manager, Amazon Fresh Selection & Merchandising
Job Description:
5+ years of with Excel experience
Bachelor's degree, or 5+ years of professional or military experience
Knowledge of Microsoft Access or SQL
Experience with business analysis and P&L management
This role can be in Love with food? Interested in shaping the grocery offering of Amazon Fresh? At Amazon Fresh Grocery, we are pioneering the next generation of customer services, offering ultra-fast delivery and in-store on fresh grocery, pantry staples, and household essentials.

The Amazon Fresh Grocery (AFG) team is looking for an experienced and detail-oriented Senior Category Program Manager to manage the in-store reset execution. The Senior Program Manager will ensure that Amazon Fresh Grocery becomes a reliable go-to grocer, and Amazon Fresh will optimize store selection to deliver an optimal customer experience. The role offers the opportunity to build and execute on selection strategy by working cross functionally within Retail functions (Vendor Management, Instock, Catalog, Merchandising, Sourcing, and Marketing). This is an excellent opportunity for someone who wants to use their critical thinking, problem solving and dive deep skills to help create the best customer experience in our stores! The person in this role will be interacting with cross-functional leaders on a regular basis and should understand the importance of presenting thoughtful and high quality work that drives business decisions.

This role will be responsible for –

Manage overall reset execution with macro-space, selection, and merchandising.
Ensure that selection quality, selection quantity, and channel synergies drive Amazon Fresh Grocery's goals.
Optimize category mix across the store.
Draft and present data driven program status docs to Senior Leaders.
Execute a comprehensive plan with multiple workback schedules to ensure a streamlined reset.
Key job responsibilities
Collaborate with Vendor Managers, Istock Managers and merchandising teams to develop clear and concise execution plan for Amazon Fresh Stores

A day in the life
The Senior Category Program Manager will work with the Merchandising and the broader Reset team to ensure timely execution of the Amazon Fresh Stores grocery resets. They will create workback calendars, ensure goals are correct, and report on the project status updates for each of the resets.

About the team
The Amazon Fresh Grocery Central Selection and Merchandising team was formed to create a centralized assortment management process for Amazon Fresh Grocery (stores and online). With a mission of, assorting and merchandising the grocery products that customers want and need instore & online.

Arlington, VA, USA | New York, NY, USA | Seattle, WA, USA

Experience driving direction and alignment with cross-functional teams

Job Title: Sr / Mgr Business Analyst– CRM & Marketing
Job Description:
Description:

Sr / Mgr Business Analyst– CRM & Marketing

Our Brand

MCM (Modern Creation München) is a luxury lifestyle goods and fashion house founded in 1976 with an attitude defined by the cultural Zeitgeist and its German heritage with a focus on functional innovation, including the use of cutting-edge techniques. Today, through its association with music, art, travel, and technology, MCM embodies the bold, rebellious, and aspirational. Always with an eye on the disruptive, the driving force behind MCM centers on revolutionizing classic design with futuristic materials. Appealing to the 21st Century Global Nomad generation - MCM’s millennial and Gen Z audience is genderless, ageless, empowered, and unconstrained by rules and boundaries.

MCM is currently distributed online and in 650 stores worldwide including Munich, Berlin, Zurich, London, Paris, New York, Hong Kong, Shanghai, Beijing, Seoul, Tokyo, Middle East and more. For further information about MCM: www.mcmworldwide.com.

Working with us:

With a highly collaborative workforce working from offices and stores around the world, MCM established a multinational/multicultural organization. To uphold the culture & value of MCM, we intend to fulfil our corporate social responsibility by implementing the following values and to comply with high degree of legitimacy and ethical standards.

Our employees make the best efforts to become high-performing individuals who reflect the diversity of the communities in which we work and live. MCM’s commitment to diversity and inclusion includes recruiting and retaining employees from diverse backgrounds and experiences, creating awareness of diversity issues and benefits, and fostering a supportive environment where inclusivity is expected and prioritized. We have zero tolerance in any form of harassment, insultation, ostracization or groundless defamation of any other person.

Position Overview:

This position will be part of Global Front Office IT organization to manage and deliver CRM/ Marketing solution such as CRM, CDP, Marketing Automation at global level, with primary focus in North America (NCSA) and Europe (EMEA). Our ideal candidate will coordinate with the company CRM & Marketing team in to deliver necessary IT solutions to facilitate Customer Management and Marketing in different sales channels including offline stores and eCommerce processes, bring best business values via IT solution, provide best customer experience in multiple ways. They will also coordinate with cross function to operate retail IT solutions smoothly, stably.

This personManager will support Retail Front Office Senior manager to deliver long/mid-term roadmap based upon priority and manage implementation process. He/she will be the front line working with business stakeholders and others IT teams in the Region for solution delivery as well as daily operation for multiple CRM applications.

A retail industry experience in multicultural-international landscape is essential.

Key Responsibilities:

Part of solution owner team to deliver the overall CRM & Marketing application landscape, with clear understanding of the main processes such as CRM, CDP, Marketing Automation
Work closely with business stakeholders; global digital & marketing team, regional CRM team to understand business process/ operation procedure, collect business requirements, review / maintain application enhancement/optimization based on priority.
Interact closely with other global IT functional team – Retail, eCommerce, SAP ERP, BI team to properly address business needs and enhance overall solution landscape.
Manage L2/L3 support in the Region (as part of Global support structure) for CRM/Marketing applications, work as Administrator to handle operational tasks if necessary.
Coordinate / communicate properly with Regional IT team to execute operational processes, to enable Regional IT teams in NCSA/EMEA to be properly trained to support business process / application in the country.
Produce & Maintenance documentation of CRM IT Applications to facilitate standardization & harmonization of IT processes at global level.
Follow application governance and change management process to deliver change request/ improvement on configuration & integration flows.
Lead and deliver enhancements/ projects with both internal and vendor resources, including delivery of business process documentation, requirement specification, system design documents, testing (system integration test and UAT) and user training manual.
Regularly review application adoption and propose initiatives to increase business adoption.
Understand the company strategies, research market best practice to continuously propose new ideas to support business needs.
Requirements:

Experience & Key Competencies:

Hands on experience in CRM & Customer Lifecycle application –CRM, CDP, Marketing Automation, SFMC and broad exposure to other domain such as POS, eCommerce, BI, etc. Knowledge & Experience on eCommerce Web Tracking and Email Marketing is a plus.
A demonstrated knowledge of IT solution delivery process including requirement collection, feasibility study, system design, testing, deployment, and end-user support.
Understanding of the technical environment needed to support a CRM and customer data management environment (communication, security, privacy)
Strong interpersonal communication skills including active listening, clear presentation (writing and speaking), as well as coordination, persuasion, negotiation, and social perceptiveness.
Strong analytical skills (operational, technological and systems) for complex problem-solving, solution definition and root cause analysis & presentationMinimum 5 years’ experience within a Retail Environment (Luxury Retail is a “nice to have”)
Minimum 8 years’ business analyst experience in CRM/ Marketing domains
Knowledge in US and Europe market practices
Ability to work multi-task and committed to timeline.
Team and customer-oriented mindset
Ability to work independently and under minimum supervision.
Working experience within a multi-national multi-brand environment is a plus.
Experience managing vendor resource is an advantage.
Open and flexible to work with distributed team located in different physical locations in Asia, Europe, and US
Flexible to manage dynamic work environment with ad hoc tasks.
Fluent (Reading, writing, and speaking) in English.
Manager or (Senior) Business Analyst title will be offered based on candidate’s profile and relevant experience.

This job description is not all-inclusive, and MCM Products USA Inc. reserves the right to amend this job description at any time. MCM Products USA Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.

Salary range reflects the good-faith hiring base salary range for this position. However, individual salaries are determined by a variety of factors including, but not limited to: business considerations, local market conditions, internal equity, as well as candidate qualifications such as relevant skills, experience, and education/training.

The Senior Salesforce Business Analyst ensures that the Operations Division’s systems/processes conform to best practices and maximize the use of all Salesforce related functions/applications to promote efficiency and standardization in the Division’s operations as well as throughout the country.

Duties and Responsibilities include but are not limited to

Liaise with the organization’s divisions/departments to assess the operational impact, including risk assessment, of any planned new programing and integration with the Salesforce platform.
Document process workflows in current state. Identify areas for organizational efficiency.
Translate common language business terminology into technical terminology.
Assist with project management related to Sprint planning, backlog grooming, and Sprint reviews. Communicate progress on a weekly basis to key leadership. Provide quarterly updates to the Governance Committee to help prioritize efforts.
Maintain system architecture diagrams.
With Admin, maintain Data Dictionaries.
Communicate changes to Salesforce proactively prior to implementation in alignment with Hadassah’s data warehouse.
Review operational systems/processes supporting Philanthropy’s fundraising efforts and recommend enhancements to capitalize on Salesforce functionality and automation opportunities. These include Major Gifts, Annual Gifts, Tax Receipting, Grassroots, Yahrzeits, Tributes (IHO/IMO), and Certificates, for example.
Manage the repository of requested Salesforce related business improvements.
Manage the repository of requested complex reports and coordinate their implementation schedule to balance priority and complexity. Assist Salesforce report team as an additional resource on request.
Monitor and manage Salesforce Adoption Dashboard(s) data to understand how/how much the Hadassah community is utilizing the tool. Prepare recommendations based on that info for the Application Integration Leadership to ensure that Salesforce is consistently supporting our strategic objectives.
Review all Salesforce (and Salesforce related tools) product enhancement notices; highlight information that needs to be communicated to users and/or features to consider for adoption, and work with the Salesforce systems administrators re: the communication and integration.
Liaise with Managed Services partner to ensure product upgrades are scheduled, implemented, and communicated in a timely manner.
Build, maintain, and distribute a quarterly newsletter of Salesforce “Tips and Techniques” for staff and volunteers.
Support “Office Hours” Zoom program (one hour twice a week) for staff and volunteers to get real-time help regarding using and capitalizing on Salesforce features.
Enhance the initial Salesforce training program to further support change management and encourage Salesforce usage across the organization for both staff and volunteers domestically and in Israel.
Manage Internal Ticketing system prioritizing tickets that are bugs, report needs, feature requests, or larger build projects.

Required Knowledge, Education, and Experience

5-7 years experience with CRMs e.g., Salesforce, ClearView
3-5 Years Project management experience
Bachelor’s degree and three to five years’ experience in systems analysis, business analysis, operations, and/or not-for-profit fundraising
Change management and documentation, especially Salesforce
Ability to manage several projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent interpersonal, verbal/presentation, and written communication skills
Strong problem solving/analytical skills; excellent attention to detail.
Computer proficiency and expertise in Office 365 and related technology skills, including familiarity with using digital platforms such as Zoom, WebEx, Microsoft Teams


We provide a comprehensive benefits package which includes:

Benefits
For eligible employees, we provide excellent medical, dental, and vision insurance; short and long term disability, and life insurance
Retirement Plans
Hadassah provides a defined contribution retirement plan and tax deferred annuity for eligible employees, including a generous match.
Paid Time Off
We provide a generous number of vacation and sick days; early close on Friday; Jewish and secular holidays.
Hybrid Work
We work two days in office and three days remotely (may vary by location)

Job Title: Sales Operations Analyst, GFS - Field Sales Ops
Job Description:
5+ years of experience in the areas of sales operations, sales planning, finance, and/or business management, in mid-to-large scale global sales organization.
5+ years of Excel experience (or other analytical applications) conducting creative analysis of complex data and translating the results into actionable deliverables/business reviews.
BS/BA degree or equivalent experience.
The Global Financial Services Operations Analyst will serve as a trusted advisor to business leaders. The right candidate will seek to improve sales productivity through complete, reliable and relevant data analyses. Sales Operations specializes in finding solutions, working cross-functionally with different stakeholders across the AWS organization.

Key job responsibilities
This position will be responsible for supporting the Global Financial Services organization through regular operational cadences, reporting, and supporting strategic initiatives. You will take ownership of Salesforce opportunity management, provide reporting and analysis for the monthly revenue publish and forecast cadences, and analyze data to identify trends and opportunities.

A day in the life

Deep dive analysis of individual charge items in our accounts' revenue forecast
Management of Salesforce pipeline, tracking revenue-generating opportunities for Financial Service accounts
Draw business insights from dashboard reporting and communicate trends to account teams
Partner with the Finance team to ensure forecast accuracy
Communicate with sales teams to understand account performance
Provide analysis of AWS services by account
About the team
The GFS Sales Operations team works with all Financial Service leadership, serving as trusted advisors. We work with great pace and are committed to producing fully accurate analyses. We are dynamic and very collaborative, often meeting as a team to find the best path forward when problem solving.

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

New York, NY, USA


2+ years in a B2B sales environment to include sales organizational structures, sales systems, and industry data used in developing go-to-market strategies.
Experience with Salesforce.
Experience with SQL, as well as using and building dashboards with BI/Data visualization tools (Tableau, Quicksight).
Exhibits sound business judgment, strong analytical skills, and a proven track record of taking ownership and delivering programs to support and grow a business.
Self-motivated, action-oriented, multi-tasking individual with a sense of urgency and follow-through.
Experience interacting with sales leadership and establishing credibility as a strategic partner.
Experience working within a high-growth, fast-paced technology company would be beneficial.
Familiarity with Financial Services industry a plus.

JOB TITLE: Senior Operations Analyst - Accounts Receivable

SALARY RANGE: $49,562 - $82,603

DEPT/DIV: Finance

SUPERVISOR: Manager, Finance

LOCATION: 333 West 34th Street

HOURS OF WORK: 9:00 am - 5:30 pm (8 hours/day)

DEADLINE: Open until filled


**This position is represented by the Transportation Communications Union (TCU).**


SUMMARY:

The purpose of this position is to administer activities and process transactions for the Accounts Receivable area.


RESPONSIBILITIES:

Handle all phases of work order and miscellaneous invoice bill generation, preliminary bill creation and supporting documentation identification.
Process and execute invoice adjustments.
Support project activities including requirements gathering, functional design & configuration, testing, training design, development & delivery, and upgrades.
Gather, validate and maintain data and other transaction inputs.
Gather forms and track status.
Enter transactions in PeopleSoft and service request management tool.
Retrieve, index and review emailed documents and forms.
Provide satisfactory customer service by receiving, analyzing, researching and seeking resolution to assigned inquiries.
Integrate across teams to document, research and resolve intermediate issues and errors as assigned. Understand when to resolve or escalate to supervisor.
Perform / support cyclical processing and period end activities.
Complete assignments as delegated by Supervisor.
Comply with MTA and BSC policies, practices and procedures.
Develop and update operating procedures and training materials as needed.
Support project activities including requirements gathering, functional design & configuration, testing, training design, development & delivery, postproduction support.
Understand the MTA and BSC vision including how individual responsibilities fit into the long-term strategies.
Manage individual assignments and expectations. Assist with prioritizing team assignments.
Maintain appropriate level of process, functional and technical knowledge and participate in training to continue to develop such knowledge.
Mentor, coach and support other team members as appropriate.
Ensure that all assignments are completed with the highest quality and within agreed-to Service Level Agreement guidelines and Key Performance Indicator targets.
Adhere to team budget.
Identify and implement continuous improvement initiatives as assigned.


KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES

Required

Possess knowledge of General Accounting principles
Ability to process requests consistently with general supervision.
Ability to assess problems and promptly resolve or identify appropriate team to resolve.
Strong oral and written communication skills
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work with and collaborate across the BSC at all levels within and outside the organization.
Strong time management skills and ability to manage individual assignments.
Ability to work in a team environment.
Strong attention to detail
Ability to handle sensitive situations and maintain a high degree of confidentiality.


Preferred

Understanding of MTA Finance policies, practices and procedures
Working knowledge and use of PeopleSoft or related database software
Familiarity with performance metrics and ability to meet identified targets
Working knowledge and use of office productivity tools (e.g., PeopleSoft, MS Office applications) and web-based applications


EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

Required

High School Diploma or GED
Minimum four (4) years of experience in Accounts Receivable


Preferred

Bachelor's degree in accounting
Shared Services experience


OTHER INFORMATION:

Pursuant to the New York State Public Officers Law & the MTA Code of Ethics, all employees who hold a policymaking position must file an Annual Statement of Financial Disclosure (FDS) with the NYS Commission on Ethics and Lobbying in Government (the "Commission").

The MTA encourages qualified applicants from diverse backgrounds, experiences, and abilities, including military service members, to apply.

Job Title: Treasury and Trade Solutions Data Governance Officer-VP (Hybrid)
Job Description:
This Treasury and Trade Solutions Data Governance Officer role is specific to Treasury & Trade Solutions (TTS), Enterprise Services, and is responsible for governing the implementation of Data Governance policies, standards, and procedures for the business globally.

As client, business, and regulatory requirements continue to increase demand for high quality data (complete, accurate, timely, and consistent) Data Governance has become increasingly important for successful execution of the TTS business lines. TTS is looking for a highly motivated, self-starting program manager/analyst who is ready to take on the challenges of working in a fast-paced global environment and contributing to TTS’ continuing business success through effective data governance.

The individual will analyze, solution and govern the Risk & Controls program for Data Quality Management under the regulatory-driven and Enterprise Chief Data Governance Office-sponsored data policy programs. In addition to program management, the role will require that the individual become a subject matter expert in Data Governance and Citi’s own set of Data Policies, Standards and Procedures. There is also an expectation that, through day-to-day execution of the role, deep knowledge of TTS’ business process, products, technology, and data elements will be gained.

Responsibilities:

Provide oversight of detailed program/initiative execution plans related to ICG-level data initiatives impacting TTS business, client, and regulatory reporting

Proactively uncover and escalate risks, issues, and dependencies that may impact program/initiative delivery

Facilitate and coordinate effective communication between and across key stakeholders to enable efficient execution of program goals. Specifically:

Deliver regular status reporting to management and key stakeholders.

Evaluate and communicate possible risks and issues to the completion of program milestones.

Organize and lead assigned program-related meetings, including the creation of agendas and preparation of materials.

Take ownership by escalating issues and managing them to conclusion.

Partner with the Federated and Enterprise Chief Data Office by providing constructive and actionable feedback on Citi-wide processes, and for implementation of policies and procedures contained in the Citi Data Governance Policy (CDGP).

Partner with TTS Lines of Business, Operations, and Technology to learn more about data elements and business processes, ensuring adherence to CDGP principles, standards and procedures, and to consistently track the progress of the Data governance programs and work slate that TTS DGO is responsible for.

Identify opportunities for improvement and communicate accordingly with management and program/initiative owners

Apply program management best practices and apply appropriate governance structure across all work streams.

Qualifications:

Experience in Data Governance and Data Management, having 7+ years’ total experience working with large global or regional data

Experience defining, implementing, and governing the adoption and implementation of Data Standards across Treasury & Transaction products and services (i.e., payments, deposits, loans)

Working knowledge of Data Types, Identifiers (ISO, NAICS), Vocabularies, Schemas (XML, JSON), Formats, and Accessibility (APIs)

Working knowledge of external Data standards (ISO), glossaries, dictionaries, catalogs, taxonomies/ontologies

Strong Project Management/Business Analyst skills

Experience producing high quality material and presenting it to senior audiences

Cash Management product knowledge across Deposits, Trade (LCs, loans, commitments), Commercial Cards, and Payments & Receivables is preferred.

Experience working in global functions such as Risk, Finance or Compliance is a plus

Skills:

Confident at presenting to all levels of the organization in both verbal and written form

Ability to deliver under pressure and on time

Ability to learn new material quickly and deliver results in compressed time frames

Proficient in MS Office, including use of Excel, PowerPoint, and Word

Experience in Program/Project Management as a PM or BA

Competencies:

Excellent English-language based technical writing skills

Understands the key dimensions of Data Quality, how those relate to Data Standards, how they are measured

A high degree of accuracy and attention to detail

Clear and confident communicator with an ability to relay information, both orally and in written form, to all levels of the organization

Ability to build and maintain effective firm-wide networks and relationships

Knowledge of and/or experience in Cash Management, Trade, Payments or Commercial Cards business is highly desirable

Education:

Bachelor Degree from a recognized/accredited institution

Job Title

Senior Analyst- Funding Operations

Job Description

Day-to-day focus is on resolution of complex problems or transactions, where expertise is required to interpret against policies, guidelines or processes. Roles at this level would usually have full ownership for one or more processes, reports, procedures or products, and may also be considered analytical or procedural "experts" representing a unit or team on cross-function process or project deliverables.

CAPITAL MARKETS LLC/BROKER DEALER FUNDING RESPONSIBILITIES:

Daily funding of firm bank accounts*
Responsible for timely deposits to/from 15C3-3 accounts.*
Responsible for intraday liquidity monitoring and reporting.
Responsible for timely deposits to various Clearing Organizations*
Planning and coordinating with other groups to meet funding needs*
Syndicate Operations – to determine need for day loans in order to intra-day finance new issues underwritten by RBC.
Treasury Clearance – as a conduit to the Repo Desk to raise or reduce cash as needed.
Foreign Settlements – To forecast key cash needs for all US Dollar securities settling overseas.
Stock Loan Desk – To determine their use of funds to enable accurate forecasting
Repo Desk – As the group responsible for raising or laying off funds, we need to work with the Repo Desk throughout the day.
Affiliated legal entities for their daily settlement versus the Broker Dealer

PROPRIETARY FUNDING RESPONSIBILITIES:

Daily funding across select proprietary entities engaging in below products types/activities:*
Equities, Fixed Income & Derivative (both Listed & OTC)
Stock Loan/Stock Borrow
Repo/Reverse Repo
Overnight and Term Loans
Various miscellaneous payments/receipts as provided internally from Product Control/Financial Control
Book and track overnight and term loans*
Daily bank reconciliations for proprietary trading entities*
Manage related bank accounts to ensure proper funding daily - ~approx. 10-15 bank accounts (USD & Multi-CCY) in our control currently
Projecting future settlements and other funding needs*
Provide the forecasts to appropriate MM Desks throughout Toronto and London to ensure proper coordination.
Daily reconciliation of funding suspense accounts*
Wire processing and approvals through various internal system and banking portals*

ACCOUNTING RESPONSIBILITIES:

Post daily accruals & cash flow activity to multiple GL’s*. Includes accruals on Bank Loans, Stock Loan/Borrow, Repo/Reverse Repo, & Custodian Cash Balances
Process the Cost of Carry function across multiple trading units.*
Monthly reconciliation & Attestation for all Cash, Loan, & Accrual GL accounts*
Assist Product Control with P&L/Carry related issues whenever possible.
Assist Financial Control with monthly reconciliation issues
Prepare month-end reporting for Home Office/Financial Control

Managerial Excellence

May supervise day-to-day work of junior level employees, as Senior Analyst you will provide cover for the Team Manager during absence and act as a point of escalation for business, clients and the team on all matters. May have management responsibilities for a small team, or maybe a single incumbent with "manager" responsibilities for a function.

JOB SPECIFICATIONSAND QUALIFICATIONS

Basic Qualifications

Roles at this level typically require an individual emerging as an expert in a specific skill set, business areas or product but who remain focused primarily on daily execution.

This role would typically require some functional and industry experience and/or expertise, as they are expected to be subject area experts in one (or more) specific skill sets, business areas or products.

Undergraduate Degree in related field of study i.e. Finance, Accounting, Mathematics, Business Management, Economics
Series 99 license or ability to acquire it in the first 6 months of employment.

Other Required Qualifications:

Basic knowledge of the following concepts through prior experience or college coursework is preferred:

PRODUCT KNOWLEDGE

Equity, Fixed Income, and Derivative products & associated settlement cycle

Stock Lending and Borrowing

Repo/Reverse Repo agreements

Initial and Variation Margin management; Futures, Swaps etc.

Foreign currency funding

US Banking and cash flows

TREASURY

Bank loan management, including day loan, overnight loan, secured and unsecured borrowing

Issuing and calculating funding rates and spreads

Allocating interest expense back to the business units

Intra-day liquidity and collateral tracking & reporting

Prior day liquidity and collateral tracking & reporting

FINANCE/ACCOUNTING

General ledger postings

Daily bank reconciliations

General ledger reconciliations

Balance Sheet Analysis

Suggested Qualifications:

Expert Level MS Excel. Intermediate VBA & SQL skills.

Primary focus of role is on day-to-day deliverables, developing solutions based upon subject expertise, and occasionally representing the department or function at a broader level. Daily funding & related accounting for the RBC CM LLC broker-dealer.

Daily interest allocations for RBC affiliated entities for which we fund.
