These capabilities, together with our culture of shared success and commitment to creating 360° value, enable us to help our clients succeed and build trusted, lasting relationships. We measure our success by the 360° value we create for our clients, each other, our shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.

People in Corporate Functions contribute to the running of Accenture as a high- performance business through specialization within a specific functional area, and grow into internally focused roles by deepening their skills and/or developing new skills within an internal functional area.

Role: Security Operations Center (SOC) Senior Analyst (Crisis Coordinator)


This role is onsite in San Antonio, TX. Candidate must be open to relocate to San Antonio.

Job Description:


The Security Operations Center (SOC) Senior Analyst will be responsible for assessing, analyzing, and responding to incidents related to safety and security around the globe. The role requires daily use of tools/systems (e.g. access control, video management, risk feeds) to detect impact to Accenture’s people, products, property, or brand image and alert the appropriate response stakeholders. Specifically, incidents may range from extreme weather conditions, political instability, crime, terror, civil unrest, and other personnel issues. In addition, the Analyst will be responsible for customer service tasks to provide critical information and assistance to travelers, static employees, and potential third parties. This role will be based in San Antonio, Texas and reports to the SOC Shift Supervisor.

Key Responsibilities:

Assist company employees in all concerns that pertain to safety, security, and property

Act as initial point of contact to aid all employees, travelers, and others contacting the SOC

Monitor and operate security systems to include access control and CCTV, along with environmental monitoring and mass notification systems

Respond quickly and initiate action related to alarms, phone calls, and environmental monitoring and alerting systems

Notify, assist, and direct external emergency personnel and internal resources as necessary

Dispatch security officers or law enforcement personnel for alarm response, calls for service and emergency situations

Execute protocols and communicate at all levels across the globe to employees, site security leads, safety & security staff or contracted officers as needed

Manage information flow to and from an incident

Maintain operational logs, conduct daily shift checklists, handover reports, and incident reports

Ensure all forms of communications, such as e-mails, phone conversations, and client interactions, are conducted in a courteous and professional manner, confidentially, and documented appropriately

Coordinate with Accenture’s Corporate Security regional leads on incident detection and management

Ensure that complete and accurate information is entered in the incident management system

Utilize and execute protocols and standard operating procedures to effectively manage global incidents

Monitor travel safety and security of company's staff

Maintain situational awareness of current global current events

Monitor and respond to global alerts and events effecting company facilities and employees providing immediate information and assistance as needed

Initiate mass communication notifications as required

Notify leadership of events effecting business operations and employees

Ensure proper handling of highly confidential information

Perform other duties assigned by supervisors related to security and safety


Location:

The role is located in San Antonio, TX and requires to be in the office.


Hours & Shift Requirements:

Night Shift (11:00pm - 7:00 am CST) - Note - This is a 24/7 operations center and critical to have flexibility to work any shift required as needed to support the business


Training:

Individuals receive paid training


Travel:

No travel is needed for this position




Basic Qualifications:

Associate degree or minimum of 2 years of security work experience in Military, Law Enforcement, Government, Corporate Security, Customer Service, Communications or Academia


Preferred Qualifications:

Experience identifying anomalies in a physical environment and performing first-line investigations

Experience with emergency response protocols & processes

Bachelor’s degree in Business, International Relations, Political Science, Communications, or other Humanities-related degrees

Minimum 1-year experience in a Security Operation or Command Center role

Bilingual (English/Spanish/Portuguese)

Experience with Genetec video solutions or CCure 9000

Proficient in Microsoft Windows and Office Suite

Ability to analyze threats and envision potential or real time impact to operations

Ability to respond quickly and calmly to emergencies and stressful situations exercising proper judgment and decision-making skills

Professional skills:

Great active listening skills

Rapport building skills

Patient and empathetic attitude

Adaptability and flexibility

Strong Customer Service skills

Strong consensus, team building and negotiating skills

Ability to work overtime on short notice

Strong cultural sensitivities

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Ability to multitask in a fast-paced, at times stressed work environment

Strong team player

Comfortable with high-tech work environment, and constant learning of new tools and innovations

Demonstrated leadership in professional setting; either military or civilian

Demonstrated teamwork and collaboration in a professional setting; either military or civilian

#LI-NA

We are seeking a Business Solution Architect, Insurance to join our Information Technology team in New York City, New Jersey, Purchase or Charlotte office.

Main areas of responsibility:

· Maintain the logical and physical integrity of the insurance technology platform foundation by collaborating with the business units, business analysts and development, and establishing documented standards compliant with Guidewire, Duck Creek or other technology platforms in use

· Apply a structure business architecture approach to define the end-to-end solution including the product model, workflow, features, functions and data. Create a complete inventory of Epics/User stories and review with the business and development teams

· Ensure that proposed solutions are focused on improving efficiency and effectiveness of the business processes, and are consistent across products where possible.

· With BA leads, conduct planning for requirements and design approach for each project

· Develop estimates for solution architecture activities

· Review all requirements deliverables for adherence to solution foundation standards, technology standards and product needs

· Conduct pre-user acceptance testing

· Collaborate with development and testing teams to provide subject matter expertise, ensure that out of the box functionality is leveraged and assist in troubleshooting and resolving issues.

· Travel as required, approximately 10%.

Qualifications, Skills and Experience:

· 7+ years of business analysis and business solution architecture experience in the Commercial Property & Casualty insurance industry with 2+ years in Specialty insurance.

· Strong technology experience with policy administration solutions. Experience with Guidewire PolicyCenter strongly preferred and is primary.

· Experience with SAP is a plus.

· Proven experience applying architectural principles to business solutions

· Experienced with Agile SCRUM methodology and business analysis methodologies; working knowledge of business analysis documentation standards.

· Hands-on experience writing user stories is required.

· Knowledge and experience leveraging both IT solutions and business process improvements.

Company Description


About Veolia North America

A subsidiary of Veolia Group, Veolia North America (VNA) offers a full spectrum of water, waste and energy management services, including water and wastewater treatment, commercial and hazardous waste collection and disposal, energy consulting and resource recovery. VNA helps commercial, industrial, healthcare, higher education and municipality customers throughout North America. Headquartered in Boston, Mass., Veolia North America has approximately 10,000 employees working at more than 350 locations across the continent. Please visit our website www.veolianorthamerica.com.



Job Description


BENEFITS

Veolia's comprehensive benefits package includes paid time off policies, as well as health, dental and vision insurance. In addition, employees are also entitled to participate in an employer sponsored 401(k) plan, to save for retirement. Pay and benefits for employees represented by a union are outlined in their collective bargaining agreement.

Position Purpose:

Reporting to the CFO of Veolia Utility Holdings Inc. this role will provide leadership, strategy, and day-to-day management for the finance function, including overall responsibility for financial planning and analysis, financial modeling, management reporting, forecasting and budgeting. This position will be responsible for the consolidated reporting and financial analysis of four business units and ensure that operational decisions result in optimal financial outcomes, address Veolia NA’s core values and consider the proper rate perspective. Revenue $715 MIL EBITDA $350 MIL Net Utility Plant $3.4 BIL.

Primary Duties/Responsibilities:

Leads VUHI Financial Planning & Analysis function, developing the long and short-term financial objectives, plan and metrics ensuring consistency and alignment with overall strategic goals and objectives.
Oversees monthly and quarterly reporting of financial and operational information, including trends, key performance metrics, variances to budget and prior period and forecasts. This reporting will also drive actions and optimize the decision-making process at each business unit.
Leads the annual budget and medium-term plan process, as well as interim forecast updates for VUHI, including developing & maintaining a financial model that supports 20-year projections for P&L, BS and cash flows.
Strategic and financial assessment for Consideration and Commitment Committees of M&A and other investment opportunities. Ensures effective integration of acquisitions.
Plans long-term debt issuances, dividends and partners with treasury to optimize the financing strategy and support the company’s credit rating.
Works in close collaboration with CFO, VP of rates, VUHI Corporate Controller/Chief Accounting Officer, BU Finance Directors, VP of capital planning and operations to orchestrate the regulatory and rate case strategy and execution to optimize financial benefits.
Assist in the development and delivery of rate case filings where required, both from an operational and financial standpoint.
Leads the development of presentations and business review materials that highlight performance, bring clarity to key issues, and support strategic recommendations.
Acts as a thought-partner to the CFO, Finance Leadership Team, and Executive Leadership, providing valuable strategic and financial analysis and insights for VUHI.
Works collaboratively with finance leadership as well as with the business unit General Managers, Finance Directors and operating personnel to help drive operational improvement initiatives, maximize financial results and optimize regulatory treatment through improved operational performance monitoring.


Qualifications


Education/Experience/Background:

Bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting or related disciplines required.
MBA or Senior Management Courses in Business Administration highly desirable.
A minimum of 10 years of financial & business analysis work experience, preferably in utilities, with a track record of progressive responsibility.

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

Strong experience developed in financial modeling & analysis, and financial planning & reporting.
Outstanding financial and analytical abilities. Effectively analyzes complex problems and creates innovative solutions.
Excellent planning and organizational skills demonstrated in project management and execution, with a strong ability to manage, simultaneously, multiple project deadlines and priorities.
Highly self-motivated individual who will provide leadership and guidance to staff.
Strong financial acumen and high attention to detail.
Ability to understand, analyze and influence financial outcomes due to operational decisions or performance metrics and drive improvement.
Rational & methodological thinking approaches for ‘challenging’ analysis and reviewing target/business unit performance.
Strong written/verbal communication skills and understanding of executive conciseness.
Effective interpersonal skills to relate well to all levels of management. Ability to communicate, collaborate, influence and build long-term effective working relationships with varying levels of leadership across the organization.
Strong work ethic.
Unquestionable ethics and integrity.
Understanding of the U.S. regulatory framework is a plus.

Physical Requirements:

Travel within Utility operations as needed.

Additional Information


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer! All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

Job Title: Senior SAP Indirect Tax and Vertex Implementer
Job Description:
POSITION SUMMARY:

As part of the Global Product Design & Development Team the successful candidate will be responsible for analyzing, designing, developing, and delivering solutions in the Indirect Tax area of the template in a Professional Services environment. The role supports processes across the Operational and Financial areas of the template as well as supporting the Vertex O series system integration and reporting.

The position requires an Indirect Tax resource with extensive experience implementing US/Canada tax solutions in SAP using the Vertex system as a bolt-on. Must have hands on experience with Vertex including Vertex integration with SAP, Vertex Accelerator, tax rates/tax reporting, SAP Tax procedure configuration and SAP pricing configuration. Candidate should have strong business analyst skills with experience on Sales & Purchasing processes along with good knowledge of US and Canada indirect tax regimes.

This position requires a versatile person that can be both technical and process oriented to be able to work with the technical team as well as explaining system solutions to a non-technical audience.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

The Indirect Tax Functional resource is responsible for managing requirements, leading and implementing solutions, and supporting/owning the indirect tax solution implemented for North America integrating SAP and Vertex.

Along with other team members, this position will engage frequently with business users, managers, project leaders, and functional leads to discuss specific business needs, gather detailed business requirements ensuring a full understanding of what is required to determine solution options as well as support existing solutions.

This role includes responsibility for the following:

Prioritizing and managing scope for applicable localization requirements in consultation with key business stakeholders: liaising with the internal SAP teams, Shared Services Teams and Business partners as well as external financial advisors and our consultancy partners
Responsible for analyzing, solutioning, designing, configuring, enhancing and testing the integrated tax solution for US and Canada in SAP interfaced to Vertex within the P2P and OTC area.
Responsible for Accelerator configuration, FI, SD and MM tax set-up and related master data that meets the US and Canada legal/business/usability requirements while being consistent with the global template
Design, build and support integrations to external tax authorities where needed
Provide Level 4 support - Ability to identify and diagnose problems and resolve/implement solutions
Prepare comprehensive documentation according to the project methodology for all aspects of requirements, development, testing and implementation
Perform comprehensive testing of solutions, including regression testing before any changes are released to QA and Production
Perform walkthroughs and demos – demonstrate excellent communication and presentation skills in order to express identified solutions in terms understood by the business
Be able to adapt and quickly learn new areas to be able to deliver integrated solutions
Ensure assigned deliverables are managed and delivered on a timely basis in accordance with the project plan
Be proactive and have ability to multi-task, work will be required on multiple projects as well as leading some projects
Liaise with other team members to communicate planned releases, change impact, and co-ordinate communication and training needs
Any other duties as directed by the Global Manager

EDUCATION, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:

Essential:

Strong business process knowledge/expertise with an ability to analyze complex business scenarios and translate to optimal solutions
Minimum of 8 years' experience implementing indirect tax solutions in SAP for US and Canada with extensive Vertex experience
Bachelor's degree in information technology or business-related field required or equivalent years of experience in the field
Completion, at minimum, of 3 distinct SAP implementations
At least 3 years' hands-on experience SAP > Vertex O Series (preferably version 9.0) integration experience
Extensive experience implementing SAP solutions for Canada and US indirect tax requirements using Vertex application for tax determination and tax reporting
Direct hands-on configuration/enhancement experience with Vertex Accelerator
Experience with Vertex interface administration
Extensive experience of SAP FI Tax Configuration, and MM/SD Pricing along with related master data
Knowledge of indirect tax impact on SAP invoice verification/FI AP invoice processing and SAP Order related billing is required
Ability to understand complex business/tax requirements within the business processes and communicate effectively with a non-technical audience
Able to execute high quality deliverables with minimal direct supervision
Team player that can collaborate with cross-team resources to build and deploy end-to-end solutions
Strong communication/presentation skills
Experience working with waterfall and agile project methodologies

Desirable:

Bachelor's degree in computer science or Information Technology OR Bachelors degree in Accounting/Finance with strong SAP experience implementing Indirect Tax Solutions
Global indirect tax experience
Knowledge of S/4 Hana highly beneficial
Prior experience of adapting SAP to a professional services environment, Media/Advertising industry a plus
Good knowledge of SD & MM Master Data, Purchasing, LIV and AR/AP processes
Exposure to Fiori based applications



SALARY RANGE:

The salary range for this position is $150,000 and $175,000. Where an employee or prospective employee is paid within this range will depend on, among other factors, actual ranges for current/former employees in the subject position; market considerations; budgetary considerations; tenure and standing with the company (applicable to current employees); as well as the employee's/applicant's background, pertinent experience, and qualifications.

Job Title

Implementation Consultant, Senior

What does a great Implementations ETL Analyst/Programmer at Fiserv do?

Implementations ETL Analyst/Programmer team plays a crucial role in providing analysis, consultation, and recommendations during the deployment of DNA Core Financial Software for our credit union and bank clients. We work closely with clients and internal stakeholders to ensure the delivery and implementation of our suite of products, providing the best-in-class solutions to meet clients' business needs.

What You Will Do:

Provide conversion support to banks and credit unions by building data requirements for extracting and transforming donor source data into a DNA Oracle standard schema.
Interpret binary data and meticulously match the data to the donor file descriptions at the bit level.
Work with the converting organization, the donor's IT staff, and the DNA programming and project teams to drive data-related problems to resolution.
Communicate professionally and provide consultative support to clients throughout the project, demonstrating excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Validate programming results against requirements and donor data.
Analyze and interpret data, leading discussions on technical topics.
Collaborate with source control systems, primarily TFS and Git, and utilize text editor tooling such as Beyond Compare, UltraEdit, Notepad ++, etc.
Utilize programming skills in PL/SQL, SQL, SQL Plus, SQL Loader, C#, COBOL, and knowledge of Oracle databases.
Coordinate multiple tasks with minimal supervision, delivering on time-sensitive project tasks.
Provide coaching and guidance to both associates and clients through technical issues and long-term projects.

What You Will Need To Have:

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, Mathematics, Finance, Business Administration, or equivalent work experience.
3-5 years of related experience.
Proficiency in PL/SQL, SQL, SQL Plus, SQL Loader, and the development of database objects.
Experience working with Oracle databases and/or relational databases in an implementation environment, specifically performing data transformation.
Strong knowledge of Hex Editor Tools.
Working experience with source control systems, primarily TFS and Git.
Proficient in C# and working knowledge of COBOL.
Ability to analyze and interpret data and lead discussions on technical topics.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to coordinate multiple tasks to completion with minimal supervision and deliver on time-sensitive project tasks.
Self-directed, detail-oriented, and able to work under strict deadlines with precision and accuracy.

What Would Be Great To Have:

5+ years of experience in ETL, manipulating data with various editors and using programming languages such as C#, COBOL, SQL, and PL/SQL.
3+ years of experience in system conversions for Oracle-based software.
3+ years of experience in an implementation environment, working in a fast-paced, deadline-oriented consulting climate.
5+ years in business analysis and programming.
Experience working remotely.

Travel Required:

30%
Occasional weekend and holiday work required

Summary:

The Information Security Engineer is a member of the corporate enterprise security team. The team has overall responsibility for enterprise IT security. This role will be focused on keeping systems and devices hardened against attacks as well as monitoring and responding to security events. The Information Security Engineer is responsible for identifying, investigating, and remediating any vulnerabilities in the company security posture that introduces risk to the company or its patients.

The Information Security Engineer assists in development of security strategy, policy and procedures. The Engineer interacts with managers, system owners, data stewards, compliance and risk management staff to assess and understand their security needs. The Engineer provides assistance, recommendations, and security procedures and ensures that the user community understands and adheres to relevant policy and procedures to maintain security.

The position calls for an individual who understands business operations, information technology and security, and can collaborate with IT experts and business executives. The candidate must have demonstrated leadership specific to technical information security issues as well as an understanding of business processes and regulations. High level communication skills are essential to successfully translate technology and security requirements into business terms. It is expected that the incumbent will be a self-starter and will act with minimal supervision.

Responsibilities include design and review of security controls, monitoring of internal/external access controls and security safeguards to protect the confidentiality, integrity and availability of information systems assets.

Essential Functions & Responsibilities:

Participates in the cyber security strategic planning process. Assist in the identification, evaluation, selection and implementation of security technologies.
Provides security design, consultancy, and assessment services; and introduces improvements in technical security standards and security implementation patterns and designs.
Develops security policy, procedures, and related metrics; reviews and contributes to the improvement and standardization of security systems across the entire IT environment.
Participates in projects and assists in the execution of project plans to help ensure compliance with all external regulations and laws, and internal policies, rules, and standards.
Stays up to date regarding potential and emerging information security threats, vulnerabilities, and control techniques and assist in the efforts to research, test, and recommend new technologies and products for implementation within the corporate computing network to mitigate threats/risks.
Develops formal training and awareness training and events to ensure that the user community understands evolving threats and adheres to necessary policy and procedures.
Works closely with business owners and IT staff to ensure adequate security solutions are in place for all IT systems and platforms to sufficiently mitigate identified risks and meet business objectives.
Interact daily with the user community to understand their security needs and provide assistance in remediation of security-related issues.
Develop and implement a certification process for new technologies or new versions of existing technologies.
Audit Business Continuity / Disaster Recovery operational procedures.
Conducts risk assessments and vulnerabilities assessments. Works with the business owners through completion of mitigation efforts. Generates risk, vulnerability and risk mitigation documentation.
Maintains awareness of latest security risks. Analyzes potential impact of new threats and exploits. Identifies operational gaps in existing controls. Communicates risks to relevant business units and implements risk mitigation improvements.
Engages with compliance staff to ensure compliance with all applicable rules, regulations, laws, and standards and that information technology operational procedures are in place to generate required logs / artifacts for compliance audits and provides support for compliance audits.
Conducts regular and ongoing audits of enterprise-wide compliance with information security and IT control standards and policies and document results. Assists in the resolution of audit findings through analysis, problem determination and development of cost-effective solutions.
Audit provisioning and use of administrative privileges.
Manages the security aspects of cloud service implementations and operations.
Participates in the development of incident response plans.
Participates in incident response, investigation, and recovery including those requiring the application of forensic practice. Produce activity, progress and management reports as required.
Operates and manages systems designed to detect malware and protect assets from malware.
Ensures that security systems remain up to date with respect to emerging exploits.
Writes and maintains technical documentation including security design documents, test plans, project plans, procedures, incident reports and troubleshooting guides.
Manages the use of external resources involved in the performance of security services, i.e., penetration tests, vulnerability scans, event monitoring, and other potential managed security services.
Serves as technical expert resource to Cyber Liability underwriting and claims personnel.
Provides an escalation path for operations and deployment staff to resolve security related issues.
Acts as escalation point for vendors to resolve security related issues.
Work hand in hand with Managed Detection & Response (MDR) partner to remediate any identified risks.
Sets standards for network access controls, account management, perimeter security devices, and website filtering systems and conducting ongoing security audits.
Sets standards for the security configuration of all inbound and outbound communications, remote access, VPN’s (B2B and Client) and conducting ongoing security audits.
Sets standards for the security configuration of LAN’s, WAN’s, and WLAN’s and ongoing security audits.
Executes periodic penetration tests.
Selects, installs, configures, operates, maintains and supports domain specific security incident and event monitoring solutions (IDS, IPS, Firewall, VPN, ISE, WAF, DLP, SIEM, Web Proxies, Vulnerability Scanners, etc.) and analysis of logs for the corporate IT environments.
Sets standards for early detection and fast reaction to unexpected “suspicious" situations (i.e., unusual traffic volume, port attacks, rogue devices in the network, etc.).
Participates in network design activities to ensure the creation and implementation of secure network connectivity solutions.
Creates governance processes for implementations and changes to authentication, authorization and encryption algorithms and key management.
Audits network security practices against internal policies and procedures and taking corrective measures as necessary.
Performs other duties as assigned.

Bachelor's degree in MIS, Computer Science, or related field with exposure to information security.
Minimum of five (5) years of Information Security experience.
Security or technology certifications strongly desired (e.g., CISSP, SANS, CCSP, SSCP, Microsoft).
Project management and/or business analysis experience highly desirable.

Knowledge/Skills/Experience:

Experience with Microsoft Windows Server Administration.
Experience with Microsoft SQL Server Administration.
Experience with Cisco Meraki technology stack.
Experience with File System Auditing Software.
Experience working with Intrusion Detection Systems.
Experience working with Two-factor authentication solutions.
Healthcare industry knowledge desired.
Well-developed oral and written communication skills.
The ability to work within the technology group with technical experts and with non-technical business process experts.
Ability to work with minimal supervision.
Ability to provide excellent customer service.
Ability to solve problems quickly and effectively.
Willingness to provide solutions that will exceed the needs of the business.
Ability and desire to learn about the company’s lines of business to better analyze significant problems and opportunities.
Effectively performs duties and responsibilities with accuracy, attention to detail, and support for organizational policies.

About the Role
The Sr. Staff SAP PP Analyst is a seasoned individual who will join the IT ERP team to support the ongoing SAP implementation project and other application areas specific to the Production Planning module (Also known as Forecast to Production). The ideal candidate is well versed in the SAP PP module with strong knowledge of manufacturing industry. They will be responsible for the solution designing, configuration, implementation, and delivery of functions relevant to the production planning module for the ongoing SAP implementation and future SAP enhancement projects.
What You will Do
Working with global teams to gather requirements and translate them to technical capabilities
Design, develop and deliver sustainable/scalable, global solutions to achieve defined business goals
Proactively communicate and collaborate with the business users to analyze the functional requirements and deliver the following artifacts as needed: (Functional requirements Use Cases, Use Interface Document)
Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously and capable of managing projects of various sizes and complexity.
Support users with SAP function troubleshooting and trainings
Act as the liaison between the business units, technology teams and support teams.
Lead/support active and upcoming Projects & System Enhancements and support issue resolution on production applications
Effort estimation, solution design and project delivery
Work independently and stay well versed with best practices in SAP, specifically in a manufacturing environment
What You Bring
BS in computer science, Information systems or related discipline
7+ years of experience with formal Business Analysis
8+ years SAP Functional experience, specializing in SAP PP module preferably in discrete manufacturing
Strong configuration capabilities in SAP Production Planning and experience in Variant Configuration
Demonstrated ability to design and configure SAP ECC PP Module with expert knowledge of discrete manufacturing industries including but not limited to MRP, Demand Management, shop floor activities, confirmation, BOMs, routings, serialization, and batch management
Good Overall understanding and experience in the SAP supply chain modules (PP, SD, MM, WM)
At least 8 years of experience in enhancing standard objects and developing custom objects in SAP ECC with at least two full life cycle implementations
Strong analytical skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and functional requirements.
Experience in working with Shop floor/Manufacturing execution systems
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, business users, executives, managers, and subject matter experts.
Knowledge of i2 planning system is preferred but not mandatory.

Job Title: Sr. Manager/Associate Director - Analytics Consulting (CPG, D-Com/Omni-Channel)
Job Description:
Tiger Analytics is an advanced analytics consulting firm. We are the trusted analytics partner for several Fortune 100 companies, enabling them to generate business value from data. Our consultants bring deep expertise in Data Science, Machine Learning, and AI. Various market research firms, including Forrester and Gartner, have recognized our business value and leadership. We are seeking someone with a good blend of business consulting skills and a data analytics background. If you are passionate about working on unstructured business problems that can be solved using data, we would like to talk to you.

Responsibilities

Work on the latest applications of data science to solve business problems in the Omni Channel, Direct to Consumer (DCOM) space.
Conduct solution and requirement workshops involving business and analytics stakeholders.
Leverage DCOM best practices to define and design advanced analytics solutions.
Participate in discussions with team members to select and apply relevant analytic techniques and create actionable business insights.
Ability to understand the business context by discussing existing data models with senior client leaders and deriving useful business insights.
Ability to break down a project into specific tasks involving business analysis, data science, and engineering.
Direct teams of business analysts to create data-driven solutions.
Architect data analytics frameworks and solutions to solve data-driven business problems.
Use Data Science, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, and Operational Research techniques to develop data models.
Report the results and insights using business intelligence tools.
Responsible for making presentations to senior management, communicating results to business teams, and developing plans to help operationalize analytic solutions.
Being able to communicate with and manage expectations across stakeholders effectively.

Requirements

8-12 years of professional work experience with at least 5 years in business data analytics in the Omni /DTC / DCOM space.
Prior experience working in the consumer goods / Retail/ Pet care industry.
Experience in leading E-commerce or marketing analytics programs.
Experience working with large data sets would be preferable (with an emphasis on business analysis problems).
Experience working with offshore teams.
Graduate in Business Analytics or MBA or equivalent work experience.
Ability to engage with executive/VP-level stakeholders from the client’s team to translate business problems into a high-level analytics solution approach.
Strong project management and team management skills and ability to work with global teams.
Knowledge of statistical and machine learning algorithms

Benefits

Significant career development opportunities exist as the company grows. The position offers a unique opportunity to be part of a small, fast-growing, challenging, and entrepreneurial environment, with a high degree of individual responsibility.
